Years of easy success had ossified the company's thinking and it never faced up to the challenge of the new technology.
多年來輕易取得的成功令這家公司變得思維僵化，從不積極應對新技術帶來的挑戰。

blocks.def: If body tissue ossifies, it becomes hard and changes into bone.
used to describe a person's face or skin if it has less colour than usual, for example when the person is or ill or frightened, or if it has less colour than people generally have
examples:
You're looking pale - are you feeling well?
你看起來臉色蒼白——你病了嗎？
 She has a naturally pale complexion and dark hair.
她天生膚色白皙，頭髮烏黑。

blocks.def: A pale light or colour is not bright or strong.
examples:
She wore a pale blue hat.
她戴著一頂淺藍色的帽子。
 pale winter sunlight
冬天慘澹的日光

blocks.def: If a person's face pales, it loses its usual colour.
examples:
His face paled and he looked as if he might faint.
他臉色變得蒼白，看起來像要暈倒一樣。

blocks.def: to make someone have strong feelings of shock or of disapproval
examples:
I was appalled at/by the lack of staff in the hospital.
醫院裡人手之少令我震驚。
 The state of the kitchen appalled her.
廚房的髒亂讓她目瞪口呆。

blocks.def: (of an amount of money) very small and of little or no value
examples:
Student grants these days are paltry.
如今的學生助學金少得可憐。
 The company offered Frazer a paltry sum, which he refused.
公司提議要給弗雷澤一筆微不足道的錢，他拒絕了。

blocks.def: of little quality or value
examples:
She made some paltry excuse and left.
她編了個蹩腳的藉口離開了。

blocks.def: so obvious that it can easily be seen or known, or (of a feeling) so strong that it seems as if it can be touched or physically felt
blocks.trans: 可感知的，易察覺的；觸摸得到的
examples:
a palpable effect
明顯的效果
 Her joy was palpable.
她的快樂全寫在臉上。

blocks.def: to make or get something or someone ready for something that will happen in the future
blocks.trans: 準備，預備；把…準備好，使預備好
examples:
Have you prepared for your interview?
你作好面試的準備了嗎？
 She'll prepare the food ahead of time and freeze it.
她會提前把食物準備好並冷凍起來。
 This course prepares students for middle and senior managerial positions.
這門課旨在使學生在將來能夠勝任中、高級管理職位。
 [ + obj + to infinitive  ] Are the players mentally and physically prepared to play a tough game?
選手們是否已經在心理和體能上對這場艱困比賽作好了準備？
 The meal took two hours to prepare.
準備這頓飯花了兩個小時。

blocks.def: to expect that something will happen and to be ready for it
blocks.trans: （在思想上或心理上）作好準備；防範
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] It almost seems as if she is preparing to die.
看來她好像已經作好了赴死的準備。
 You need to prepare yourself for a long wait.
你需要作好長時間等待的準備。

blocks.def: clothes of a particular type when they are being sold in a shop
blocks.trans: （商店出售的某一種類的）衣服，服裝
examples:
sports apparel
運動服裝

blocks.def: clothes
the spirit of a dead person appearing in a form that can be seen
to examine or look for the difference between two or more things
examples:
If you compare house prices in the two areas, it's quite amazing how different they are.
如果比較一下兩個地段的房價，你會驚訝地發現兩者差別竟如此之大。
 That seems expensive - have you compared prices in other shops?
那好像很貴——你有沒有比較一下其他店裡的價格？
 Compare some recent work with your older stuff and you'll see how much you've improved.
把你近來的作品與以前的對照一下，你就會知道你的進步有多大。
 This road is quite busy compared to/with ours.
與我們那條路相比，這條路很繁忙。
 Children seem to learn more interesting things compared to/with when we were at school.
與我們上學時相比，孩子現在學到的有趣東西似乎更多一些。

blocks.def: to judge, suggest, or consider that something is similar or of equal quality to something else
blocks.trans: 將…比作；拿…與…相比；認為…和…相似（或不相上下）
examples:
The poet compares his lover's tongue to a razor blade.
詩人把他戀人的舌頭比作剃鬚刀刀片。
 Still only 25, she has been compared to the greatest dancer of all time.
她才25歲就被譽為有史以來最偉大的舞蹈家。
 People compared her to Elizabeth Taylor.
人們把她比作伊莉莎白‧泰勒。
 You can't compare the two cities - they're totally different.
你不能把這兩座城市相提並論——它們完全不同。

blocks.def: If something or someone does not compare with something or someone else, the second thing is very much better than the first.
examples:
Instant coffee just doesn't compare with freshly ground coffee.
即溶咖啡根本比不上現磨的咖啡。

blocks.def: If something compares favourably with something else, it is better than it.
examples:
The hotel certainly compared favourably with the one we stayed in last year.
這家飯店當然比我們去年住的那家要好。

blocks.def: so good that everyone or everything else is of worse quality
blocks.trans: 無與倫比；無可比擬；舉世無雙
examples:
Her beauty is beyond compare.
她的美麗無與倫比。

blocks.def: to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not respect or value him, her, or it
examples:
The actor's work for charity has recently been disparaged in the press as an attempt to get publicity.
該演員爲慈善事業所做的工作近來被報紙說成是想出名。

blocks.def: different in every way
blocks.trans: 截然不同的，迥然相異的
examples:
The two cultures were so utterly disparate that she found it hard to adapt from one to the other.
這兩種文化截然不同，她發現很難由一種文化轉而去適應另一種文化。

blocks.def: equality, especially of pay or position
blocks.trans: （尤指薪水或職位的）同等，平等
examples:
Firefighters are demanding pay parity with police.
消防隊員要求收入與員警享有同等的工資待遇。

blocks.def: writing, music, art, speech, etc. that intentionally copies the style of someone famous or copies a particular situation, making the features or qualities of the original more noticeable in a way that is humorous
blocks.trans: 滑稽模仿作品（指文章、音樂、藝術品、講話等）
examples:
He was an 18th-century author who wrote parodies of other people's works.
他是一位18世紀的作家，專對他人的作品進行滑稽模仿。
 There is a hint of self-parody in his later paintings.
他後期的畫含有自嘲的意味。

blocks.def: something that so obviously fails to achieve the effect that was intended that it is stupid
examples:
"It was a parody of a trial," said one observer.
「這稱不上審判，只是在裝模作樣，」一位觀察者說。

blocks.def: to copy the style of someone or something in a humorous way
examples:
One of the papers is running a competition in which you have to parody a well-known author.
有一家報紙正在舉行一場競賽，在比賽中你必須滑稽地模仿一位著名作家的風格寫些東西。

blocks.def: a social event at which a group of people meet to talk, eat, drink, dance, etc., often in order to celebrate a special occasion
examples:
a birthday party
生日會
 a farewell party
歡送會
 a dinner party (= a small, sometimes formal party where a meal is eaten)
晚宴
UK a fancy-dress (US costume) party (= a party where people wear clothes that make them look like someone or something else)
（美國）化裝舞會
 Peter has/gives/throws really wild parties.
彼得舉辦的聚會很瘋狂。

blocks.def: an organization of people with particular political beliefs that competes in elections to try to win positions in local or national government
examples:
the Democratic Party
民主黨
 the Green party
綠黨
 the Conservative party
保守黨
 The party has/have just elected a new leader.
該黨剛選出了一名新領袖。
 He was elected as party leader in 2011.
他於2011年當選為該黨的領袖。
 They contacted party members from across the nation to ask for their support.
他們聯繫全國的黨員，請求他們支援。

blocks.def: a group of people who are involved in an activity together, especially a visit
blocks.trans: （共同參加活動，尤指參觀的）一批人，一組人
examples:
a party of tourists
一批遊客
 Most museums give a discount to school parties.
大多數博物館都對學校的參觀團體打折。

blocks.def: one of the people or groups of people involved in an official argument, arrangement, or similar situation
examples:
The UN called on all parties in the conflict to take a positive stance towards the new peace initiative.
聯合國呼籲衝突各方對新的和平倡議採取積極態度。
 It's often difficult to establish who the guilty party is following a traffic accident.
發生交通意外後常常很難確定誰是有錯的一方。

blocks.def: to enjoy yourself by drinking and dancing, especially at a party
blocks.trans: （尤指在聚會上）吃喝玩樂，狂歡
examples:
Let's party!
我們盡情玩吧！
 They partied till dawn.
他們一直玩到天亮。

blocks.def: a person or thing that has the same purpose as another one in a different place or organization
blocks.trans: （與不同地方或組織的人或物）作用相同者，相對應者
examples:
The prime minister is to meet his European counterparts to discuss the war against drugs.
首相將會見歐洲各國首腦就打擊毒品犯罪進行商討。

blocks.def: to communicate information to someone
examples:
to impart the bad news
告知壞消息
 I was rather quiet as I didn't feel I had much wisdom to impart on the subject.
我沒怎麼說話，因為我覺得自己在這個問題上談不出甚麼高見。

blocks.def: to give something a particular feeling, quality, or taste
examples:
Preservatives can impart colour and flavour to a product.
防腐劑能保持產品的色澤和味道。

blocks.def: not supporting any of the sides involved in an argument
examples:
impartial advice
客觀公正的建議
 A trial must be fair and impartial.
審判必須客觀公正。

blocks.def: not complete
examples:
The general has ordered a partial withdrawal of troops from the area.
將軍已下令部隊部分人員撤出該地區。

blocks.def: influenced by the fact that you personally prefer or approve of something, so that you do not judge fairly
blocks.trans: 偏向一方的，偏袒的，偏心的
examples:
The reporting in the papers is entirely partial and makes no attempt to be objective.
報紙上的報道毫不客觀，而且也沒打算保持客觀。

blocks.def: having a liking for something
examples:
I'm not partial to fish.
我並不特別愛吃魚。

blocks.def: an extremely small piece of dirt, especially one produced by road vehicles, that causes pollution
blocks.trans: （尤指汽車引擎排出的引起嚴重污染的）微粒，顆粒

blocks.def: strongly supporting a person, principle, or political party, often without considering or judging the matter very carefully
blocks.trans: （常指盲目）支持的，擁護的；偏袒的
examples:
The audience was very partisan, and refused to listen to her speech.
聽眾的觀念固執偏頗，拒絕聽她的演講。
 partisan politics
黨派政治

blocks.def: (in a country that has been defeated) a member of a secret armed force whose aim is to fight against an enemy that is controlling the country
blocks.trans: （淪陷區內的）遊擊隊員，武裝抗敵分子

blocks.def: someone who supports a person, principle, or political party
blocks.trans: 虔誠的信徒，熱烈的支持者；黨徒，黨羽

blocks.def: to do or be better than
examples:
His time for the 100 metres surpassed the previous world record by one hundredth of a second.
他以0.01秒的優勢打破了100米短跑的前世界紀錄。
 The book's success has surpassed everyone's expectations.
這本書獲得出乎所有人意料的成功。
 The director has really surpassed himself (= done better than he has done before) with this new film.
這位導演憑藉這部新電影實現了真正的自我超越。

blocks.def: a situation in which progress is impossible, especially because the people involved cannot agree
examples:
The dispute had reached an impasse, as neither side would compromise.
由於雙方都不肯讓步，爭端陷入僵局。

blocks.def: causing feelings of sadness, sympathy, or sometimes lack of respect, especially because a person or an animal is suffering
examples:
The refugees were a pathetic sight - starving, frightened and cold.
難民看起來實在可憐——飢寒交迫，擔心受怕。
 After the accident he became a pathetic figure, a shadow of his former self.
意外後他成了一個可憐人，與之前判若兩人。

blocks.def: unsuccessful or showing no ability, effort, or bravery, so that people feel no respect
examples:
a pathetic attempt/joke/excuse
不成功的嘗試／差勁的笑話／蹩腳的藉口
 Are you telling me you're frightened to speak to her? Don't be so pathetic!
你是說你不敢跟她說話嗎？別太窩囊了！

blocks.def: a feeling of strong dislike, opposition, or anger
examples:
Despite the deep antipathies between them, the two sides have managed to negotiate an agreement.
儘管雙方芥蒂很深，但還是設法通過談判達成了一項協議。
 Declarations of racial antipathy against ethnic minorities will not be tolerated.
公開聲明對於少數民族的仇視是不可容忍的。
 He is a private man with a deep antipathyto/towards the press.
他是個喜歡獨處的人，對新聞界非常反感。

blocks.def: showing no interest or energy and unwilling to take action, especially over something important
blocks.trans: 無興趣的；懈怠的；（尤指對重要事情）不關心的，無動於衷的
examples:
Young people today are so apathetic about politics.
現在的年輕人太不關心政治。
 Don't be so apathetic - how are you going to get a job if you don't even start looking?
別那麼吊兒郎當的，不開始找怎麼能找到工作？

blocks.def: able to exist, live together, or work successfully with something or someone else
blocks.trans: 可共存的；協調的；相容的
examples:
It was when we started living together that we found we just weren't compatible.
等到開始生活在一起時，才發現我們根本合不來。
 This software may not be compatible with older operating systems.
該軟體可能與較早期的作業系統不相容。
 Such policies are not compatible with democratic government.
此類政策與民主政體格格不入。
 Are their two blood groups compatible (= can blood from one person be given to the other person)?
他倆的血型相容嗎？

blocks.def: showing compassion
examples:
The public's response to the crisis appeal was generous and compassionate.
公眾對危難時刻的呼籲表現得慷慨大方、富有同情心。

blocks.def: able to think clearly or make good decisions because of not being influenced by emotions
examples:
In all the media hysteria, there was one journalist whose comments were clear-sighted and dispassionate.
當各種媒體都變得十分狂熱時，有一位記者的評論卻能灼見真知保持冷靜。

blocks.def: the ability to share someone else's feelings or experiences by imagining what it would be like to be in that person's situation
Impassioned speech or writing is full of strongly felt and strongly expressed emotion.
blocks.trans: （講話或文章）充滿激情的，熱烈的
examples:
Relatives of the dead made an impassioned plea for the bodies to be flown back to this country.
死者親屬強烈懇求將屍體空運回國。

blocks.def: If someone's face is impassive, it expresses no emotion, because the person seems not to be affected by the situation they are experiencing.
the quality or state of being passive
(of a person) unable to control part of their behaviour; unreasonable
blocks.trans: （行為）無法控制的，病態的，非理智的
examples:
I've got a pathological fear of heights.
我有懼高症。
 Anthony's a pathological liar.
安東尼說謊成性。

blocks.def: relating to or caused by a disease
blocks.trans: 病理的，病態的，由疾病引起的
examples:
a pathological condition/complaint
病情／病症

blocks.def: the power of a person, situation, piece of writing, or work of art to cause feelings of sadness, especially because people feel sympathy
blocks.trans: （境況、文章、藝術品或人的）感染力
examples:
There's a pathos in his performance which he never lets slide into sentimentality.
他的表演有一種感染力，而他從不讓這種感染力變成過分的感傷。

blocks.def: a person who loves their country and, if necessary, will fight for it
perfect, with no problems or bad parts
examples:
impeccable taste/manners/credentials
無可挑剔的品味／舉止／資歷
 His English is impeccable.
他的英語無懈可擊。

blocks.def: a small fault or mistake, or something that someone does wrong that is not very serious
examples:
a youthful peccadillo
年輕時犯的小錯誤
 He dismissed what had happened as a mere peccadillo.
他只把發生的事當作一個小過失而不予理會。

blocks.def: relating to money
examples:
pecuniary interest/loss/benefit
金錢方面的利益／損失／好處
 a pecuniary matter
涉及金錢的事

blocks.def: a small part of a machine or object that is pushed down with the foot to operate or move the machine or object
examples:
the brake/accelerator pedal
煞車／油門踏板
 This sewing machine is operated by a foot pedal.
這台縫紉機是用腳踏板來操作的。
 He stood up on the pedals of his bike to get extra power as he cycled up the hill.
他騎車上山時站在踏板上踩車以增加力量。

blocks.def: operated by a pedal or pedals
examples:
a pedal bike/boat/car
腳踏自行車／船／汽車
 She emptied the ashtray into the pedal bin.
她把煙灰缸裡的東西倒入腳踏式垃圾桶裡。

blocks.def: to push the pedals of a bicycle with your feet
examples:
He struggled to pedal his bicycle up the hill.
他吃力地騎著腳踏車上山。
 We were pedalling like mad (= very fast) against the wind, but didn't seem to be getting anywhere.
我們逆著風拚命地騎著車，但似乎沒有騎多遠。

blocks.def: helpful or useful in a particular situation, but sometimes not morally acceptable
blocks.trans: 權宜之計的；應急的；不得已而為之的
examples:
It might be expedient not to pay him until the work is finished.
要到工作完成才給他薪水，這或許也是逼不得已的。
 The management has taken a series of expedient measures to improve the company's financial situation.
管理階層採取了一系列應急措施來改善公司的財務狀況。

blocks.def: an action that is expedient
examples:
a political expedient
政治上的權宜之計

blocks.def: to make it more difficult for something to happen or more difficult for someone to do something
examples:
Although he's shy, it certainly hasn't impeded his career in any way.
儘管他很害羞，但這顯然一點也沒有妨礙他的事業。

blocks.def: a person who is walking, especially in an area where vehicles go
examples:
A few pedestrians sheltered from the rain in doorways.
幾個行人站在門口躲雨。
 The death rate for pedestrians hit by cars is unacceptably high.
行人遭遇車禍的死亡率高得令人無法接受。

blocks.def: not interesting; showing very little imagination
blocks.trans: 乏味的，單調的；缺乏想像力的
examples:
Her books, with few exceptions, are workmanlike but pedestrian.
除了寥寥幾本以外，她的書全都寫得精確細膩但缺乏想像力。
 His speech was long and pedestrian.
他的演講冗長乏味。

blocks.def: expressing disapproval, or suggesting that something is not good or is of no importance
examples:
Make sure students realize that "fat" is a pejorative word.
一定要讓學生明白 fat（肥胖）是貶損詞。
 It comes as quite a shock to still hear a judge describing a child as "illegitimate", with all the pejorative overtones of that word.
令人大為震驚的是，儘管「私生子」一詞帶有強烈的貶義，但現在仍能聽到法官稱某個孩子為私生子。

blocks.def: travelling around to different places, usually because you work in more than one place
blocks.trans: （通常指因工作而）巡迴的，流動的；漫遊的
examples:
a peripatetic music teacher
流動的音樂教師

blocks.def:
US spelling of 
paediatrics
giving too much attention to formal rules or small details
blocks.trans: 迂腐的，學究式的，書呆子氣的
examples:
They were being unnecessarily pedantic by insisting that Berry himself, and not his wife, should have made the announcement.
他們太拘泥於形式，堅持要求由貝利本人而不是他妻子來宣佈，這實在沒有必要。

blocks.def: to force someone to do something
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] As a schoolboy he was compelled to wear shorts even in winter.
在小學階段，即使在冬天他也被迫穿著短褲。
formal The new circumstances compelled a change in policy.
新情況迫使在政策上作出改變。

blocks.def: to produce a strong feeling or reaction
blocks.trans: （有時指並非所願地）激起，引發
examples:
Over the years her work has compelled universal admiration and trust.
這些年來，她的工作獲得了大家的一致欽佩和信賴。

blocks.def: If a reason, argument, etc. is compelling, it makes you believe it or accept it because it is so strong.
blocks.trans: （理由、論證等）令人信服的，很有說服力的
examples:
compelling evidence
強而有力的證據
 It's a fairly compelling argument for going.
去的理由很有說服力。

blocks.def: very exciting and interesting and making you want to watch or listen
blocks.trans: 引人入勝的；激動人心的；扣人心弦的
examples:
I found the whole film very compelling.
我覺得整部影片都很扣人心弦。
 a compelling story
扣人心弦的故事

blocks.def: to remove fears, doubts, and false ideas, usually by proving them wrong or unnecessary
blocks.trans: 消除（恐懼）；掃除（疑慮）；打消（錯誤念頭）
examples:
I'd like to start the speech by dispelling a few rumours that have been spreading recently.
我想在演講的開頭先澄清一些近期流傳的謠言。

blocks.def: to make someone feel that they must do something
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] She was in such a mess I felt impelled to (= felt I had to) offer your services.
她陷入了這麼一個爛攤子，我不得不提出讓你去幫幫她。
 I wonder what it is that impels him to exercise all the time.
我不知道是甚麼原因驅使他整天都在鍛煉身體。

blocks.def: to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force
examples:
a rocket propelled through space
在推力作用下穿越外太空的火箭
 The Kon-Tiki sailed across the Pacific Ocean propelled by wind power.
「太陽神康提基號」帆船借助風力橫渡了太平洋。

blocks.def: to cause someone to do an activity or be in a situation
blocks.trans: 推動（某人）做…／將（某人）推向（某一境地）
examples:
The film propelled him to international stardom.
這部電影使他成為了國際巨星。

blocks.def: a punishment, or the usual punishment, for doing something that is against a law
examples:
The law carries a penalty of up to three years in prison.
該法律允許判處長達三年的監禁。
 They asked for the maximum penalty for hoax calls to be increased to one year.
他們要求把對惡作劇電話的最高懲罰增至一年監禁。
 The protesters were told to clear the area around the building, on penalty of arrest (= or be arrested) if they did not.
抗議人士被告知離開大樓周圍的地區，否則將被捕。

blocks.def: a type of punishment, often involving paying money, that is given to you if you break an agreement or do not follow rules
examples:
Currently, ticket holders pay a penalty equal to 25 percent of the ticket price when they change their flight plans.
目前，持票人若改變航班，須支付相當於票價25%的罰金。
 There was a penalty clause which said you had to pay half the cost if you cancelled your booking.
有一則懲罰條款規定，若取消預訂則必須支付一半費用。

blocks.def: an advantage given in some sports to a team or player when the opposing team or player breaks a rule
blocks.trans: （體育運動中對犯規者的）判罰，處罰
examples:
The referee awarded (= gave) a penalty kick.
裁判給了一個罰球機會。
 Hysen handled the ball and conceded the penalty that gave Manchester United the lead.
海森控球犯規，給了曼聯隊一次罰球機會，使他們取得了領先。

blocks.def: a disadvantage brought about as a result of a situation or action
blocks.trans: （某情況或行動帶來的）不利，劣勢
examples:
Loss of privacy is one of the penalties of success.
失去個人隱私乃是功成名就的代價之一。
 She has paid a heavy penalty for speaking the truth.
她因說實話而付出了沉重的代價。

blocks.def: showing that you are sorry, especially in a formal religious way, for wrong things that you have done
examples:
It was the end of the penitential month of Ramadan.
齋月也是懺悔月到這裡就結束了。
 a penitential prayer
懺悔的禱告

blocks.def: to stop something from being active, either temporarily or permanently
examples:
The ferry service has been suspended for the day because of bad weather.
因為天氣惡劣，渡船已經停開。
 The country's president has suspended the constitution and assumed total power.
總統廢除憲法，獨攬大權。
 When you go to the theatre, you have to be willing to suspend disbelief (= to act as if you believe that what you are seeing is real or true, although you know that it is not).
去戲院看戲時，你得對劇情深信不疑。
 I'm suspending judgment (= not forming an opinion) on the book I'm reading until I've finished it.
在把書讀完之前，我不會對它作出任何評價。
 Mr Young was given a six-month jail sentence, suspended for two years (= if he commits another crime within two years, he will have to go to prison for six months for his original crime).
楊先生被判監禁六個月，緩刑兩年執行。

blocks.def: If someone is suspended from work, school, etc., they are temporarily not allowed to work, go to school, or take part in an activity because of having done something wrong.
blocks.trans: （因犯錯而）暫令停職；暫令停學；暫令停止參加活動
examples:
She was suspended from school for fighting.
她因為打架而被勒令停學。
 He was suspended for four games after arguing with the referee.
跟裁判發生爭執之後，他被禁賽四場。

blocks.def: to hang
examples:
The builders worked on wooden platforms, suspended by ropes from the roof of the building.
建築工人站在用繩子從房頂上吊下來的木製平臺上工作。
 It was very uncomfortable lying on the hospital bed with my legs suspended in the air.
我躺在醫院的病床上，腿懸吊在半空，難受極了。

blocks.def: If small pieces of solid material are suspended in a gas or a liquid, they hang or float in the gas or liquid.
examples:
The drug is suspended in a saline solution.
這種藥懸浮在生理鹽水中。
 A cloud of smoke was suspended in the air.
空中飄浮著一團煙霧。

blocks.def: used to refer to an event, usually something unpleasant or unwanted, that is going to happen soon
blocks.trans: （通常指不愉快或不受歡迎的事件）即將發生的，逼近的
examples:
impending disaster/doom
即將來臨的災難／劫數
 The player announced his impending retirement from international football.
這位球員宣佈他即將從國家隊退役。

blocks.def: a liking for, an enjoyment of, or a habit of doing something, especially something that other people might not like
examples:
a penchant for melodrama/skiing/exotic clothes
偏愛通俗劇／滑雪／奇裝異服
 Her penchant for disappearing for days at a time worries her family.
她喜歡不時失蹤幾天，這讓她的家人非常擔心。

blocks.def: about to happen or waiting to happen
blocks.trans: 即將發生的；待定的，待決的
examples:
There were whispers that a deal was pending.
有傳言說即將達成一筆交易。
 The pending releases of the prisoners are meant to create a climate for negotiation.
囚犯即將獲釋，目的是要營造一個有利談判的氛圍。

blocks.def: used to say that one thing must wait until another thing happens
examples:
The identity of the four people was not made public, pending (the) notification of relatives.
四名受害者的身分要等到家屬確認之後才能公開。
 Flights were suspended pending (an) investigation of the crash.
墜機事故正待調查，航班暫時取消。

blocks.def: thinking in a quiet way, often with a serious expression on your face
examples:
She became withdrawn and pensive, hardly speaking to anyone.
她變得孤僻憂鬱，幾乎不和任何人說話。

blocks.def: the use of money, time, or effort
examples:
Buying a bigger car has proved to be well worth the expense.
事實證明，買輛大一點的車還是值得的。
 We've just had a new garage built at great expense.
我們剛用了很多錢蓋一座新車庫。
 We went on holiday at my father's expense (= he paid for it).
我們去度了假，一切費用由我父親支付。
 It's silly to go to the expense of (= spend money on) buying new clothes when you don't really need them.
花錢去買你並不真正需要的新衣服是很傻的。

blocks.def: something that makes you spend money
blocks.trans: 花錢的東西（或緣由）；開銷
examples:
Our biggest expense this year was our summer holiday.
我們今年最大的開支就是暑期度假。
 We need to cut down on our expenses.
我們必須縮減開支。

blocks.def: money that you spend when you are doing your job, that your employer will pay back to you
blocks.trans: （向僱主報銷的）業務費用，開支，花銷
examples:
I need to get my expenses approved.
我要去辦核銷手續。
UK Don't worry about the cost of lunch - it's on expenses.
不要擔心午餐用多少錢——這是可以報銷的。

blocks.def: to give out things, especially products, services, or amounts of money
examples:
There is a vending machine on the platform that dispenses snacks.
月臺上有一個出售零食的自動售貨機。

blocks.def: to prepare and give out medicine
examples:
UK a dispensing chemist
藥劑師

blocks.def: more than you need and therefore not necessary; that can be got rid of
examples:
It seemed the soldiers were regarded as dispensable - their deaths just didn't matter.
那些士兵似乎被認爲是可有可無的——他們的死無關緊要。

blocks.def: a man, woman, or child
examples:
Who was the first person to swim the English Channel?
游過英吉利海峽的第一人是誰？
 A meal at the restaurant costs about $70 for two people.
在這個餐廳裡兩個人吃飯的費用大約為70美元。
formal Four persons have been charged with the murder.
四人被控犯有謀殺罪。

blocks.def: used when describing someone's character
blocks.trans: （用於描述人的某一品質）…的人
examples:
She's an extremely kind person.
她是個非常和藹的人。
 He's nice enough as a person, but he's not the right man for this job.
他是個很好的人，但不適合做這份工作。
informal I don't think of him as a book person (= a person who likes books).
我認為他不是個喜歡看書的人。

blocks.def: If you do something or go somewhere in person, you do it or go there yourself.
examples:
If you can't be there in person, the next best thing is watching it on TV.
如果你不能親自到場的話，在電視上觀看就是退而求其次的選擇了。

blocks.def: used in grammar to describe the verbs and pronouns that refer to the different people in a conversation. The first person ("I" or "we") refers to the person speaking, the second person ("you") refers to the person being spoken to and the third person ("he", "she", "it", or "they") refers to another person or thing being spoken about or described
blocks.trans: 人稱（第一人稱 I 或 we 指說話人，第二人稱 you 指聽話的人，第三人稱 he， she， it 或 they 指談到的人或事物）
examples:
The novel is written in the first person, so that the author and narrator seem to be the same.
小說是以第一人稱寫的，因此作者和敘述者好像是同一個人。
 "Am" is the first person singular of the verb "to be".
am 是動詞 to be 的第一人稱單數形式。

blocks.def: used to combine with nouns to form new nouns referring to the particular job or duty that someone has. It is often used instead of -man or -woman to avoid making an unnecessary statement about the sex of the particular person
blocks.trans: 從事（某項工作）的人（常用來代替以 -man 和 -woman 結尾的名詞，以避免不必要提及性別）
examples:
spokesperson
發言人
 chairperson
主席
 business people
商人

blocks.def: the act of giving a human quality or characteristic to something which is not human, or an example of this
blocks.trans: 擬人化，人格化；化身，象徵
examples:
Nemesis, in Greek mythology, is the personification of divine justice and the vengeance of the gods.
在希臘神話中，復仇女神是神聖正義和眾神復仇的象徵。
 In the scriptures, there is a very strong personification of wisdom as feminine.
在聖經中，智慧的化身常常是女性，這一點非常明顯。

blocks.def: to say or tell people something more than once
examples:
Would you mind repeating what you just said?
您能重複一遍剛才您講的話嗎？
 Please don't repeat what I've just told you to anyone else.
請不要把我剛才對你所說的話告訴任何人。
 [ + that ] She repeated that she had no intention of running for president.
她重申沒有競選總統的打算。

blocks.def: to happen, or to do something, more than once
examples:
The test must be repeated several times.
這個試驗一定要重複多做幾次。
 This is an offer never to be repeated.
如不接受這個報價，以後就再也沒有這樣的機會了。
 Johnny had to repeat a year/class at school.
莊尼不得不留級一年／留級。
 Some historians think that history repeats itself.
有些歷史學家認為歷史會重演。

blocks.def: to say the same thing again, or the same things again and again
blocks.trans: 重複說；翻來覆去地說同樣的事情
examples:
His speech was dreadful - he just kept repeating himself.
他的演講令人生厭——他只是翻來覆去地重複那一點內容。

blocks.def: a situation in which something happens or is done more than once
examples:
All this is a repeat/a repeat performance of what happened last year.
這完全是去年發生的事件的重演。

blocks.def: a television or radio programme that is broadcast again
examples:
There's nothing but repeats on television these days.
這些天電視淨重播以前的節目。

blocks.def: likely to do something suddenly, without considering the results of your actions
examples:
He's so impetuous - why can't he think things over before he rushes into them?
他太衝動了——為甚麼他急著做事前不能仔細考慮一下呢？

blocks.def: said or done suddenly, without considering the likely results
examples:
The governor may now be regretting her impetuous promise to reduce unemployment by half.
州長現在可能後悔她輕率地承諾要將失業人數減少一半。

blocks.def: something that encourages a particular activity or makes that activity more energetic or effective
examples:
The recent publicity surrounding homelessness has given (a) fresh impetus to the cause.
最近圍繞無家可歸者的宣傳對這項事業是一股新的推動力。

blocks.def: to cause something to continue
examples:
Increasing the supply of weapons will only perpetuate the violence and anarchy.
增加武器供應只會使暴力和混亂持續下去。
 The aim of the association is to perpetuate the skills of traditional furniture design.
該協會致力於促進傳統傢俱設計工藝的傳承延續。

blocks.def: easily annoyed and complaining in a rude way like a child
blocks.trans: 耍孩子脾氣的，任性的；脾氣暴躁的

blocks.def: likely to result in success, or showing signs of success
examples:
With the economy in recession, it was not a propitious time to start a company.
經濟正處於蕭條時期，這可不是開公司的好時候。

blocks.def: a spirit of a dead person believed by some to visit the living as a pale, almost transparent form of a person, animal, or other object
like a ghost
examples:
A phantom coach is said to pass through the grounds of this house when there's a full moon.
據說月圓時一輛幽靈馬車就會駛過這棟房子的庭院。
humorous The phantom wine-drinker has been around (= an unknown person has been drinking the wine)!
附近一定有嗜酒幽靈出沒！

blocks.def: used to describe something that you imagine exists or that appears to exist, although in fact it does not
examples:
Although she had to have her leg amputated, she still feels as though she's got a phantom limb.
儘管不得已把一條腿截去了，但她仍覺得自己彷彿有條虛幻的腿。
 They discovered it was a phantom organization set up for the processing of drug profits.
他們發現這只是一個遮人耳目、處理毒品利潤的組織。
UK Although she grew bigger, she later discovered it was a phantom (US false) pregnancy.
儘管她肚子越來越大，但後來卻發現自己是精神性假懷孕。

blocks.def: lasting for only a short time
blocks.trans: 短暫的，極短的；轉瞬即逝的
examples:
Fame in the world of rock and pop is largely ephemeral.
在搖滾和流行音樂界，名聲大多轉瞬即逝。

blocks.def: a word or phrase used to avoid saying an unpleasant or offensive word
examples:
"Senior citizen" is a euphemism for "old person".
「年長公民」是「老年人」的委婉說法。
 The article made so much use of euphemism that often its meaning was unclear.
這篇文章用了太多的委婉語，以至於意思常常不甚明瞭。

blocks.def: an extreme fear or dislike of a particular thing or situation, especially one that cannot be reasonably explained
blocks.trans: （尤指道理上無法解釋的）恐懼，懼怕
examples:
I've got a phobia about/of worms.
我很怕蠕蟲。

blocks.def: used to form words for types of anxiety disorder (= a mental illness that makes someone very worried and affects their life) that involve an extreme fear of something
examples:
People who suffer from agoraphobia may panic when they're in public places.
患有廣場恐懼症的人在公共場所時可能會感到恐慌。
 Podophobia is a fear of feet.
畏腳症是對腳的恐懼。

blocks.def: using special signs to represent the different sounds made by the voice in speech
examples:
Pronunciations are shown in this dictionary using the International Phonetic Alphabet.
這本詞典使用國際音標標注讀音。

blocks.def: A spelling system can be described as phonetic if you can understand how words are pronounced simply by looking at their spelling.
blocks.trans: （拼寫系統）表音的，與發音近似的，拼音的

blocks.def: an unpleasant mixture of loud sounds
examples:
What a cacophony!
多麼刺耳的聲音！
 As we entered the farmyard we were met with a cacophony of animal sounds.
我們一走進農家院，就聽到各種動物嘈雜的聲音。

blocks.def: not sincere or not real
examples:
All salespeople seem to have the same phoney smile.
所有推銷員的微笑似乎都一樣，假惺惺的。
 He gave the police a phoney address.
他給了員警一個假地址。

blocks.def: an expression, often found in literature, that describes a person or object by referring to something that is considered to have similar characteristics to that person or object
examples:
"The mind is an ocean" and "the city is a jungle" are both metaphors.
「思維是海洋」和「城市是叢林」都是隱喻。
 Metaphor and simile are the most commonly used figures of speech in everyday language.
隱喻和明喻是日常語言中最常用的修辭手法。

blocks.def: a short clever saying that is intended to express a general truth
examples:
Oscar Wilde was famous for such aphorisms as "Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes".
諸如「經驗者，乃所有人對其錯誤之雅稱」這類的警句使得奧斯卡•王爾德聞名於世。

blocks.def: extreme happiness, sometimes more than is reasonable in a particular situation
examples:
They were in a state of euphoria for days after they won the prize.
獲獎之後一連幾天他們都處於亢奮狀態。

blocks.def: the process by which a plant uses the energy from the light of the sun to produce its own food
reacting to light
examples:
a photosensitive lens/chemical/surface
感光鏡頭／化學物質／表面

neophyte.note: Neo- means new, and -phyte is from the Greek phuton, "plant" — like a baby plant, a neophyte is someone who is new to an activity.

blocks.def: someone who has recently become involved in an activity and is still learning about it
strong belief in a religion that is shown in the way someone lives
strongly believing in religion, and living in a way that shows this belief
examples:
She is a pious follower of the faith, never missing her prayers.
她是個虔誠的信徒，從來不耽誤禱告。

blocks.def: pretending to have sincere feelings
blocks.trans: 假虔誠的；偽善的；虛偽的
examples:
Quit the pious apologies - I know you don't really care.
別假惺惺地道歉了——我知道你並非真的在乎。

blocks.def: something that is unlikely to happen
blocks.trans: 不可能實現的希望，不切實際的希望

blocks.def: to represent or show something in a picture or story
examples:
Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century.
她的畫反映了上個世紀普通人的生活。
 In the book, he depicts his father as a tyrant.
在那本書裡，他把自己的父親描寫成了一個暴君。
 [ + -ing verb ] People were shocked by the advertisement which depicted a woman beating her husband.
人們對那個女人毆打丈夫的廣告感到非常震驚。

blocks.def: (especially of a place) attractive in appearance, especially in an old-fashioned way
blocks.trans: （尤指某地）美麗的，古色古香的
examples:
the picturesque narrow streets of the old city
古城裡如畫的狹窄街道

blocks.def: feeling so satisfied with your own abilities or situation that you feel you do not need to try any harder
examples:
a complacent smile/attitude
自鳴得意的微笑／態度
 We can't afford to become complacent about any of our products.
我們不能對自己的任何一款產品沾沾自喜。

blocks.def: used to describe (someone who has) strong opinions or feelings that are impossible to change
blocks.trans: 不饒人的；堅定的；無法改變的
examples:
an implacable enemy
死敵
 implacable hostility
無法化解的敵意

blocks.def: to stop someone from feeling angry
examples:
Outraged minority groups will not be placated by promises of future improvements.
許諾今後進行改善無法安撫憤怒的少數民族團體。

blocks.def: a substance given to someone who is told that it is a particular medicine, either to make that person feel as if they are getting better or to compare the effect of the particular medicine when given to others
examples:
She was only given a placebo, but she claimed she got better - that's the placebo effect.
她只是服用了安慰劑，但她說好一些了——這就是「寬心藥效」。

blocks.def: something that is given to try to satisfy a person who has not been given the thing they really want
examples:
These small concessions have been made as a placebo to stop the workers making further demands.
這些小讓步就像安慰劑一樣，可以避免工人提出更多的要求。

blocks.def: having a calm appearance or characteristics
examples:
a slow-moving and placid river
平緩寧靜的河流
 the placid pace of village life
鄉村悠然的生活節奏
 She was a very placid (= calm and not easily excited) child who slept all night and hardly ever cried.
她是個非常安靜的孩子，整個晚上都在睡覺，極少哭泣。

blocks.def: a remark or statement that may be true but is boring and has no meaning because it has been said so many times before
examples:
He doesn't mouth platitudes about it not mattering who scores as long as the team wins.
他不會說這樣老掉牙的話；只要球隊贏了，誰進球都不重要。

transplant.pos: verb [ I or T,  usually + adv/prep ]

blocks.def: to move something, or to be moved, from one place or person to another
examples:
The plants should be grown indoors until spring, when they can be transplanted outside.
這些植物應該先種在室內，到了春天就可以移栽到外面。

blocks.def: a medical operation in which a new organ is put into someone's body
examples:
a liver/kidney transplant
肝臟／腎臟移植
 transplant surgery
移植手術
 He had a heart transplant (= doctors gave him a different, healthier heart instead of his old one).
他接受過心臟移植。

blocks.def: something, especially a new organ, that has been transplanted
examples:
His body accepted/rejected the transplant.
他的身體對移植器官沒有出現／出現了排斥反應。

blocks.def: to replace
examples:
Printed books will soon be supplanted by e-books.
紙質書將很快被電子書取代。
 Small children can often feel supplanted in their parents' affections (= that their parents no longer like them as much) when a new brother or sister is born.
當弟弟或妹妹出生後，小孩子常常會覺得自己在父母心中的地位被取代了。

blocks.def: to show enjoyment or approval of something such as a performance or speech by clapping the hands repeatedly to make a noise
examples:
You should have heard the audience applaud - the noise was fantastic.
你真應該聽聽觀眾的掌聲——那才叫掌聲雷動。
 She was applauded for a full five minutes after her speech.
她演講結束後，掌聲持續了整整五分鐘。

blocks.def: to say that you admire and agree with a person's action or decision
examples:
We applaud the family's decision to remain silent over the issue.
我們非常讚賞這一家人對此事保持沉默的決定。

blocks.def: difficult to believe, or unlikely
examples:
The whole plot of the film is ridiculously implausible.
影片的整個情節荒謬得令人難以置信。

blocks.def: expressing praise
seeming likely to be true, or able to be believed
examples:
a plausible explanation/excuse
貌似有理的解釋／藉口

blocks.def: A plausible person appears to be honest and telling the truth, even if they are not.
blocks.trans: 花言巧語的，舌燦蓮花的
examples:
a plausible salesman
能說會道的推銷員

blocks.def: (the state of having) enough or more than enough, or a large amount
examples:
"Would you like some more wine?" "No thanks, I've had plenty."
「還想要點酒嗎？」「不，謝謝，已經足夠了。」
 Don't grab at the balloons, children - there are plenty for everyone.
孩子們，別搶氣球——還有很多，每人都有。
 We've got plenty of time before we need to leave for the airport.
去機場前我們有的是時間。
 They've always had plenty of money.
他們總是有很多錢。
 There's plenty to do here.
這裡有很多事要做。
US informal This car cost me plenty (= a lot of money).
這輛車花了我很多錢。
 There's plenty more beer in the fridge.
冰箱裡還有很多啤酒。

blocks.def: the situation when there is more than enough of something
examples:
They have a plenitude of vacancies for drivers.
他們有大量的司機職位空缺。

blocks.def: to make whole or perfect
examples:
Complete the sentence with one of the adjectives provided.
從所給形容詞中選擇一個使句子變得完整。
 He only needs two more cards to complete the set.
他只需再有兩張牌就湊成一副了。
 All she needed to complete her happiness was a baby.
只需再有個孩子她的生活就幸福美滿了。

blocks.def: to write all the details asked for on a form or other document
examples:
Have you completed your application form yet?
你的申請表填好了嗎？

blocks.def: to finish doing something
examples:
He's just completed filming his 17th feature film.
他剛剛完成他第17部故事片的拍攝工作。
 The palace took over 20 years to complete.
這座宮殿耗時20多年才竣工。
 She will complete her studies in France.
她將在法國完成學業。

blocks.def: very great or to the largest degree possible
examples:
The man's a complete fool!
這個人是個十足的傻瓜！
 I need a break, a complete change of scene.
我需要休息一下，徹底換換環境。
 I made a complete and utter mess of it!
我把它徹底弄糟了！

blocks.def: with all the parts
examples:
the complete works of Oscar Wilde
奧斯卡‧王爾德全集
 The report comes complete with (= including) diagrams and colour photographs.
報告中有圖表和彩色圖片，非常齊全。
 Sun, sand, and romance - her holiday was complete.
陽光、沙灘加上浪漫的愛情——她的假期完美無缺。

blocks.def: useful or attractive together
examples:
complementary colours/flavours/skills
互補色／風味／技能
 My family and my job both play an important part in my life, fulfilling separate but complementary needs.
家庭和工作都是我生活中重要的組成部分，兩者互為補充，滿足我不同的需要。

blocks.def: to reduce something in size or amount, especially supplies of energy, money, etc.
blocks.trans: 消耗；耗費（資源、金錢、精力等）
examples:
If we continue to deplete the earth's natural resources, we will cause serious damage to the environment.
如果我們繼續消耗地球上的自然資源，將對環境造成嚴重的破壞。
 The illness depletes the body of important vitamins.
這種疾病會消耗人體中重要的維他命。
humorous That last holiday seriously depleted my bank account!
上次度假花掉了我銀行帳戶裡的一大筆錢！

blocks.def: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with
examples:
There's a plethora of books about the royal family.
有關皇室的書非常多。
 The plethora of regulations is both contradictory and confusing.
過多的規章制度既相互矛盾又令人困惑。

blocks.def: full, especially with food
blocks.trans: 充滿的，裝滿的；（尤指）飽食的
examples:
After two helpings of dessert, Sergio was at last replete.
吃了兩份甜品，塞爾吉奧終於飽了。

blocks.def: well supplied
examples:
This car has an engine replete with the latest technology.
這輛車的引擎應用了最新技術。

blocks.def: to make or do something again in exactly the same way
examples:
Researchers tried many times to replicate the original experiment.
研究者們作了很多次努力，試圖重複這一實驗。

blocks.def: If organisms and genetic or other structures replicate, they make exact copies of themselves.
examples:
Chromosomes replicate before cells divide and multiply.
染色體自我複製後，細胞便開始分裂、繁殖。
 Computer viruses replicate themselves and are passed along from user to user.
電腦病毒自我複製並從一個用戶的電腦傳到另一個用戶的電腦上。

blocks.def: to make an exact copy of something
examples:
The documents had been duplicated.
這些文件已經被複印過了。
 Parenthood is an experience nothing else can duplicate.
當父母是任何其他經歷都無法比擬的。

blocks.def: being an exact copy of something
examples:
The thieves were equipped with duplicate keys to the safe.
竊賊帶著配好的保險櫃鎖匙。

blocks.def: something that is an exact copy of something else
examples:
I lost the original form so they sent me a duplicate.
我把表格的原件給丟了，所以他們又寄給了我一份副本。

blocks.def: If a form is in duplicate, an exact copy has been made of it.
examples:
The application has to be completed in duplicate.
申請表格必須填寫一式兩份。

blocks.def: involving duplicity
examples:
a duplicitous traitor/spy/politician
雙面叛徒／間諜／政客

blocks.def: able to be explained
blocks.trans: 可解釋的；可說明的；可理解的
examples:
Under the circumstances, what happened was quite explicable .
在那種情形下，所發生的事情是完全可以理解的。

blocks.def: clear and exact
blocks.trans: 清楚明白的；明確的；不含糊的
examples:
I gave her very explicit directions how to get here.
我明確地告訴她這裡怎麼走。
 She was very explicit about (= said very clearly and exactly) what she thought was wrong with the plans.
她明確地指出了計劃中她認為有誤的地方。
 I wasn't aware that I would be paying - you certainly didn't make it explicit (= state it clearly).
我不知道要付錢——很明顯是因為你沒說清楚。

blocks.def: showing or talking about sex or violence in a very detailed way
blocks.trans: （描繪性或暴力）赤裸裸的，露骨的
examples:
a sexually explicit movie
有露骨性愛場面的電影

blocks.def: unable to be explained or understood
examples:
For some inexplicable reason, he's decided to cancel the project.
由於某種無法解釋的原因，他決定取消這個專案。

blocks.def: to search and discover (about something)
examples:
to explore space
探索太空
 The best way to explore the countryside is on foot.
探索農村地區，步行是最好的方法了。
 The children have gone exploring in the woods.
孩子們去樹林裡觀察大自然了。

blocks.def: to think or talk about something in order to find out more about it
examples:
Let's explore this issue/idea more fully.
讓我們進一步探討一下這個問題／計劃。

blocks.def: very bad
blocks.trans: 非常糟糕的，極其惡劣的
examples:
I thought his behaviour was absolutely deplorable.
我認為他的行為極其惡劣。
 They are forced to live in deplorable conditions.
他們被迫在極其惡劣的條件下生活。

blocks.def: to guess or think about what might happen using information that is already known
examples:
You can't really extrapolate a trend from such a small sample.
你不能單憑這樣一件小小的樣品就推斷出潮流的真正發展趨勢。

blocks.def: the activities of the government, members of law-making organizations, or people who try to influence the way a country is governed
examples:
Joe is very active in left-wing politics.
喬在左翼政治中很活躍。

blocks.def: the job of holding a position of power in the government
examples:
The group is campaigning to get more women into politics.
該組織正發起運動以使更多女性有機會從政。
 He is planning to retire from politics next year.
他打算明年退出政壇。

blocks.def: the study of the ways in which a country is governed
examples:
She studied politics at Leicester University.
她曾在萊斯特大學攻讀政治學。

blocks.def: someone's opinions about how a country should be governed
blocks.trans: （某人的）政治見解，（某人的）政治觀點
examples:
Her politics have become more liberal over the past few years.
在過去的幾年中，她在政治上變得更加傾向於自由主義。

blocks.def: the relationships within a group or organization that allow particular people to have power over others
blocks.trans: （團體或組織內的）爭權奪勢，權術，勾心鬥角
examples:
I don't like to get involved in office politics.
我不想捲入辦公室的爭權奪利。

blocks.def: If words or actions are impolitic, they are unwise and likely to cause offence or problems, especially in social situations.
blocks.trans: 失策的；不當的；不審慎的
examples:
I thought it impolitic to ask any questions about her ex-husband.
我覺得問她有關她前夫的任何問題都是不當的。

blocks.def: wise and showing the ability to make the right decisions
examples:
It would not be politic for you to be seen there.
你被人看見在那裡是不妥的。

blocks.def: too serious and full of importance
blocks.trans: 妄自尊大的，自以為是的
examples: A pompous person is arrogant or conceited. He'll walk into a party with an inflated ego, ready to tell anyone who will listen that "I'm kind of a big deal."

blocks.def: to think carefully about something, especially for a noticeable length of time
examples:
She sat back for a minute to ponder her next move in the game.
她在椅背上靠了一會兒，思考下一步棋該怎麼走。

blocks.def: slow and awkward because of being very heavy or large
blocks.trans: （因重或大而）行動遲緩的，笨拙的
examples:
He had a slow and ponderous manner.
他的舉止緩慢笨拙。

blocks.def: If a book, speech, or style of writing or speaking is ponderous, it is boring because it is too slow, long, or serious.
blocks.trans: （書、講話或寫作風格）嚴肅而乏味的，呆板的，生硬的
examples:
The ponderous reporting style makes the evening news dull viewing.
沉悶的播音風格使晚間新聞看起來很乏味。

blocks.def: to buy or bring in products from another country
examples:
We import a large number of cars from Japan.
我們從日本進口大量的汽車。

blocks.def: to introduce new goods, customs, or ideas to one country from another
examples:
Jazz is an American modification of musical conventions imported from Europe.
爵士樂是一種從歐洲引進在美國進行了改造的音樂形式。
 the spelling of imported words
引進詞語的拼寫

blocks.def: to copy information from one computer or computer program to another
examples:
I need to import data from the database into this spreadsheet.
我需要將資料從資料庫導入到我的文字處理器中。
 imported files
導入的文件

blocks.def: goods bought by one country from another
examples:
restrictions on foreign imports
對外國進口商品的限制

blocks.def: the action of bringing goods or fashions into a country
examples:
the illegal importation of drugs
非法的毒品輸入
 an import licence
進口許可證
 import duties
進口稅

blocks.def: importance or meaning
examples:
Whether it is to be a "working" visit or an "official" visit is of little/no import.
是「工作訪問」還是「正式訪問」，這並不重要。

blocks.def: happening at a time that is likely to produce success or is convenient
examples:
This seems to be an opportune moment for reviving our development plan.
看來這將是恢復我們發展計劃的大好時機。
 Would it be opportune to discuss the contract now?
現在討論這項合約合適嗎？

blocks.def: using a situation to get power or an advantage
examples:
He made an opportunistic grab for power, which resulted in a civil war.
他抓住一個機會奪了權，導致了內戰爆發。
 At half-time, United were leading with two opportunistic goals by Black.
上半場結束時，聯隊因布萊克打進兩個機會球而領先。

blocks.def: to pretend to be or to do something, especially in a way that is not easy to believe
examples:
They purport to represent the wishes of the majority of parents at the school.
他們聲稱自己代表了該校大多數學生家長的期望。
 The study purports to show an increase in the incidence of the disease.
該研究據稱顯示出這種疾病的發病率在上升。
 The tape recording purports to be of a conversation between the princess and a secret admirer.
這盒錄音帶據稱是王妃和她的一個秘密愛慕者之間的談話。

blocks.def: the general meaning of someone's words or actions
examples:
I didn't read it all but I think the purport of the letter was that he will not be returning for at least a year.
我沒有把信讀完，但我想這封信的大意是說他至少一年不回來。

blocks.def: the way in which someone usually holds their shoulders, neck, and back, or a particular position in which someone stands, sits, etc.
examples:
She's got very good/bad posture.
她儀態優美／極不優美。
 He always adopts/assumes (= moves into) the same posture for the cameras.
他在鏡頭前總是擺出同樣的姿勢。

blocks.def: a way in which a government or other organization thinks about and/or deals with a particular matter
examples:
For the third time this week the opposition has attacked the government's posture on defence.
本週反對派已是第三次攻擊政府的國防政策了。
 The tone of the feminist speakers suggested they were adopting a somewhat defensive posture.
女權主義發言人的口氣顯示她們的戒心相當重。

blocks.def: suitable and right for the occasion
examples:
an apposite phrase/quotation/remark
恰當的說法／引語／話
 The film starts in a graveyard, an apposite image for the decaying society which is the theme of the film.
這部電影以墳地的場景開場，這個恰如其分的意象揭示了電影的主題——一個走向衰亡的社會。

imposing.note:
not related to impose.
To impose means to force or inflict something on someone else. If you want to impose your musical taste on your parents, play your tunes all day at top volume.

blocks.def: having an appearance that looks important or causes admiration
blocks.trans: 壯觀的，宏偉的；氣宇不凡的
examples:
an imposing mansion
雄偉壯觀的大廈
 He was an imposing figure on stage.
他在舞臺上氣度不凡。

blocks.def: a person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others
examples:
He felt like an impostor among all those intelligent people, as if he had no right to be there.
他感覺自己在所有那些聰明人中間像個冒牌貨——好像自己無權留在那裡。

blocks.def: to put things that are not similar next to each other
blocks.trans: 把（不同的事物）並置，把…並列
examples:
The exhibition juxtaposes Picasso's early drawings with some of his later works.
展覽同時展出了畢卡索早期的畫作和他的一些晚期作品。

blocks.def: to suggest something as a basic fact or principle from which a further idea is formed or developed
examples:
[ + that ] If we posit that wage rises cause inflation, it follows that we should try to minimize them.
如果我們假設工資上漲會導致通貨膨脹的話，那麼我們應該盡可能地減小工資上漲的幅度。

blocks.def: the state of being likely to behave in a particular way or to suffer from a particular disease
blocks.trans: 傾向；稟性；（易患某種疾病的）體質
examples:
She has an annoying predisposition to find fault.
她有愛挑毛病這一令人討厭的習性。
 There is evidence that a predisposition to(wards) asthma runs in families.
有證據顯示易患哮喘是家族遺傳的。

blocks.def: a place where things are stored and can be found
a person who has, or a book that contains, a lot of information or detailed knowledge
blocks.trans: 智囊；知識淵博的人；知識寶典
examples:
She's a repository of knowledge about our family history.
她對我們的家族史瞭若指掌。

blocks.def: possible when the necessary conditions exist
examples:
A number of potential buyers have expressed interest in the company.
一些潛在的買主表達了對該公司的興趣。
 Many potential customers are waiting for a fall in prices before buying.
很多潛在的顧客都在等著降價再購買。
 The accident is a grim reminder of the potential dangers involved in North Sea oil production.
該意外殘酷地提醒人們生產北海石油可能會出現的危險。

blocks.def: someone's or something's ability to develop, achieve, or succeed
examples:
The region has enormous potential for economic development.
該地區經濟發展潛力無窮。
 I don't feel I'm achieving my full potential in my present job.
我覺得目前的工作沒有完全發揮我的潛力。
 [ + to infinitive ] You have the potential to reach the top of your profession.
你有潛力達到事業的頂峰。
 I think this room has got a lot of potential (= could be very nice if some changes were made to it).
我覺得這個房間有很多改善空間。

blocks.def: the amount of electricity passing through an electric circuit, measured in volts
blocks.trans: 電勢（電路中通過的電量，以伏特為單位）

blocks.def: having unlimited power over other people, and often using it unfairly and cruelly
examples:
a despotic government/regime
專制政府/政權
 A handful of corrupt and despotic leaders make the decisions.
决策者是少数腐败专制的领导人。

blocks.def: having unlimited power and able to do anything
blocks.trans: 全能的，萬能的，無所不能的
examples:
How can a loving, omnipotent God permit disease, war and suffering?
慈愛、萬能的主怎會允許疾病、戰爭和苦難的存在？

blocks.def: very powerful, forceful, or effective
blocks.trans: 強有力的，強大的；有效力的
examples:
Surprise remains the terrorists' most potent weapon.
突襲仍是恐怖分子最強有力的武器。
 The Berlin Wall was a potent symbol of the Cold War.
柏林圍牆是冷戰的有力象徵。
 This is a very potent drug and can have unpleasant side-effects.
該藥效力很強，副作用也不小。

blocks.def: to make someone depraved
to not approve of something or say that you do not approve of something
examples:
We deprecate this use of company funds for political purposes.
我們反對這種將公司資金用於政治目的的做法。

blocks.def: to say that you think something is of little value or importance
examples:
He always deprecates my achievements.
他總是貶低我的成就。

blocks.def: in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly
blocks.trans: 危險的；不牢靠的，不穩的
examples:
The lorry was lodged in a very precarious way, with its front wheels hanging over the cliff.
卡車的位置很危險，前輪懸在峭壁上面。

blocks.def: A precarious situation is likely to get worse.
blocks.trans: （情勢）不穩定的，不確定的，危險的
examples:
Many borrowers now find themselves caught in a precarious financial position.
許多借款人現在發現自己陷入不穩定的財務狀況。

comprehend.pos: verb [ I or T,  not continuous ]

blocks.def: to understand something completely
examples:
I fail to comprehend their attitude.
我無法理解他們的態度。
 He doesn't seem to comprehend the scale of the problem
他似乎沒意識到問題的嚴重性。
 [ + question word ] I'll never comprehend why she did what she did.
我永遠也不會明白她為甚麼那麼做。
 [ + that ] I don't think he fully comprehends that she won't be here to help him.
我看他還沒有充分意識到她是不會來這裡幫他的。

blocks.def: to catch and arrest someone who has not obeyed the law
examples:
The police have finally apprehended the killer.
警方終於抓住了兇手。

blocks.def: to understand something
complete and including everything that is necessary
blocks.trans: 全面的；綜合的；包羅萬象的；詳盡的
examples:
We offer you a comprehensive training in all aspects of the business.
我們向你提供這個行業各方面的綜合培訓。
 Is this list comprehensive or are there some names missing?
這份名單是完整的還是遺漏了一些名字？
 He has written a fully comprehensive guide to Rome.
他寫了一本內容詳盡的羅馬旅遊指南。

blocks.def: a failure to understand something, or an understanding or belief about something that is not correct
examples:
[ + that ] Most industrialists labour under a misapprehension (= wrongly believe) that unrestrained economic growth can be achieved without damaging the environment.
大多數工業家都誤以為不破壞環境也可以實現無限制的經濟增長。

blocks.def: If an object or achievement is impressive, you admire or respect it, usually because it is special, important, or very large.
blocks.trans: （因特殊、重要或巨大而）給人留下深刻印象的
examples:
That was an impressive performance from such a young tennis player.
這麼年輕的網球選手居然打得那麼好。
 an impressive collection of modern paintings
令人讚歎的現代繪畫收藏品
 There are some very impressive buildings in the town.
鎮上有一些非常雄偉的建築物。

blocks.def: If someone is impressive, you admire or respect that person for their special skills or abilities.
blocks.trans: （因具備特殊技能）令人欽佩的
examples:
She's a very impressive public speaker.
她是個不同凡響的演說家。

blocks.def: urgent or needing to be dealt with immediately
examples:
a pressing need for housing
對住房的迫切需求
 a pressing issue
緊迫的問題
 The most pressing question is what do we do next?
最迫切的問題是接下來我們要做甚麼？

blocks.def: a large number of CDs, records, etc. produced at one time
blocks.trans: 同批次的模壓雷射唱片

blocks.def: to not allow something, especially feelings, to be expressed
blocks.trans: 壓抑，壓制，克制（尤指感情）
examples:
He repressed a sudden desire to cry.
他突然想哭，但他控制住了自己。

blocks.def: to control what people do, especially by using force
to end something by force
examples:
The Hungarian uprising in 1956 was suppressed by the Soviet Union.
1956年匈牙利起義受到蘇聯武力鎮壓。

blocks.def: to prevent something from being seen or expressed or from operating
examples:
She couldn't suppress her anger/annoyance/delight.
她無法抑制內心的憤怒／氣惱／喜悅。
 His feelings of resentment have been suppressed for years.
他的怨恨之情已經壓抑多年。
 The British government tried to suppress the book because of the information it contained about the security services.
因為這本書的內容涉及情報安全部門的資料，所以英國政府試圖查禁它。
 The virus suppresses the body's immune system.
這種病毒會抑制人體的免疫系統。

blocks.def: not impressed (= made to feel admiration or respect)
blocks.trans: 印象平平的，無深刻印象的
examples:
They looked at the house, but they seemed unimpressed (by it).
他們把房子看了一遍，但似乎感覺一般。

blocks.def: more important than anything else; main
examples:
The Red Cross's primary concern is to preserve and protect human life.
紅十字會最關心的是維護人的生命安全。
 The primary responsibility lies with those who break the law.
主要的責任在於那些違法者。

blocks.def: of or for the teaching of young children, especially those between five and eleven years old
examples:
primary education
初等教育
 a primary school
小學

blocks.def: happening first
examples:
the primary stages of development
發展的最初階段

blocks.def: in the US, an election in which people choose who will represent a particular party in an election for political office
blocks.trans: （美國推舉黨內候選人的）初選

blocks.def: a primary in which only voters who are members of a political party can vote for the candidates from that party in order to choose who will represent the party in a later election
blocks.trans: 封閉式初選（只有該黨成員可以進行投票選出代表本黨的候選人的投票方式）

blocks.def: a primary in which everyone who is allowed to vote can choose either party's ballot (= list of candidates) in order to vote for a candidate to represent that party at a later election
blocks.trans: 開放式初選（任何人都可以進行投票選出代表某黨的候選人的投票方式）
examples:
In an open primary, Democrats still usually choose a ballot listing the Democratic candidates rather than the Republican ones
在開放式初選中，民主黨人通常仍然選擇列有本黨候選人而非共和黨候選人的選票。

blocks.def: relating to the time when human life on earth began
examples:
The universe evolved from a densely packed primal inferno.
宇宙是從原始的熾熱混沌狀態演變而來的。

blocks.def: basic and relating to an early stage of development
examples:
a primal urge to connect with nature
與自然相通的原始衝動
 primal fears
本能的恐懼

blocks.def: the state of being the most important thing
examples:
The government insists on the primacy of citizens' rights.
政府堅持把公民權利放在首位。

blocks.def: relating to human society at a very early stage of development, with people living in a simple way without machines or a writing system
examples:
Primitive races colonized these islands 2,000 years ago.
原始種族2000年前開拓了這些島嶼。
 primitive man
原始人
 The spiny anteater is a mammal, although a very primitive one.
針鼴屬於哺乳動物，儘管是非常原始的一種。

blocks.def: Primitive living conditions are basic, unpleasant, and uncomfortable.
examples:
Early settlers had to cope with very primitive living conditions.
早期殖民者不得不克服非常原始的生存條件。

blocks.def: something that is very important and must be dealt with before other things
examples:
The management did not seem to consider office safety to be a priority.
管理部門似乎並不認為應該優先考慮辦公室安全問題。
 My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.
我首先要考慮的是找個地方住。
 You have to learn to get your priorities right/straight (= decide which are the most important jobs or problems and deal with them first).
你必須學會先處理最重要的事。
 Repairing the plumbing is a priority task (= more important than other jobs).
修好水管是當務之急。
 Banks normally give priority to large businesses when deciding on loans (= they deal with them first because they consider them most important).
銀行在發放貸款時通常優先考慮大企業。
 Official business requirements obviously take/have priority over personal requests (= official business matters will be dealt with first).
公事顯然應該置於私事之前。

blocks.def: new or almost new, and in very good condition
examples:
pristine new offices
嶄新的辦公室
 Washing machine for sale - only two months old and in pristine condition.
出售洗衣機——只用了兩個月，完好如新。

blocks.def: to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone
examples:
He claimed that he had been deprived of his freedom/rights.
他聲稱本身自由／權利被剝奪。
 You can't function properly when you're deprived of sleep.
如果被剝奪了睡眠，人體就無法正常運作。

blocks.def: to be told information that is not told to many people
examples:
I was never privy to conversations between top management.
高層管理者之間的對話我從不知情。

blocks.def: a toilet, especially in a very small building in the garden of a house
to show a particular result after a period of time
examples:
The operation proved a complete success.
這場手術結果是大成功。
 The dispute over the song rights proved impossible to resolve.
結果是，有關歌曲版權的爭論根本無法解決。
 [ L (+ to be) ] The new treatment has proved to be a disaster.
這種新療法的結果是一場災難。

blocks.def: to show that you are good at something
examples:
I wish he'd stop trying to prove himself all the time.
但願他別再不停試圖證明自己的實力了。

blocks.def: to show that something is true
examples:
[ + that ] They suspected that she'd killed him but they could never actually prove that it was her.
他們懷疑她殺了他，但他們從來未能確切證明是她做的。
 [ + adj ] They proved him innocent/guilty.
他們證明他是清白／有罪的。
 Under the present system, you're innocent until proven guilty.
在現行制度下，在被證明有罪之前你是清白的。
 [ + question word ] "I lost £30 on the bus." "That just goes to prove what an idiot you are!"
「我在公車上丟了30英鎊。」「那正好證明了你是個多麼愚蠢的傻瓜！」
 Computers have been used to prove mathematical theorems.
電腦被用於證明數學定理。
 That theory was proved false.
那個理論被證實是錯誤的。
 He's so aggressive - it's as if he's always trying to prove something.
他好逞強——似乎他一直想證明些甚麼。

blocks.def: approval or agreement, often given by an official group
examples:
The council has finally indicated its approbation of the plans.
政務會最終表示批准這些計畫。

blocks.def: complete honesty
examples:
Her probity and integrity are beyond question.
她的誠實和正直是毋庸置疑的。

blocks.def: something that you say or do to show that you disapprove of someone's bad or silly behaviour
examples:
She got a sharp reproof for being late.
她因遲到受到嚴厲斥責。
 He picked up the broken vase without a word of reproof to his son.
他撿起被兒子打碎的花瓶，一句責備的話也沒有說。

blocks.def: to tell someone that you disapprove of their bad or silly behaviour
examples:
The teacher gently reproved the boys for not paying attention.
男孩子們不注意聽講，老師委婉地責備了他們。

blocks.def: information, ideas, opinions, or images, often only giving one part of an argument, that are broadcast, published, or in some other way spread with the intention of influencing people's opinions
examples:
political/wartime propaganda
政治／戰時宣傳
 At school we were fed communist/right-wing propaganda.
在學校時我們被灌輸了共產主義／右翼思想。
 One official dismissed the ceasefire as a mere propaganda exercise.
一名官員將停火斥為赤裸裸的宣傳伎倆。

blocks.def: to create or spread propaganda
to produce a new plant from a parent plant
examples:
Most house plants can be propagated from stem cuttings.
大多數室內植物都能由切下來的莖繁殖。
 Plants need certain conditions to propagate.
植物需要一定的條件才能繁殖。

blocks.def: (of a plant or animal) to produce young plants or animals
to spread opinions, lies, or beliefs among a lot of people
examples:
The government have tried to propagate the belief that this is a just war.
政府竭力宣揚這是一場正義之戰。
 Such lies are propagated in the media.
這樣的謊言透過媒體傳播開來。

blocks.def: suitable or right for a particular situation or occasion
examples:
appropriate footwear for the country
適合在鄉間穿的鞋
 Is this film appropriate for small children?
這部電影適合幼童觀看嗎？
 I didn't think his comments were very appropriate at the time.
我覺得他在當時發表那些評論很不妥當。
 Is this an appropriate occasion to discuss finance?
這個場合適合討論財政問題嗎？
 Please complete the appropriate parts of this form (= the parts that are right or necessary for your particular situation) and return it as soon as possible.
請正確填寫表中相關部分並盡快交回。

blocks.def: to take something for your own use, usually without permission
examples:
He lost his job when he was found to have appropriated some of the company's money.
他被發現侵吞公司款項後就丟了工作。

blocks.def: to keep an amount of money to use for a particular purpose
examples:
The government have appropriated millions of pounds for the project.
政府已經為該企劃案撥款數百萬英鎊。

blocks.def: used to introduce something that is related to or connected with something that has just been said
examples:
I had an email from Sally yesterday - apropos (of) which, did you send her that article?
我昨天收到薩莉的一封電子郵件——對了，你把那篇文章寄給她了嗎？
 Apropos what you said yesterday, I think you made the right decision.
至於你昨天說的話，我覺得你作的決定是對的。

blocks.def: suitable in a particular situation or at a particular time
examples:
clothes that are apropos to the occasion
適合那個場合穿的衣服

blocks.def: the wrong use of one word instead of another word because they sound similar to each other, with results that are unintentionally funny
relating to owning something, or relating to or like an owner
examples:
I just assumed he owned the place - he had a proprietary air about him.
我理所當然以為這個地方是他的——他有一副主人的架勢。

blocks.def: Proprietary goods are made and sent out by a particular company whose name is on the product.
examples:
proprietary medicines
專利藥品

blocks.def: correct moral behaviour or actions
examples:
The director insisted that there was no question as to the propriety of how the funds were raised.
經理堅持說集資方式是完全正當的。
 She was careful always to behave with propriety.
她時刻注意行為得體。

blocks.def: the rules of polite social behaviour
examples:
They'd invited us to dinner so we thought we'd better observe the proprieties and invite them back.
他們請我們吃飯，所以我們認為最好遵循禮數回請他們。

blocks.def: written language in its ordinary form rather than poetry
examples:
I've always preferred reading prose to poetry.
我一直偏好讀散文而不是詩歌。

blocks.def: without interest, imagination, and excitement
blocks.trans: 乏味的；平淡無奇的；缺乏想像力的
examples:
If only she'd been called Camilla or Flavia instead of the prosaic Jane.
要是她叫「卡蜜拉」或「弗拉維亞」而不是叫「珍」這個平常的名字該多好。
 He asked if I'd got my black eye in a fight - I told him the prosaic truth that I'd banged my head on a door.
他問我眼睛是不是在打架時被打瘀青的——我告訴他事情很簡單，是頭撞到門弄的。

blocks.def: not completely accurate but close
examples:
The train's approximate time of arrival is 10.30.
這列火車大概在10點30分到站。
 The approximate cost will be about $600.
費用大約為600美元。
 Can you give me an approximate idea of the numbers involved?
你能粗略地告訴我參與的人數嗎？

blocks.def: to be almost the same as
examples:
The newspaper reports of the discussion only roughly approximated to (= were not exactly the same as) what was actually said.
報紙關於這次商討的報導並不完全符合實際。
 Student numbers this year are expected to approximate 5,000 (= to be about 5,000).
預計今年學生人數可達5000人左右。

blocks.def: the state of being near in space or time
examples:
The best thing about the location of the house is its proximity to the town centre.
這棟房子地理位置最好的就是鄰近市中心。

blocks.def: careful and avoiding risks
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] It's always prudent to read a contract carefully before signing it.
簽合約前先好好看一下，這樣做永遠都是明智的。

blocks.def: unwise, by failing to consider the likely results of your actions
blocks.trans: 不明智的；不謹慎的，輕率的
examples:
The report criticizes the banks for being imprudent in their lending.
該報告批評銀行在貸款方面不謹慎。

blocks.def: rude and not showing respect, especially towards someone who is older or in a more important position
blocks.trans: （尤指對年長者或上級）放肆的，無禮的
examples:
an impudent remark/child
放肆的言論／小孩

blocks.def: to refuse to accept something or someone as true, good, or reasonable
examples:
He repudiated the allegation/charge/claim that he had tried to deceive them.
他們指控／譴責／聲稱他企圖欺騙他們，他對此進行了駁斥。
 I utterly repudiate those remarks.
我認為這些話純屬一派胡言。

blocks.def: If behaviour or beliefs, etc. are repugnant, they are very unpleasant, causing a feeling of disgust.
blocks.trans: 令人厭惡的；令人反感的
examples:
a repugnant smell
令人作嘔的氣味
 I find your attitude towards these women quite repugnant.
我覺得你對待這些女性的態度非常令人反感。
 The idea of cheating in an exam is morally repugnant to me.
我認為在考試中作弊的想法不道德，對此深惡痛絕。

blocks.def: to cause people to doubt someone's character, qualities, or reputation by criticizing them
examples:
Are you impugning my competence as a professional designer?
你是在質疑我作為專業設計師的能力嗎？

blocks.def: wanting to start an argument or fight, or expressing an argument or opinion very forcefully
blocks.trans: 愛爭吵的；愛爭鬥的，好鬥的
examples:
I found him pugnacious and arrogant.
我發現他咄咄逼人，傲慢無禮。

blocks.def: a sudden strong wish to do something
examples:
I had this sudden impulse to shout out "Nonsense!" in the middle of her speech.
在她發言時我突然想大喊「一派胡言！」。

blocks.def: because you suddenly want to, although you haven't planned to
examples:
"I didn't know you were looking for some new shoes." "Oh, I wasn't - I just bought them on impulse."
「我不知道你想要買雙新鞋。」「噢，不是的——我只是一時衝動才買的。」

blocks.def: a short electrical, radio, or light signal that carries information or instructions between the parts of a system
examples:
an electrical/nerve impulse
電脈衝／神經衝動

blocks.def: something that is the driving force behind or reason for something else
examples:
a creative/commercial impulse
創作衝動／商業動機

blocks.def: If something is compulsory, you must do it because of a rule or law.
blocks.trans: 必須做的；強制性的；必修的
examples:
Swimming was compulsory at my school.
在我們學校，游泳是必修課。
 The law made wearing seat belts in cars compulsory.
坐車繫安全帶是法律強制規定的。

blocks.def: showing behaviour in which you do things suddenly without any planning and without considering the effects they may have
examples:
Don't be so impulsive - think before you act.
不要如此衝動——要三思而後行。
 an impulsive man/decision/gesture
衝動的人／決定／舉動

blocks.def: to push away or refuse something or someone unwanted, especially to successfully stop a physical attack against you
blocks.trans: 趕走，驅逐；擊退（尤指進攻）；拒絕，拒絕接受
examples:
The enemy attack was quickly repulsed.
敵人的進攻很快被擊退了。

blocks.def: If something repulses you, it causes you to have a strong feeling of dislike, disapproval, or disgust.
examples:
The tourists were repulsed by the filthy conditions.
遊客們對骯髒不堪的環境感到厭惡。

blocks.def: the act of pushing someone or something unwanted away or of refusing him, her, or it
arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
examples:
a punctual start to the meeting
準時開會
 He's fairly punctual (= he usually arrives on time).
他通常非常準時。

blocks.def: a slight guilty feeling about something you have done or might do
blocks.trans: 良心的不安；內疚；自責；後悔
examples:
I wouldn't have any compunction about telling him to leave.
我不會因為叫他走開而覺得內疚。

blocks.def: very careful to behave correctly or to give attention to details
blocks.trans: 一絲不苟的；循規蹈矩的
examples: Are you always precisely on time? Is your room perfectly neat? Do you never forget a birthday or a library book's due date? Then you are one of the punctilious people.

blocks.def: a small hole made by a sharp object, especially in a tyre
blocks.trans: （尤指輪胎上被尖物刺出的）小孔
examples:
My bike has had two punctures in the last three weeks.
在過去的三週裡我的腳踏車被紮了兩個小洞。
 I (= my car tyre) had a puncture when I was driving back from work.
我下班開車回來時輪胎被紮了個洞。
 She had a puncture wound in her arm, from a wasp sting.
她的手臂被黃蜂蜇傷了。

blocks.def: to make a small hole in something, or to get a small hole in something
examples:
She had used a screwdriver to puncture two holes in the lid of a paint tin.
她用螺絲起子在顏料罐的蓋子上戳了兩個洞。
 The knife went through his ribs and punctured his lung.
刀子穿過他的肋骨刺穿了他的肺。

blocks.def: to suddenly make someone less confident or positive
examples:
My positive mood was rather punctured by the news.
這個消息使我的好心情大大受挫。

blocks.def: to remove bad substances from something to make it pure
examples:
Plants help to purify the air.
植物有助於淨化空氣。
 One of the functions of the kidneys is to purify the blood.
腎臟的功能之一是淨化血液。
 water-purifying tablets
淨水藥片

blocks.def: to remove immoral thoughts or acts from something
examples:
One of the main teachings of Buddhism is that you should try to purify your mind.
佛教的主要教義之一是人應該努力淨化自己的思想。

blocks.def: (especially of a man) gay
strange, unusual, or not expected
examples:
What a queer thing to say!
多麼奇怪的事啊！
 I'm feeling rather queer (= ill), may I sit down?
我感覺很不舒服，可以坐下嗎？

blocks.def: a gay person, especially a man
blocks.trans: 同性戀者；（尤指）男同性戀者

blocks.def: to spoil a chance or an opportunity for someone, often on purpose
examples:
If she asks Dan for a pay rise before I do, it will probably queer my pitch.
要是她比我先向丹提出加薪的要求，那可能會毀了我加薪的機會。

blocks.def: unusual in an attractive and interesting way
examples:
He was tall and had a quirky, off-beat sense of humour.
他個子高高的，有一種獨特的、另類的幽默感。

blocks.def: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.
examples:
She stared at the tranquil surface of the water.
她凝視著平靜的水面。
 The hotel is in a tranquil rural setting.
飯店周圍是靜謐的鄉村。
 A spasm of pain crossed his normally tranquil features.
一陣疼痛掠過他那平時平靜的臉龐。

blocks.def: to accept or agree to something, often unwillingly
examples:
Reluctantly, he acquiesced to/in the plans.
雖然很不情願，他還是默許了這個計劃。

blocks.def: willing to do what other people want
examples:
She has a very acquiescent nature.
她生性逆來順受。

blocks.def: agreement
examples:
I was surprised by her acquiescence to/in the plan.
她竟然默許了這項計劃，這使我感到很驚訝。

blocks.def: temporarily quiet and not active
examples:
The political situation was now relatively quiescent.
政治形勢目前暫時平靜。

blocks.def: to remove something, especially a pencil mark by rubbing it
blocks.trans: 抹去，擦掉（尤指鉛筆字跡）
examples:
It's in pencil so you can just erase anything that's wrong.
這是用鉛筆寫的，這樣你就可以把任何錯誤的地方擦掉。

blocks.def: to remove recordings or information from a magnetic tape or disk
blocks.trans: 抹去（磁帶內容）；刪除（磁片裡的文件）
examples:
A virus erased my hard disk.
病毒把我硬碟中的資訊給刪了。

blocks.def: to cause a feeling, memory, or period of time to be completely forgotten
blocks.trans: （從頭腦中）清除，消除；忘卻（感覺、記憶等）
examples:
He is determined to erase the memory of a disappointing debut two years ago.
他決心要把兩年前初次參加比賽時令人失望的表現永遠忘掉。
 Woods wants a convincing victory to erase doubts about his team's ability to reach the World Cup finals.
伍茲想要透過大比數獲勝來消除人們對他的球隊能否打入世界盃決賽的疑慮。
 One election cannot erase 65 years of a corrupt one-party political process.
一場選舉並不能將長達65年腐敗的一黨專政的政治歷程抹去。

blocks.def: to remove or destroy something, especially something that shows that that person or thing ever existed or happened
examples:
The president said NATO expansion would finally erase the boundary line in Europe artificially created by the Cold War.
總統說北約的擴展將最終消除冷戰在歐洲造成的人為界限。
 Years of hard living had blurred but not erased her girlhood beauty.
多年的艱辛歲月使她芳容暗淡，但少女時代的美貌仍然依稀可辨。
 He was a man of mystery - erased from the history books.
他是一個充滿神秘色彩的人物——有關他的任何情況都已不見於史冊。

blocks.def: the act of erasing something
examples:
the nuclear erasure of entire populations
對全人類的核毀滅
 the erasure of police audiotapes
抹掉警方的錄音

blocks.def: to get rid of something completely or destroy something bad
examples:
The government claims to be doing all it can to eradicate corruption.
政府聲稱正盡其所能根治腐敗。
 The disease that once claimed millions of lives has now been eradicated.
這種曾奪去數百萬人生命的疾病現在已被根除了。

blocks.def: made angry easily
examples:
She's becoming more and more irascible as she grows older.
隨著年齡的增長，她的性情變得越來越暴躁。

blocks.def: to force someone to have sex when they are unwilling, using violence or threatening behaviour
examples:
She was pulled from the car and raped.
她被拉出車外，遭到強暴。
 It's difficult to understand what causes a man to rape.
很難理解是甚麼原因導致一個男人犯下強姦罪行。

blocks.def: (an example of) the crime of forcefully having sex with someone against their wishes
examples:
He had committed several rapes.
他多次犯下強姦罪。
 He was convicted of rape.
他被判犯有強姦罪。

blocks.def: destruction of the natural world, often for profit
blocks.trans: （為謀利而對自然環境的）破壞，損害，糟蹋
examples:
The road builders were accused of the rape of the countryside.
道路建築商被指責肆意破壞鄉村環境。

blocks.def: a plant with yellow flowers from which oil and animal food are produced
having or showing a strong wish to take things for yourself, usually using unfair methods or force
blocks.trans: 巧取豪奪的，貪婪的，掠奪的
examples:
a rapacious landlord/businessman
貪婪的地主／商人
 her rapacious appetite for fame
她對名聲的貪慾

blocks.def: a flat shape with four 90° angles and four sides, with opposite sides of equal length
honesty and correct moral behaviour
examples:
An austere man of unquestioned moral rectitude, Nava inspired deep devotion in those who worked for him.
納瓦的簡樸作風和正直品行有口皆碑，使得員工們對其忠心耿耿。

blocks.def: to bring someone back to life
examples:
Almost all Christians believe that Jesus was resurrected from the dead.
幾乎所有的基督徒都相信耶穌死而復生。

blocks.def: to bring back something into use or existence that had disappeared or ended
blocks.trans: 重新使用；恢復；使重新流行
examples:
Several members of the party have resurrected the idea of constitutional change.
該黨幾位黨員重新提出了修改憲法的主張。
 She has been busily trying to resurrect her Hollywood career.
她一直奔忙，試圖重振她的好萊塢演藝生涯。

blocks.def: to control something, especially by making it work in a particular way
blocks.trans: （尤指使按照某種方式運作而）控制，管理，調節，調整
examples:
You can regulate the temperature in the house by adjusting the thermostat.
你可以透過調節恆溫器來控制室溫。
 [ + question word ] Her mother strictly regulates how much TV she can watch.
她媽媽嚴格控制她看電視的時間。

blocks.def: a particular government or a system or method of government
examples:
The old corrupt, totalitarian regime was overthrown.
腐敗的舊極權政府被推翻。

blocks.def: a particular way of operating or organizing a business, etc.
blocks.trans: 組織方法；管理體制；體系
examples:
The regime in this office is hard work and more hard work.
該事務所的管理方式是讓人努力再努力。

blocks.def:
a 
regimen formal
blocks.trans: 生活規則，養生之道（同 regimen）

blocks.def: connected with a particular regiment (= a large group of soldiers)
examples:
a regimental tie/uniform
團領帶/團制服
 a regimental commander/sergeant-major
團長/團軍士長

blocks.def: a long, thin piece of material, especially leather, that helps you to control and direct a horse
examples:
You pull on both reins to stop or slow a horse, but only the left rein to turn left.
拉兩邊的繮繩來讓馬停住或放慢速度，但是要想左轉時，只需拉左邊的繮繩。

blocks.def: a strap that is put around a small child's body or wrist and held at the other end by an adult so that the adult can stop the child running away
blocks.trans: （領幼兒走路時防止其走失的）安全繩套，保護帶
examples:
I always put my son on reins when we go shopping.
我們帶兒子去購物時，總是用安全帶牽著他。

blocks.def: a king or queen
a British gold coin that was in use in Britain from 1817 to 1914 and was worth £1
blocks.trans: 金鎊（英國於1817-1914年之間使用的面值爲一英鎊的金幣）

blocks.def: having the highest power or being completely independent
blocks.trans: 至高無上的；完全獨立的
examples:
Sovereign power is said to lie with the people in some countries, and with a ruler in others.
據說，在某些國家中最高統治權歸於人民，而在其他國家則掌握在統治者手中。
 We must respect the rights of sovereign states/nations to conduct their own affairs.
我們必須尊重主權獨立國家處理本國事務的權利。

blocks.def: an extremely successful way of dealing with a problem
examples:
Love is a sovereign remedy for unhappiness.
愛是治療悲傷的萬靈丹。

blocks.def: an animal that produces eggs and uses the heat of the sun to keep its blood warm
done secretly, without anyone seeing or knowing
blocks.trans: 秘密的，偷偷的；鬼鬼祟祟的
examples:
She seemed to be listening to what I was saying, but I couldn't help noticing her surreptitious glances at the clock.
她看起來好像在聽我說話，但我明顯注意到她偷偷看了幾眼鐘。

blocks.def: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
examples:
Do I look ridiculous in this hat?
我戴這頂帽子看著很可笑嗎？
 Don't be so ridiculous! I can't possibly afford to stay in a hotel like that.
別傻了！我才住不起那樣的旅館呢。
 It's ridiculous to expect a two-year-old to be able to read!
指望一個兩歲的孩子能閱讀真是太荒唐了！

blocks.def: to laugh at someone or something in a way that shows you think they are stupid or of no value
examples:
He derided my singing as pathetic.
他嘲笑說我的歌聲不堪入耳。
 This building, once derided by critics, is now a major tourist attraction.
這座曾被評論家嘲笑的建築如今已成為一個主要的旅遊景點。

blocks.def: unkind words or actions that make someone or something look stupid
examples:
She was treated with scorn and ridicule by her colleagues when she applied for the job.
她申請那份工作時，受到了同事們的嘲弄和奚落。
 He's become an object of ridicule (= a person that everyone thinks is stupid and criticizes or laughs at).
他成了眾人嘲弄的對象。

blocks.def: to laugh at someone in an unkind way
examples:
She rarely spoke her mind out of fear of being ridiculed.
她怕人嘲笑，幾乎從來不說出自己的想法。
 He was ridiculed for his ideas.
他因為自己的想法而受到嘲笑。

blocks.def: stiff or fixed; not able to be bent or moved
blocks.trans: 僵硬的；固定的；不能彎曲的
examples:
a rigid steel and concrete structure
堅固的鋼筋混凝土結構
 I was rigid with (= stiff and unable to move because of) fear.
我被嚇得呆若木雞。

blocks.def: not able to be changed or persuaded
examples:
disapproving We were disappointed that they insisted on such a rigid interpretation of the rules.
他們堅持對規則進行如此呆板僵化的解釋，令我們非常失望。

blocks.def: the stiffness of the joints (= places where two bones are connected) and muscles of a dead body
examples:
Rigor mortis usually sets in between two and four hours after death.
通常死後兩至四小時就會開始出現屍僵。

blocks.def: careful to look at or consider every part of something to make certain it is correct or safe
