He's very suave and sophisticated.
他非常文氣，老練世故。

blocks.def: excited and eager to know or see more
blocks.trans: 極度興奮的；興奮期待的，急切的
examples:
We waited agog for news.
我們渴盼得到音訊。

blocks.def: a young deer
A fawn is a young deer, but it's also a verb meaning to try and win favor by flattering. You might fawn over Bambi if you want to hang out with the cute and fuzzy gang.
the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details
examples:
That was the gist of what he said.
那就是他說話的大意。
 I think I got (= understood) the gist of what she was saying.
我想我明白她說的話的大意了。

blocks.def: a stopping of an activity for an agreed amount of time
examples:
a five-year worldwide moratorium on nuclear weapons testing
全球為期五年的核武器試驗中止期

blocks.def: a person who lives alone and avoids going outside or talking to other people
examples:
He is a millionaire recluse who refuses to give interviews.
他是個喜歡獨處的百萬富翁，不接受別人的採訪。

blocks.def: to make a judgment in an argument, usually because asked to do so by those involved
blocks.trans: （通常指在爭議方要求下）仲裁，裁決，公斷
examples:
I've been asked to arbitrate between the opposing sides.
對立的雙方請我作個公斷。
 An outside adviser has been brought in to arbitrate the dispute between the management and the union.
局外顧問受邀對資方和工會之間的爭端進行仲裁。

blocks.def: (especially of women) quiet and well behaved
blocks.trans: （尤指女性）端莊的，文靜的，安靜的
examples:
She gave him a demure smile.
她朝他文雅地一笑。

blocks.def: the character of a place or the quality it seems to have
examples:
Despite being a busy city, Dublin has the ambience of a country town.
儘管都柏林是一個繁忙的城市，但頗有鄉村城鎮的情調。

blocks.def: to bring back swallowed food into the mouth
blocks.trans: （使）（咽下的食物）返回到口中；反芻
examples:
Owls regurgitate partly digested food to feed their young.
貓頭鷹將半消化的食物吐出來餵幼鳥。

blocks.def: If you regurgitate facts, you just repeat what you have heard without thinking about it.
blocks.trans: （不加思考地）重複；照搬；照本宣科
examples:
Many students simply regurgitate what they hear in lectures.
很多學生只會鸚鵡學舌般地重複從課堂上聽來的東西。

blocks.def: the exact opposite
examples:
She is slim and shy - the very antithesis of her sister.
她身材苗條，性格靦腆，正好和她姐姐相反。
 He is the exact antithesis of what I find attractive in men.
我認為男性應有的魅力他一點都沒有。

blocks.def: a contrast between two things
examples:
Thanks to the collapse of communism the political antithesis between Left and Right is less important.
由於共產主義瓦解，左翼和右翼的對立顯得不那麼重要了。

blocks.def: a feeling of friendliness towards people that you work or share an experience with
examples:
When you've been climbing alone for hours, there's a tremendous sense of camaraderie when you meet another climber.
獨自攀登數小時後遇到另一個攀登者，這時你會產生強烈的志同道合感。

blocks.def: extremely honest
blocks.trans: 胸懷坦蕩的；審慎的；嚴格認真的
examples:
A scrupulous politician would not lie about her business interests.
一個光明磊落的政治家並不會隱瞞自己的職務權益。

blocks.def: doing everything correctly and exactly as it should be done
examples:
The nurse told him to be scrupulous (= extremely careful) about keeping the wound clean.
護士告訴他務必保持傷口清潔。

blocks.def: to gradually take away someone else's rights, or to take control of someone's time, work, etc.
blocks.trans: 逐步侵犯（權利）；慢慢侵佔（時間）；逐漸干擾（工作）
examples:
What the company is proposing encroaches on the rights of individuals.
公司打算做的這件事侵犯了個人的權利。
 I resent it that my job is starting to encroach on my family life.
我的工作開始佔據本來屬於我家庭生活的時間，我很討厭這一點。

blocks.def: to gradually cover more and more of an area of land
examples:
They have promised that the development will not encroach on public land.
他們已經承諾這項開發不會侵佔公共土地。

blocks.def: to remove something or someone, especially by force, from a fixed position
blocks.trans: （尤指在外力作用下）使移位；使免職
examples:
The earthquake dislodged stones from the walls and the roof.
地震震落了牆壁和屋頂上的石頭。
 The Red Sox need two wins to dislodge the Yankees from first place.
波士頓紅襪隊必須贏兩場比賽才能把紐約洋基隊從第一的位置上擠下去。。

blocks.def: to remove the testicles of a male animal or human
blocks.trans: 閹割，割除（雄性動物或男子的）睾丸

blocks.def: deep respect and often praise shown for a person or god
examples:
On this occasion we pay homage to him for his achievements.
在此我們謹就他取得的成就向他表示敬意。

blocks.def: used instead of something else, usually because the other thing is too expensive or rare
blocks.trans: （通常指因爲某物過於昂貴或稀有而以其他事物）代用的
examples:
I'm allowed to eat ersatz chocolate made from carob beans, but it's a poor substitute for the real thing.
他們允許我吃用角豆做的巧克力替代品，不過這種以假代真的東西太蹩腳了。

blocks.def: of or like a style of building that was common in Europe between the 12th and 16th centuries and whose characteristics are pointed arches and windows, high ceilings, and tall, thin columns
blocks.trans: 哥德式的，哥德風格的（12到16世紀流行於歐洲的建築風格，有尖拱、尖窗、很高的天花板以及細長的柱子）
examples:
a Gothic cathedral
哥特式大教堂
 Gothic arches
哥特式拱門

blocks.def: used to describe writing or films in which strange things happen in frightening places
blocks.trans: （文學、電影等）哥德派的，哥德風格的（描述在恐怖的地方發生的怪異故事）

blocks.def: something that is allowed or given up, often in order to end a disagreement, or the act of allowing or giving this
blocks.trans: （常指為結束爭端而作出的）認可，讓步，妥協
examples:
Both sides involved in the conflict made some concessions in yesterday's talks.
在昨天的談判中，衝突雙方都作出了讓步。
 He stated firmly that no concessions will be made to the terrorists.
他強硬地宣稱不會對恐怖分子作出任何讓步。

blocks.def: the act of admitting defeat
examples:
The former president's concession came even before all the votes had been counted.
選票還沒完全統計出來，前總統就承認失利了。
 a concession speech
承認失敗的講話

blocks.def: a reduction in the usual price of something, made available to students, old people, etc.
blocks.trans: （對學生、老少或失業人士的）價格優惠，減價
examples:
You can get travel concessions if you are under 26.
26歲以下者乘車可以獲得優惠。

blocks.def: a special right to property or land
blocks.trans: （財產、土地等的）特許權；許可使用權

blocks.def: the right to sell a product in a particular area
blocks.trans: 特許經營權；特許銷售權

blocks.def: a name given to someone or something that is not their or its real or official name
examples:
These charms have earned the television show's host the sobriquet "the thinking woman's heartthrob".
這位電視節目主持人的個性魅力為他贏得了「有腦女性的迷戀對象」這一綽號。

blocks.def: to make something or someone completely wet
examples:
The grass had been saturated by overnight rain.
一夜的雨淋透了草地。
 He had cut his leg badly, and his trousers were saturated with/in blood.
他劃破了腿，傷勢嚴重，褲子都被血浸透了。

blocks.def: to fill a thing or place completely so that no more can be added
examples:
The police saturated (= a large number of police officers were sent into) the area.
大批員警被派往該地區。

blocks.def: to provide too much of a product so that there is more of this product available than there are people who want to buy it
examples:
Since the US market has now been saturated, drug dealers are looking to Europe.
由於美國的市場現在已經飽和，毒販們開始轉向歐洲。

blocks.def:
a 
saturated fat specialized
the extreme belief that your own country is always best, often shown in enthusiastic support for a war against another country
blocks.trans: 極端愛國主義；侵略主義；沙文主義
examples:
Patriotism can turn into jingoism and intolerance very quickly.
愛國主義可以很快轉化為沙文主義和極端排外。

blocks.def: uncertain and frightened to take risks, or unwilling to take action
blocks.trans: 小心的，謹慎的；不願採取行動的
examples:
I'm a bit chary of using a travel agency that doesn't have official registration.
選擇沒有正式註冊的旅行社我有點不放心。

blocks.def: the state of having what you need in order to stay alive, but no more
examples:
The money is intended to provide a basic subsistence and should not be paid to someone who receives other income.
這些錢旨在提供基本生活保障，不應發放給有其他收入來源的人。
 The family was living at subsistence level.
這家人過著勉強餬口的生活。

blocks.def: enough money or food to keep yourself alive
a strong feeling of wanting to have something, especially money or possessions
blocks.trans: （尤指對金錢或財産的）貪心，貪婪

blocks.def: If a loud, deep sound reverberates, it continues to be heard around an area, so that the area seems to shake.
examples:
The narrow street reverberated with/to the sound of the workmen's drills.
狹窄的街道上迴盪著工人施工的電鑽聲。

blocks.def: If an event or idea reverberates somewhere, it has an effect on everyone or everything in a place or group.
examples:
News of the disaster reverberated around the organization.
災難的噩耗傳來，組織內所有人震驚不已。
 The surge in US share prices reverberated across the globe.
美國股價飆升，影響波及全世界。

blocks.def: having strong, unreasonable beliefs and disliking other people who have different beliefs or a different way of life
blocks.trans: 固執己見的，頑固的；心胸狹窄的
examples:
She's so bigoted that she refuses to accept anyone who doesn't think like her.
她心胸狹窄，容不得任何與她觀點不同的人。

blocks.def: If a cut or other injury festers, it becomes infected and produces pus.
examples:
a festering sore
膿瘡

blocks.def: If an argument or bad feeling festers, it continues so that feelings of hate or lack of satisfaction increase.
blocks.trans: （爭論或不快的感覺）加劇，惡化
examples:
It's better to express your anger than let it fester inside you.
把憤怒表達出來比鬱積在心裡要好。
 a festering argument/dispute
愈益激化的爭論／爭端

blocks.def: involving or producing movement
examples:
kinetic energy
動能

blocks.def: a piece of writing or a speech in which a person strongly attacks or defends a particular opinion, person, idea, or set of beliefs
examples:
She has published a fierce anti-war polemic.
她發表了一篇言辭激烈的反戰文章。

blocks.def: fashionable but not likely to stay fashionable for a long time
examples:
Faddish diets are unlikely to work in the long term.
一時流行的飲食方式有可能長期是行不通的。

blocks.def: a short piece of writing
examples:
He left a note to say he would be home late.
他留下字條說他會晚點回家。
 There's a note on the door saying when the shop will open again.
門上釘著一張便條，上面寫著商店何時重新開張。

blocks.def: a short explanation or an extra piece of information that is given at the bottom of a page, at the back of a book, etc.
blocks.trans: （頁底）注釋，說明；（書的）封底介紹
examples:
For more information see Note 3.
詳細解釋參見注釋3。

blocks.def: information written on paper
examples:
The wind blew my notes all over the room.
風把我的筆記吹得滿屋都是。
 The reporter took notes throughout the interview.
採訪過程中記者一直在做筆記。

blocks.def: a single sound at a particular level, usually in music, or a written symbol that represents this sound
examples:
high/low notes
高／低音
 She played three long notes on the piano.
她在鋼琴上彈了三個長音。
 The engine noise suddenly changed its note and rose to a whine.
引擎噪音突然越來越響，變成了尖叫聲。

blocks.def: an emotion or a way of expressing something
examples:
There was a note of caution in her letter.
她的信中帶著一絲謹慎。
 His speech struck just the right note.
他發言的語調恰如其分。
 The meeting ended on an optimistic note.
這次會議在一片樂觀的氣氛中結束。

blocks.def: a piece of paper money
examples:
a €20 note
20歐元的紙幣
 He took a wad of notes from his pocket.
他從口袋中拿出一疊鈔票。

blocks.def: importance, or the fact that something deserves attention
examples:
There was nothing of note in the latest report.
最近的這份報告中並無值得關注之處。

blocks.def: to notice something
examples:
They noted the consumers' growing demand for quicker service.
他們留意到消費者對便捷服務與日俱增的需求。
 [ + (that) ] Please note (that) we will be closed on Saturday.
請注意我們週六不營業。
 [ + question word ] Note how easy it is to release the catch quickly.
注意看，迅速拉開插銷有多麼容易。

blocks.def: to give your attention to something by discussing it or making a written record of it
examples:
[ + that ] He said the weather was beyond our control, noting that last summer was one of the hottest on record.
他說天氣超出了我們的掌控範圍，並提到去年夏天是有史以來最炎熱的一個夏天。
 In the article, she notes several cases of medical incompetence.
在文章中，她提到了幾宗醫療事故的案例。

blocks.def: very unpleasant or rude
blocks.trans: 可憎的，令人討厭的；粗魯無禮的
examples:
Some of his colleagues say that he's loud and obnoxious.
他的一些同事說他這個人又愛出風頭又惹人討厭。
 When she's in a bad mood she's obnoxious to everyone.
她發脾氣的時候，人人都很討厭她。

blocks.def: to bend the top half of the body forward and down
examples:
The doorway was so low that we had to stoop to go through it.
門道太低，我們不得不彎下腰進去。
 Something fell out of her coat pocket and she stooped down and picked it up.
有個東西從她大衣口袋裡掉了出來，她俯下身撿起來。

blocks.def: If someone stoops, their head and shoulders are always bent forwards and down.
examples:
He's over six feet tall, but the way he stoops makes him look shorter.
他身高超過六英尺，但他弓著背，顯得矮了一些。

blocks.def: a raised flat area in front of the door of a house, with steps leading up to it
examples:
She got home to find the kids sitting on the stoop waiting for her.
她回到家，發現孩子們正坐在門廊上等她。

blocks.def: a way of standing or walking with the head and shoulders bent slightly forwards and down
examples:
He is a tall man with a slight stoop.
他是個高個子，有點駝背。

blocks.def: a person who believes that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere
blocks.trans: 憤世嫉俗的人；懷疑人之真誠者；認為人皆自私者
examples:
I'm too much of a cynic to believe that he'll keep his promise.
我懷疑這世間的一切，不相信他會遵守諾言。
 A cynic might say that the government has only taken this measure because it is concerned about its declining popularity.
憤世嫉俗者會說政府之所以採取這項措施僅僅是由於對其信任度下降感到擔憂。

blocks.def: an official process to discover the cause of someone's death
examples:
An inquest is always held if murder is suspected.
如果懷疑是謀殺，總要驗屍調查。

blocks.def: an examination of or discussion about the reasons for someone's or something's failure
examples:
an inquest into the department's poor performance
對該部門業績不佳的調查

blocks.def: public criticism of something or someone
the act of accusing someone in public of something bad
examples:
his denunciation as a traitor
揭發他的叛徒身分

blocks.def: to rub metal until it is smooth and shiny
If you burnish something such as your public image, you take action to improve it and make it more attractive.
examples:
The company is currently trying to burnish its socially responsible image.
公司目前正在努力改善形象，把自己塑造成一個有社會責任感的公司。

blocks.def: smooth and shiny
an amount of money, such as a tax, that you have to pay to a government or organization
examples:
They imposed a five percent levy on alcohol.
他們對酒品徵收5%的稅。

blocks.def: an official order given by a law court, usually to stop someone from doing something
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] The court has issued an injunction to prevent the airline from increasing its prices.
法院頒布禁令不准航空公司加價。
 [ + -ing verb ] She is seeking an injunction banning the newspaper from publishing the photographs.
她正在爭取獲得禁令，禁止報紙刊登這些照片。

blocks.def: a type of vulture (= a large bird that feeds on dead animals) from South America

trample.pos: verb [ I or T,  usually + prep ]

blocks.def: to step heavily on something or someone, causing damage or injury
examples:
Somebody trampled all over my flowerbeds!
有人把我的花壇全部踩壞了！
 Eight people were trampled to death (= killed) when the stadium collapsed and the crowd rushed out onto the football pitch.
體育場突然倒塌時，人群衝進足球場，其間八人被踩踏致死。

blocks.def: to act without any respect for someone or something
examples:
She accused the government of trampling on the needs and rights of the ordinary citizen.
她譴責政府無視普通公民的需求和權利。
 He argues that Congress trampled the constitutional rights of legal immigrants in the new welfare reform law.
他認為，國會在新的福利改革法中侵犯了合法移民享有的憲法所賦予的權利。

blocks.def: a sudden and uncontrolled expression of strong emotion
examples:
an effusion of anger and despair
突然陷入憤怒和絕望之中

blocks.def: showing no respect, especially for God or religion
blocks.trans: （尤指對上帝或宗教）不敬的；不恭的

blocks.def: to shake slightly, often because of strong emotion
examples:
Lennie's bottom lip quivered and tears started in his eyes.
雷尼的下唇顫抖著，眼裡湧出了淚光。

blocks.def: a long, thin container for carrying arrows
a slight shake, often because of strong emotion
examples:
The opening bars of the music sent a quiver of excitement through the crowd.
音樂起始的幾小節讓人群頓時興奮激動起來。

blocks.def: unlucky and usually unhappy
examples:
Many children are hapless victims of this war.
許多兒童是這場戰爭不幸的受害者。

blocks.def: to repair something that is broken or damaged
examples:
Could you mend this hole in my shirt?
你能把我襯衫上的這個洞補一下嗎？
UK I've left my watch at the jeweller's to be mended.
我把手錶留在鐘錶店那裡修理了。
UK The plumber came to mend the burst pipe.
水管工來修理爆裂的水管。
 The country's president is seeking to mend relations with the United States.
該國總統正試圖修補與美國的關係。

blocks.def: a place in a piece of clothing where a repair has been made
a person, thing, or idea that exists out of its time in history, especially one that happened or existed later than the period being shown, discussed, etc.
blocks.trans: 時代錯誤，年代誤植，不合時代的人（或物）
examples:
For some people, marriage is an anachronism from the days when women needed to be protected.
對一些人來說，婚姻是婦女需要受保護的時代的產物，而現在已經不合時宜了。

blocks.def: illegal or disapproved of by society
blocks.trans: 非法的；違禁的；社會不容許的
examples:
illicit drugs such as cocaine and cannabis
古柯鹼和大麻之類的違禁藥物
 the illicit trade in stolen vehicles
非法的贓車交易
 an illicit love affair
不正當的戀情

blocks.def: A congenital disease or condition exists at or from birth.
examples:
a congenital abnormality/disease
先天性畸形／疾病

blocks.def: used to say that someone always shows a particular bad quality
blocks.trans: 生就有（某種壞品質）的，生性的
examples:
a congenital liar
生性愛說謊的人

blocks.def: the quality of being ostentatious
examples:
Her luxurious lifestyle and personal ostentation were both hated and envied.
她奢侈的生活方式和自我炫耀令人又恨又妒。

blocks.def: showing anger or violence that is too extreme and not well controlled
blocks.trans: （人或其言行）無節制的，過激的，放縱的
examples:
an intemperate outburst
毫無節制的情感爆發
 intemperate language
過激的語言
 The governor said he would not be provoked into intemperate action.
州長說他不會因被激怒而採取過激行動。

blocks.def: to deceive or trick someone
examples:
He hoodwinked us into agreeing.
他騙取我們的同意。

blocks.def: (especially of countries) the position of being the strongest and most powerful and therefore able to control others
blocks.trans: （尤指國家的）霸權，支配權，領導權
examples:
The three nations competed for regional hegemony.
這三個國家就地區霸權展開爭奪。

blocks.def: the largest part or greatest amount
examples:
The preponderance of evidence suggests that he's guilty.
大量的證據顯示他有罪。

blocks.def: to say exactly how something must be or must be done
examples:
She agreed to buy the car, but stipulated racing tyres and a turbo-powered engine.
她同意買這輛車，但指明要裝賽車輪胎和渦輪動力引擎。
 [ + that ] The law stipulates that new cars must have seat belts for the driver and every passenger.
法律規定新車必須為駕駛人和每位乘客配備坐椅安全帶。
 [ + question word ] We have signed a contract which stipulates when the project must be completed.
我們已簽署合約，規定了必須完成專案計劃的時間。

blocks.def: sad or likely to cry often and easily
blocks.trans: 悲傷的；愛哭的，容易落淚的
examples:
He is better known for his lachrymose ballads than hard rock numbers.
他的傷感民謠比他的硬搖滾樂更加廣為人知。

blocks.def:
→ 
homogeneous
to accept something enthusiastically
examples:
This was an opportunity that he would embrace.
這樣的機會他是求之不得的。

blocks.def: to hold someone tightly with both arms to express love, liking, or sympathy, or when greeting or leaving someone
examples:
She saw them embrace on the station platform.
她看到他們在月臺上擁抱。
 He leaned over to embrace the child.
他彎腰去擁抱那個孩子。

blocks.def: to include something, often as one of a number of things
examples:
Linguistics embraces a diverse range of subjects such as phonetics and stylistics.
語言學包括一系列不同的科目，如語音學和文體學。

blocks.def: the act of holding someone tightly with both arms to express love, liking, or sympathy, or when greeting or leaving someone
examples:
She greeted me with a warm embrace.
她用熱烈的擁抱迎接我。

blocks.def: happening after something else
examples:
The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.
書中講述了他患病及隨後隱退政壇的事。
 Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure, because we didn't hear anything.
那些爆炸一定是在我們離開後發生的，因為我們甚麼也沒聽到。

blocks.def: cups, plates, bowls, etc., used to serve food and drink, especially made of china
of or relating to dogs
examples:
The city's canine population (= the number of dogs in the city) has grown dramatically over recent years.
近年來該市狗的數量急劇增加。

blocks.def: one of four pointed teeth in the human mouth
a dog
a formal agreement or promise between two or more people
examples:
The contract contained a restrictive covenant against building on the land.
該合同包含嚴格的限制條款，禁止在這塊土地上建築施工。

blocks.def: a formal agreement to pay a fixed amount of money regularly, especially to a charity
blocks.trans: （尤指定期向慈善機構捐款的）合同，約定

blocks.def: a medical condition that makes a person unable to speak, write, or understand speech or writing because of damage to the brain
blocks.trans: 失語症（由於腦部受損導致喪失口語、文字的表達和理解能力的症狀）

blocks.def: to make something happen
examples:
The bishop's speech has prompted an angry response from both political parties.
主教的發言激起了兩大政黨的憤怒回應。
 Recent worries over the president's health have prompted speculation over his political future.
最近對總統健康狀況的擔憂引發了對其政治前途的猜測。

blocks.def: to make someone decide to say or do something
blocks.trans: 促使（某人）決定說（或做）某事
examples:
What prompted you to say that?
是甚麼促使你那麼說的？
 I don't know what prompted him to leave.
我不知道是甚麼促使他離開的。

blocks.def: to help someone, especially an actor, to remember what they were going to say or do
examples:
I forgot my line and had to be prompted.
我忘詞了，只好讓人提詞。

blocks.def: (of an action) done quickly and without delay, or (of a person) acting quickly or arriving at the arranged time
examples:
They've written back already - that was a very prompt reply.
他們已經回信了——答覆相當迅速。
 They're usually fairly prompt in dealing with enquiries.
他們回覆諮詢通常都比較快。
 Try to be prompt because we'll be very short of time.
儘量快點，因為我們時間很緊迫。

blocks.def: a sign on a computer screen that shows that the computer is ready to receive your instructions
blocks.trans: （電腦螢幕上的）提示符（顯示電腦已經準備好接受指令）

blocks.def: words that are spoken to an actor who has forgotten what he or she is going to say during the performance of a play
a person whose job is to help actors, during a performance, to remember words that they have forgotten
at the time stated and no later
examples:
We'll be leaving at six o'clock prompt.
我們六點準時動身。

blocks.def: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning
examples:
Flags of all the participating countries are flying outside the stadium.
所有參賽國家的國旗都飄揚在體育場外。
 Flags were flapping/fluttering in the breeze.
旗子在和風中飄揚。
 The guard waved his flag and the train pulled away from the station.
護衛揮旗示意，火車從車站駛離。

blocks.def:
a 
flagstone
a flower that is a type of large iris
to put a mark on something so it can be found easily among other similar things
examples:
Flag any files that might be useful later.
給日後可能有用的文檔做上標記。

blocks.def: to mark computer information with one of two possible values so that you can deal with it later
blocks.trans: 標記（電腦裡某些資料，以便之後處理）
examples:
We'll flag the records of interest in the database and then we can give you a print-out.
我們會在資料庫中把值得關注的紀錄標記出來，之後列印一份給你。

blocks.def: to become tired, weaker, or less effective
examples:
I was starting to flag after the ninth mile.
走了九英里後，我開始感到疲倦了。
 The conversation was flagging.
談話越來越乏味了。

blocks.def: to hit someone or something repeatedly, especially with your fists (= closed hands)
examples:
The boxer had pummelled his opponent into submission by the end of the fourth round.
第四回合比賽快要結束時那位拳擊手連續擊打對手使其認輸。

blocks.def: to defeat someone easily at a sport
examples:
They were pummelled in the second round.
他們在比賽的第二輪中被輕鬆擊敗。

blocks.def: showing that you are sorry for something you have done because you feel it was wrong
examples:
"I'm sorry," she said with a penitent smile.
「對不起，」她歉疚地笑著說。
 It was hard to be angry with him when he looked so penitent.
當時他看來是那麼懊悔，很難對他發火。

blocks.def: a person who is performing a formal religious act to show that they are sorry for something they have done wrong
a person who is not loyal or stops being loyal to their own country, social class, beliefs, etc.
examples:
The leaders of the rebellion were hanged as traitors.
叛亂的首領被作為叛國者絞死了。
 The Chinese Communist Party branded (= called) Mr Gorbachev "a traitor to socialism".
中國共產黨稱戈巴契夫先生為「社會主義的叛徒」。

blocks.def: deserving respect because of age, high position, or religious or historical importance
blocks.trans: 德高望重的；令人尊敬的；崇高神聖的
examples:
a venerable tradition/company/family
備受推崇的傳統／久負盛名的公司／德高望重的家族
 She has worked at such venerable institutions as Boston's Museum of Fine Arts and the Metropolitan Art Museum in New York.
她曾供職於一些久負盛名的機構，比如波士頓美術館和紐約的大都會藝術博物館。

blocks.def: used as a title for an archdeacon in the Church of England
blocks.trans: （對英國聖公會會吏長的尊稱）尊者

blocks.def: used as a title for a person who is considered holy by the Roman Catholic Church but who has not yet been made a saint
blocks.trans: （羅馬天主教對尚未列為聖徒的聖潔者的尊稱）尊者

blocks.def: used as a title for a monk in Buddhism
blocks.trans: （佛教中對和尚的尊稱）師父，法師

blocks.def: in a way that shows that you are feeling sorry and wishing that something had not happened
examples:
"I wish we'd started six months earlier," he said ruefully.
“我們要是能早六個月開始就好了，”他傷心地說。
 She shook her head and smiled ruefully.
她搖搖頭，苦澀地笑了笑。

blocks.def: something, such as a swimming pool or shopping centre, that is intended to make life more pleasant or comfortable for the people in a town, hotel, or other place
blocks.trans: 生活福利設施，便利設施；娛樂消遣設施
examples:
The council has some spare cash, which it proposes to spend on public amenities.
政務委員會有一些餘款，計劃用來增添一些公共便利設施。

blocks.def: things considered to be necessary to live comfortably, such as hot water
examples:
The 200-year-old jail is overcrowded, understaffed, and lacking in basic amenities.
這座已有200年歷史的監獄擁擠不堪、警力不足，而且缺乏基本的生活設施。

blocks.def: the vertical part of a door or window frame
to repair or improve something so that every part of it works as it should
blocks.trans: 徹底檢修，大修；改造；改進
examples:
I got the engine overhauled.
我徹底檢修了引擎。
 The government has recently overhauled the healthcare system.
政府最近徹底改革了公共醫療保健服務。

blocks.def: to do something that shows that you are sorry for something bad that you did
examples:
The country's leader has expressed a wish to atone for his actions in the past.
該國領導人表示願意為其以前的行為向世人謝罪。

blocks.def: a letter
examples:
humorous Many thanks for your lengthy epistle, which arrived in this morning's post.
今晨收到你寫來的長信，非常感謝。

blocks.def: one of the letters written to the early Christians by the apostles (= the first men who believed in Jesus Christ)
a person, usually a man, who lives in a way that is not moral, having sexual relationships with many people
having or expressing more than one possible meaning, sometimes intentionally
blocks.trans: 含糊不清的；引起歧義的，模棱兩可的；不明確的
examples:
His reply to my question was somewhat ambiguous.
他對我的提問回答得有些含糊不清。
 The wording of the agreement is ambiguous.
該協議的措辭模棱兩可。
 The government has been ambiguous on this issue.
在此問題上政府立場一直不明確。

blocks.def: 默劇
examples:
It's an evening of music, drama and pantomime.
晚會上匯集了音樂、戲劇和默劇。

blocks.def: to make something slightly wet
examples:
Rain had dampened the tent so we left it to dry in the afternoon sun.
雨水打濕了帳篷，午後我們把它放到太陽底下曬。

blocks.def: to make feelings, especially of excitement or enjoyment, less strong
blocks.trans: 使（尤指興奮或喜悅之情）平靜下來；穩定（情緒）；對…潑冷水
examples:
Nothing you can say will dampen her enthusiasm.
不管你說甚麼，她的熱情仍絲毫不減。
 I didn't want to dampen his spirits.
我不想給他潑冷水。

blocks.def: all the music or plays, etc. that you can do or perform or that you know
blocks.trans: （總稱某人可演出的）全部劇目，全部節目，全部曲目
examples:
The Royal Shakespeare Company also have many modern plays in their repertoire.
皇家莎士比亞劇團的演出劇目中也包括很多現代戲劇。
 There is an extensive repertoire of music written for the flute.
為長笛演奏而譜寫的曲目林林總總，豐富多彩。

blocks.def: to be involved in a difficult situation, especially for a long period of time
examples:
The peace talks are mired in bureaucracy.
和平談判深陷於官僚主義的泥潭中。

blocks.def: a lack of equality or similarity, especially in a way that is not fair
examples:
the growing disparity between rich and poor
正在加劇的貧富懸殊

blocks.def: A strident sound is loud, unpleasant, and rough.
examples:
People are put off by his strident voice.
人們很厭惡他那刺耳的嗓音。

blocks.def: expressing or expressed in forceful language that does not try to avoid upsetting other people
blocks.trans: 措詞強硬的，咄咄逼人的
examples:
a strident newspaper article
報紙上措詞強硬的文章
 They are becoming increasingly strident in their criticism of government economic policy.
他們對政府經濟政策的抨擊越來越猛烈。

blocks.def:
a 
death knell
blocks.trans: 終結的預兆，完結的信號（同 death knell）

blocks.def: a sudden movement of the muscles in your body that you cannot control, caused by illness or drugs
examples:
She went into convulsions and had to be rushed to hospital.
她全身抽搐，被迅速送到醫院。

blocks.def: a person who doubts the truth or value of an idea or belief
examples:
People say it can cure colds, but I'm a skeptic.
人們說它能治感冒，我有些懷疑。
 to convince the skeptics
說服持懷疑態度的人

blocks.def: to climb up, across, or into somewhere with difficulty, using the hands and the feet
examples:
They clambered over/up the rocks.
他們攀上了岩石。
 I clambered into/onto the bus.
我擠進了公車。
 She clambered into bed.
她爬上了床。

blocks.def: a piece of art, music, literature, etc. that intentionally copies the style of someone else's work or is intentionally in various styles, or the practice of making art in either of these ways
blocks.trans: （藝術品、音樂、文學作品等的）模仿作品
examples:
The movie is a skilful, witty pastiche of "Jaws".
該影片是對《大白鯊》巧妙而詼諧的模仿。

blocks.def: to take something without having the right to do so
examples: When the teacher steps out of the classroom and some bossy student marches up to the front of the class and begins scolding the other kids? The student is trying to arrogate the teacher's authority.

blocks.def: to secretly become part of a group in order to get information or to influence the way that group thinks or behaves
examples:
A journalist managed to infiltrate the powerful drug cartel.
一位記者設法滲入了勢力強大的販毒集團內部。

blocks.def: to move slowly into a substance, place, system, or organization
blocks.trans: 滲透（進入某物質、地方、系統或機構）
examples:
At about this time the new ideas about "corporate management" had begun to infiltrate (into) local government.
大約此時，有關「共同管理」的一些新思想逐步開始為當地政府所接受。

blocks.def: trying to appear wise, intelligent, and important, in a way that is annoying
examples: If you speak in sententious phrases, your listeners are probably falling asleep, as your speech is pompous and pretentious, and full of moralistic babble.

blocks.def: the feeling of having little energy or of being unable or unwilling to do anything
blocks.trans: 沒精打采，懶散；無生氣，呆滯
examples:
Symptoms include loss of appetite, lethargy, and vomiting.
症狀包括食欲不振、昏昏欲睡和嘔吐。

blocks.def: to make an illegal copy of something in order to deceive
examples:
a forged passport
偽造的護照
 a forged signature
偽造的簽名
 A number of forged works of art have been sold as genuine.
一些藝術贋品已被當作真品出售。

blocks.def: to make or produce something, especially with some difficulty
examples:
The accident forged a close bond between the two families.
事故使兩個家庭緊密地聯繫在了一起。
 She forged a new career for herself as a singer.
她成了一名歌唱家，為自己開創了一番新事業。

blocks.def: to suddenly and quickly move forward
examples:
Just 100 metres from the finishing line Jackson forged ahead.
離終點線還有100米時，傑克遜突然加速衝刺。
 She forged through the snow.
她在大雪中飛馳。

blocks.def: a working area with a fire for heating metal until it is soft enough to be beaten into different shapes
examples:
a blacksmith's forge
鐵匠鋪

blocks.def: something or someone that you think about all the time
blocks.trans: 困擾；無法擺脫的念頭；念念不忘的事（或人）
examples:
an unhealthy obsession with death
總是想到死的不健康念頭
 her chocolate obsession
她對巧克力的癡迷
 He's always wanted to find his birth mother but recently it's become an obsession.
他一直想找到自己的生母，但最近這成了他的一塊心病。

blocks.def: the part of an army or navy that leads an attack on an enemy
a group of people who lead the development of new ideas, or a leading position in the development of something
examples:
He is in the vanguard of economic reform.
他是經濟改革的領頭人。

blocks.def: to make a person or an action seem as if he, she or it is not important
examples:
Though she had spent hours fixing the computer, he belittled her efforts.
雖然她花了多個小時維修電腦，他卻無視她的努力。
 Stop belittling yourself - your work is highly valued.
別小看你自己——你的工作很有價值。

blocks.def: a new word or expression, or a new meaning for an existing word
examples: Neologisms can be fun-ti-ful, but the problem is making sure others understand what you mean.

blocks.def: soft or weak rather than firm
examples:
The penis is usually in a flaccid state.
陰莖通常處於鬆弛狀態。

blocks.def: weak and not effective
examples:
The programme included a lacklustre and flaccid performance of Berg's violin concerto.
節目包括一首由伯格演奏的死氣沉沉、毫不精彩的小提琴協奏曲。

blocks.def: something that results from something else
examples:
Unfortunately, violence is the inevitable corollary of such a revolutionary change in society.
不幸的是，這種社會大變革必然會導致暴力事件。

blocks.def: (of speech or writing) expressing an idea cleverly in a few words
blocks.trans: （講話或寫作）言簡意賅的，簡潔有力的
examples: A pithy phrase or statement is brief but full of substance and meaning. Proverbs and sayings are pithy; newspaper columnists give pithy advice.

blocks.def: not able to see clearly things that are far away
unable to understand a situation or the way actions will affect it in the future
blocks.trans: 目光短淺的，缺乏深謀遠慮的
examples:
Their myopic refusal to act now will undoubtedly cause problems in the future.
他們目光短淺，不肯現在行動，一定會造成後患。

blocks.def: to force someone by law to serve in one of the armed forces
examples:
He was conscripted into the army at the age of 18.
他18歲被徵召入伍。

blocks.def: a formal fight in the past, using guns or swords, arranged between two people as a way of deciding an argument
examples:
The two men fought a duel over the lady.
兩個男人爲了這位女士決鬥。
 The composer Strauss was once challenged to a duel.
作曲家施特勞斯曾經受到決鬥挑戰。

blocks.def: a difficult competition in which both sides show a lot of effort
examples:
The two boxers are locked in a duel for the championship title.
兩名拳擊手爲了奪冠而爭得不可開交。

blocks.def: the activity of fighting duels
an area that is lower than surrounding areas
examples:
At the bottom of the field was a wooded declivity.
田地的盡頭是一片樹木繁茂的斜坡。

blocks.def: to produce or encourage something such as an emotion or support
blocks.trans: 鼓起（勇氣）；激起（某種感情或支持）
examples:
She managed to muster the courage to ask him to the cinema.
她終於鼓起勇氣請他去看電影。
 The team will need all the strength they can muster to win this game.
球隊必須傾盡全力才能贏得這場比賽。
 Opponents are unlikely to be able to muster enough votes to override the veto.
反對者不太可能拉到足夠的選票來推翻否決。

blocks.def: (especially of soldiers) to come together, especially in preparation for fighting, or to cause to do this
examples:
The twelfth division mustered on the hill.
第12師在山上集結。
 The general mustered his troops.
將軍召集起他的部隊。

blocks.def: a group of people, especially soldiers, who have been brought together
cruel or like an animal
examples:
The soldiers were accused of bestial acts against unarmed civilians.
士兵因對手無寸鐵的平民施以暴行而遭指控。

blocks.def: to cut a large piece out of rock, stone, or another hard material in a rough way
examples:
The monument was hewn out of the side of a mountain.
這座紀念碑是在山的一側鑿刻出來的。

blocks.def: suitable for a funeral
examples:
funereal music
哀樂
 dressed in funereal black
身穿適於葬禮的黑衣服

blocks.def: praising someone too much and giving them a lot of attention that is not sincere in order to get a positive reaction
examples:
a fawning young man
阿諛奉承的年輕人

blocks.def: something good that has happened that is the result of chance instead of skill or planning
examples:
The first goal was just a fluke.
第一個進球只是僥倖命中。

blocks.def: (of roads, rivers, branches, etc.) to divide into two parts
examples:
A sample of water was taken from the point where the river bifurcates.
水質樣本取自河流分流處。

blocks.def: to steal something from a place or a person by using violence, especially during war
blocks.trans: （尤指在戰爭中）掠奪，搶劫，劫掠
examples:
Works of art were pillaged from many countries in the dark days of the Empire.
在該帝國一手遮天的黑暗時期，許多國家的藝術品被肆意掠奪。

blocks.def: a piece of writing, a drawing, etc. that criticizes a famous person or a public organization in a humorous way, allowing their or its bad qualities to be seen and making them or it seem stupid
examples:
The magazine is famed for its merciless political lampoons.
該雜誌以其筆鋒犀利的政治諷刺文章而聞名。

blocks.def: a form of strength training consisting of a variety of movements that exercise large muscle groups (gross motor movements), such as standing, grasping, pushing, etc.
a noisy argument or fight
examples:
He was injured in a Saturday-night fracas outside a disco.
他星期六晚上在一家迪斯可舞廳外的一次鬥毆中受了傷。
 The prime minister has joined the fracas over the proposed changes.
首相也加入到有關擬議改革的激烈爭論中來了。

blocks.def: soft and like wool or like fur
examples:
fluffy toys
毛絨玩具

blocks.def: light and full of air
examples:
Beat the eggs and sugar together until they are fluffy.
攪打雞蛋和糖直到鬆軟爲止。

blocks.def: a feeling of hate and continuing anger about something in the past
examples:
They cheated me, but I feel no rancour towards/against them.
他們欺騙了我，但是我並沒有對他們懷恨在心。

blocks.def: the area surrounding a place, especially a town
blocks.trans: （尤指城鎮）附近的地方，周邊地區

blocks.def: to speak or say something quickly in a way that is difficult to understand
examples:
The train was full of people jabbering (away) into their mobile phones.
火車上滿是對著手機嘰哩咕嚕說個不停的人。
 He jabbered (out) something about an accident further down the road.
他含混急促地講著路那頭發生的一次意外。

blocks.def: a statement that is so obviously true that it is almost not worth saying
blocks.trans: 自明之理，不言而喻的話
examples:
As far as health is concerned, it's a truism that prevention is better than cure.
就健康而言，預防勝於治療，這是不言而喻的。

blocks.def: a thick piece of tree trunk or branch, especially one cut for burning on a fire
a full written record of a journey, a period of time, or an event
blocks.trans: （旅程、某段時間或事件的）日記，日誌
examples:
the ship's log
該船的航海日誌

blocks.def:
informal for
logarithm
to cut down trees so that you can use their wood
examples:
The forest has been so heavily logged that it is in danger of disappearing.
這片森林被過度砍伐，面臨消失的危險。

blocks.def: to officially record something
examples:
The Better Business Bureau has logged more than 90 complaints.
商業改進局已經記錄下了90多宗投訴。

blocks.def: to travel and record a particular distance
(of a bad action, situation, person, etc.) shocking because of being so obvious
blocks.trans: 駭人聽聞的；公然的；罪惡昭彰的
examples:
a flagrant misuse of funds/privilege
明目張膽的濫用資金／特權
 a flagrant breach of trust
公然背信
 a flagrant disregard for the law
公然蔑視法律

blocks.def: a stupid, rude, or awkward person, especially a man
examples:
a drunken/insensitive/stupid oaf
醉醺醺／麻木不仁／愚蠢的傢夥
 You clumsy oaf! You broke it!
你這個笨手笨腳的笨蛋！你把它打碎了！

blocks.def: the scientific study of disease

incorrigible.note: Something that can be fixed is corrigible. When you have a chance to go back and fix the mistakes on a math test, any errors you make are corrigible.

blocks.def: An incorrigible person or incorrigible behaviour is bad and impossible to change or improve.
examples:
an incorrigible liar/rogue
無可救藥的說謊者／無賴

blocks.def: very old and familiar and therefore not interesting or funny
examples:
He told a few hoary old jokes and nobody laughed.
他講了幾個老掉牙的笑話，沒人覺得好笑。

blocks.def: (of a person) very old and with white or grey hair
to support something by forming a strong base for it
blocks.trans: 在底部加固；形成…的基礎；加強，支撐
examples:
These are the four major theories that undergird criminal law.
這是構成刑法基礎的四大理論。

blocks.def: an adjective added to a person's name or a phrase used instead of it, usually to criticize or praise them
blocks.trans: （通常指在褒貶人時使用的）表述形容詞，修飾語
examples:
The singer's 104-kilo frame earned him the epithet of "Man Mountain" in the press.
這位歌劇演員身材魁梧，體重104公斤，在新聞報道中他因此而被冠以「巨人」的稱號。

blocks.def: to recognize how good someone or something is and to value him, her, or it
examples:
There's no point buying him expensive wines - he doesn't appreciate them.
給他買名貴的酒沒有用——他不懂品酒。

blocks.def: to understand a situation and realize that it is important
examples:
We appreciate the need for immediate action.
我們充分意識到了馬上採取行動的必要性。

blocks.def: used when you are thanking someone or showing that you are grateful
examples:
We really appreciate all the help you gave us last weekend.
上週末得到你們的大力幫助，我們非常感謝。

blocks.def: used when you are politely asking for something
blocks.trans: （用於禮貌地請求某事）（如果…）將不勝感激
examples:
I would appreciate it if you could let me know (= please let me know) in advance whether or not you will be coming.
如能提前告知能否前來，我將不勝感激。

blocks.def: to increase in value
examples:
The value of our house has appreciated by 50 percent in the last two years.
過去兩年內我們房子的價格上漲了50%。

blocks.def: unhappy and with no hope or enthusiasm
examples:
He became/grew increasingly despondent when she failed to return his phone calls.
她沒給他回電話，讓他感到越來越沮喪。
 She started to feel despondent about ever finding a job.
她開始對找到工作感到氣餒了。

blocks.def: to be unwilling to do something or to allow something to happen
examples:
I balked at the prospect of spending four hours on a train with him.
想到要與他一起在火車上度過四個小時，我就感到心不甘情不願的。

blocks.def: in baseball, to stop in the act of throwing the ball to the batter, in a way that is against the rules
a rough, thick piece of wood
in baseball, an act of stopping in the middle of throwing the ball to the batter, which is against the rules
a person who helps the poor, especially by giving them money
examples:
a donation from a wealthy 19th-century philanthropist
一位19世紀富有的慈善家的捐款

blocks.def: a piece of cloth with a pattern or picture that is created by sewing or weaving different coloured threads onto a special type of strong cloth
a lot of small red spots on the skin
examples:
I've got an itchy rash all over my chest.
我胸部出滿了疹子，癢得要命。
 If you stay in the sun too long you'll get (a) heat rash.
如果你在陽光下呆得太久，就會生痱子。
UK He came out/up in a rash after he fell in a patch of nettles.
他摔倒在一片蕁麻地裡，結果身上就起了疹子。

blocks.def: a large number of unpleasant events of the same type
blocks.trans: （一下子出現的）大量令人不快的事
examples:
There has been a rash of robberies/accidents/complaints in the last two months.
過去兩個月中，突然發生很多起搶劫案／一下出了很多宗事故／接二連三收到多宗投訴。

blocks.def: careless or unwise, without thought for what might happen or result
examples:
That was a rash decision - you didn't think about the costs involved.
那個決定太輕率了——你沒有考慮到這樣做的代價。
 [ + to infinitive ] I think it was a bit rash of them to get married when they'd only known each other for a few weeks.
我覺得他們剛認識幾週就結婚有些草率。

blocks.def: having a lot of trouble with something, or having to deal with a lot of something that causes problems
examples:
With the amount of traffic nowadays, even a trip across town is beset by/with dangers.
目前交通如此擁擠，即使穿城而行也充滿了危險。

blocks.def: strange and unusual and difficult to accept or like
blocks.trans: 稀奇古怪的；不尋常的；難以接受的
examples:
an outlandish hairstyle/outfit
古怪的髮型／裝束

blocks.def: to develop or grow quickly
examples:
Love burgeoned between them.
他們雙雙迅速墜入愛河。

blocks.def: the fact that you are too interested in your appearance or achievements
examples:
He wants the job purely for reasons of vanity and ambition.
他想得到那份工作純粹是為了滿足虛榮和野心。

blocks.def: a piece of bedroom furniture like a table with a mirror and drawers
a small cupboard that stands on the floor in a bathroom and has a washbasin (= a fixed bowl-shaped container for water) in the top
blocks.trans: （帶有盥洗盆的）浴室櫃；組合式盥洗盆

blocks.def: used to describe something that is done with the aim of getting praise, fame, or approval rather than for serious or good reasons
examples:
The new bridge was quickly condemned as a "pointless vanity project", intended to enhance the reputation of the mayor. 
這座新橋很快就被譴責為意在提高市長聲譽的「毫無意義的面子工程」。
 vanity publishing
為了滿足虛榮心而自己出錢出版作品

blocks.def: a small group of people with shared interests, often one that does not want other people to join them
blocks.trans: （有共同興趣、常排外的）小圈子，小團體，小集團
examples:
a coterie of writers
作家小圈子

blocks.def: very respected and praised because of great importance or great age
blocks.trans: （因地位重要或年長而）受尊崇的，奉爲神聖的
examples:
hallowed icons such as Marilyn Monroe and James Dean
諸如瑪麗蓮‧夢露和詹姆斯‧迪恩等倍受尊崇的偶像

blocks.def: holy
examples:
Can atheists be buried in hallowed ground?
無神論者能葬在聖地裡嗎?

blocks.def: a discussion between two groups of people, especially one that is intended to end an argument
blocks.trans: （尤指欲結束爭論的）和談，會談，談判

blocks.def: a report, especially in a newspaper, that gives the news of someone's death and details about their life
stealing, especially (in the US) the crime of taking something that does not belong to you, without illegally entering a building to do so
blocks.trans: 盜竊罪；（尤指美國的非入室）偷盜，盜竊

blocks.def:
old-fashioned for
ophthalmologist
blocks.trans: 眼科醫師，眼科專家（ophthalmologist 的舊稱）

blocks.def: to complain about someone or something in an annoyed way
examples:
She spent the evening grumbling to me about her job.
她整晚都在向我抱怨她的工作。
 [ + speech ] "You never hang your coat up," she grumbled.
「你就從來不會把外套掛起來。」她埋怨道。

blocks.def: If your stomach grumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise, usually because you are hungry.
a person who complains a lot
blocks.trans: 牢騷滿腹的人，總是抱怨的人

blocks.def: a complaint
examples:
When the teacher assigned extra homework, she heard a few grumbles from the kids.
要是再讓我聽到你抱怨飯不好吃，你就自己做！

blocks.def: related to the belief that your own country is always best
blocks.trans: 沙文主義的，狹隘民族主義的
examples:
jingoistic nationalism
沙文民族主義，狹隘民族主義
 A lot of the war movies were very jingoistic. 
很多戰爭電影都充斥著沙文主義。

blocks.def: to be nervous or worried
examples:
Don't fret - I'm sure he's OK.
別發愁——他肯定沒事。
 She spent the day fretting about/over what she'd said to Nicky.
她為對尼基說的話而擔心了一整天。

blocks.def: any of the small raised metal bars across the long, thin part of a stringed musical instrument such as a guitar, that show you where to put your fingers on the strings in order to produce different notes
blocks.trans: （吉他等絃樂器指板上定音的）品

blocks.def: a feeling of anger, especially caused by someone damaging your feeling of being proud of yourself
blocks.trans: （尤指因自尊心受損而產生的）不悅，生氣
examples:
He stormed from the room in a fit of pique, shouting that he had been misunderstood.
他怒氣沖沖地衝出房間，大嚷著他被誤解了。

blocks.def: Something that is porous has many small holes, so liquid or air can pass through, especially slowly.
examples:
porous soil with good drainage
有良好排水系統的滲漏性土壤
 porous brick walls
多孔磚牆
 a porous polymer membrane
多孔聚合物膜

blocks.def: not protected enough to stop people going through
examples:
The border in this region is porous and many refugees have simply walked across.
這個地區的邊界管理很鬆懈，許多難民很容易就越過了。

blocks.def: causing harm or trouble
examples:
the baneful effects of corruption
腐敗的惡性影響 
He sought to remove his children from the baneful influences of the city.
他想讓自己的孩子遠離城市的惡劣影響。

blocks.def: a small smooth round stone, especially one found on a beach or in a river
blocks.trans: （尤指沙灘或河流中的）卵石，礫石
examples:
This part of the coast has pebble beaches.
海岸的這一部分有幾處礫石海灘。

blocks.def: a strong feeling of disapproval that most people in a society have about something, especially when this is unfair
blocks.trans: 恥辱；（尤指不公正的）惡名
examples:
There is no longer any stigma to being divorced.
離婚不再是甚麼恥辱的事了。
 Being an unmarried mother no longer carries the social stigma that it used to.
未婚媽媽不再像過去那樣在社會上背負惡名了。

blocks.def: the top of the central female part of a flower, where pollen is received

antediluvian.note: Antediluvian means "before the flood" — that is, the Biblical flood with Noah's ark.

blocks.def: extremely old-fashioned
blocks.trans: 早已過時的，十分老式的
examples:
My mother has some hopelessly antediluvian ideas about the role of women.
我母親對女性的角色持有一些老掉牙的觀念。

blocks.def: very happy, especially at someone else's defeat or failure
blocks.trans: （尤指因別人失敗而）歡欣鼓舞的，興高采烈的
examples:
an exultant cheer
因取勝而歡呼
 an exultant crowd
興高采烈的人群

blocks.def: careful not to give too much information or show how you really feel
blocks.trans: 謹慎的；有保留的，提防的
examples:
a guarded response
謹慎的答覆

blocks.def: a sign of what might happen in the future
examples:
These sales figures are a good augury for another profitable year.
這些銷售數字是個好兆頭，預示著接下來的一年將繼續盈利。

blocks.def: the skill of knowing what will happen in the future
examples:
His remarkable recovery defied all medical augury.
他奇跡般地康復了，所有的醫學預測都不攻自破。

blocks.def: to say officially that something, especially an earlier official decision, is no longer to be accepted
examples:
His conviction was quashed in March 1986 after his counsel argued that the police evidence was all lies.
他的辯護人舉證說明了警方的證據是一派謊言，於是在1986年3月撤銷了對他的判決。

blocks.def: to forcefully stop something that you do not want to happen
examples:
The revolt was swiftly quashed by government troops.
叛亂很快就被政府軍鎮壓住了。
 The company moved quickly to quash rumours/speculation that it is losing money.
公司迅速地採取行動，平息其虧損的謠言。

blocks.def: kindness when giving a punishment
blocks.trans: （施加懲罰時表現出的）寬厚，仁慈
examples:
The jury passed a verdict of guilty, with an appeal to the judge for clemency.
陪審團通過了有罪的判決，同時請求法官從寬處理。

blocks.def: (of weather) the quality of being pleasant or not severe
soft, wet ground, or an area of this
a toilet
examples:
I'm just going to nip to the bog.
我正要跑去上廁所。
 We've run out of bog paper/roll.
我們的廁紙用完了。

blocks.def: a special power that some people have naturally that makes them able to influence other people and attract their attention and admiration
blocks.trans: 超凡的個人魅力；吸引力；超凡氣質
examples:
On screen Garbo had this great charisma so that you couldn't take your eyes off her.
在銀幕上，嘉寶魅力非凡，讓人無法將眼光從她身上移開。
 How did a man of so little personal charisma get to be prime minister?
一個如此缺乏個人魅力的人是怎麼成為首相的？

blocks.def: the money or property belonging to someone that they say that, after their death, they wish to be given to other people
examples:
Her will included small bequests to her family, while most of her fortune went to charity.
她在遺囑中寫明將一小部分遺產留給家人，大部分都捐給慈善機構。

blocks.note: Pliant has both a literal and a figurative meaning. Pliant can describe something that is bendable — like a spine, a tree branch, a bendy straw — or it can describe something that is flexible, but less tangible. In this latter sense, pliant describes something that adjusts to conditions or is easily influenced.
blocks.def: Pliant people are easily influenced or controlled by other people.
examples:
I don't think it's a good thing for children to be too pliant.
我認為孩子太聽話了並不是件好事。

blocks.def: being able and willing to accept change or new ideas
blocks.trans: 善於變通的，能合乎時宜的，順勢應變的
examples:
In order to survive the recession, the company had to be pliant and adjust to the new economic conditions.
 The management has adopted a more pliant position, and has agreed to listen to the staff's requests.
管理階層採取了更靈活的立場，同意聽取員工的要求。

blocks.def: able to bend easily without breaking
examples:
These toys are made of pliant rubber, so they won't break.
這些玩具由柔韌橡膠製成，所以不會被弄壞。

blocks.def: using a very loud voice, or (of a voice) very loud
examples:
a stentorian preacher
聲若洪鐘的牧師
 Suddenly a stentorian voice boomed across the room.
突然，從房間那頭傳來一個洪亮的聲音。

blocks.def: a person who loves expensive things and pleasure
threatening to do something bad or to hurt someone
examples:
He gave me a baleful look.
他惡毒地瞪了我一眼。
 his baleful influence
他的兇惡勢力

blocks.def: any very serious infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people
a serious and growing problem
examples:
The report states that vandalism is a pestilence that must be stamped out.
該報告說明，惡意破壞行為是一種毒瘤，必須剷除。

blocks.def: to officially announce that something such as a law, agreement, or marriage no longer exists
blocks.trans: 廢除，取消（法律、協議等）；宣佈（婚姻）無效
examples:
His second marriage was annulled because he never divorced his first wife.
他的第二次婚姻被判無效，因為他從未與第一任妻子離婚。

blocks.def: to improve the quality, amount, or strength of something
examples:
These scandals will not enhance the organization's reputation.
這些醜聞並不會提高這個組織的聲譽。

blocks.def: done or said without any preparation or thought
blocks.trans: 即興的（地）；無準備的（地）；臨場的（地）
examples:
an extempore performance
即興表演
 At the audition, the actors were asked to perform extempore.
試鏡時，演員們被要求作即場表演。

blocks.def: tight or completely stretched
examples:
a taut rope
拉緊的繩子
 He kept his eyes on the road ahead, his face taut with concentration.
他眼睛盯著前方的道路，神情專注，臉緊繃著。

blocks.def: excited or nervous
examples:
His latest film was described as a taut thriller.
他的最新一部電影被歸為驚悚片。
 There was a taut edge to Chris's voice.
克里斯的聲音透著緊張。

blocks.def: Taut writing or speech is controlled, clear, and short.
examples:
taut prose
結構嚴謹的散文

blocks.def: having two opposing feelings at the same time, or being uncertain about how you feel
blocks.trans: （心情）矛盾的；模棱兩可的，含糊不定的
examples:
I felt very ambivalent about leaving home.
要離開家了，我心裡喜憂參半。
 He has fairly ambivalent feelings towards his father.
他對父親的感情很矛盾。
 an ambivalent attitude to exercise
既想鍛煉又怕吃苦的態度

blocks.def: the state of feeling of being ambivalent
examples:
her ambivalence towards men
她對男性的矛盾心理

blocks.def: to change or arrange something again, in order to improve it
examples:
We revamped the management system, but the business is doing no better than it was before.
我們對管理制度作了徹底改進，但是經營業績並不比從前好。

blocks.def: happening or moving quickly or within a short time, especially in a smooth and easy way
examples:
The police took swift action against the rioters.
警方對暴動人員迅速採取了行動。
 Thank you for your swift reply.
感謝您的即時回覆。
 The gazelle is one of the swiftest and most graceful of animals.
瞪羚是最敏捷、最優雅的動物之一。

blocks.def: a small bird with curved, pointed wings that can fly very fast
causing disagreement or discussion
examples:
a controversial issue/decision/speech/figure
有爭議的問題／決議／講話／數字
 The book was very controversial.
這本書很有爭議。

blocks.def: to make someone who is sad or disappointed feel better by giving them comfort or sympathy
examples:
He tried to console her, but she kept saying it was all her own fault.
他盡力安慰她，可是她不停地說那都是她自己的錯。
 I tried to console her with a box of chocolates.
我竭力想用一盒巧克力來撫慰她。
UK I was consoling Liz on having broken up with her boyfriend.
莉茲跟男友分手了，我在安慰她。

blocks.def: a surface on which you find the controls for a piece of electrical equipment or a machine
blocks.trans: （電子設備或機器的）操縱臺，控制臺，儀表板
examples:
a gaming console
遊戲機

blocks.def: an unexpectedly successful achievement
examples:
It was a tremendous coup for the local paper to get an exclusive interview with Prince Charles.
當地報紙能獨家採訪到查爾斯王子是破天荒的成功。
 I got him to come to a party, which was something of a coup.
我說服了他來參加聚會，實屬意外之得。

blocks.def: a sudden illegal, often violent, taking of government power, especially by part of an army
examples:
a military coup
軍事政變

blocks.def: to begin a discussion of something difficult
examples:
At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know how to broach the subject with him.
我們最終必須談到錢，但我不知道如何向他提這個問題。

blocks.def: to open a bottle or barrel in order to drink its contents
examples:
Shall we broach another cask of wine?
我們再開桶葡萄酒喝好嗎？

blocks.def:
a 
brooch
very shiny
examples:
long, lustrous hair
光亮的長髮

blocks.def: to treat someone or something unfairly by disapproving of him, her, or it
examples:
People should not be stigmatized on the basis of race.
人們不應因其種族而受到侮辱。

blocks.def: a situation in which you do not have things or conditions that are usually considered necessary for a pleasant life
examples:
They used sleep deprivation as a form of torture.
他們把不讓人睡覺作為一種折磨人的手段。
 There is awful deprivation in the shanty towns.
貧民區的生活條件十分糟糕。
 There were food shortages and other deprivations during the Civil War.
南北戰事期間，食品短缺，物資匱乏。

blocks.def: to cause someone to be liked by someone
examples:
She is unlikely to endear herself to her colleagues with such an aggressive approach.
她這種咄咄逼人的態度使她很難受到同事們的歡迎。

blocks.def: shining gently
examples:
a lambent glow
柔和的光亮

blocks.def: the ability to use words in a clever and humorous way without being unkind
very strange and unusual
blocks.trans: 怪誕的；罕見的；異乎尋常的
examples:
a bizarre situation
異乎尋常的情形
 bizarre behaviour
怪誕的行為

blocks.def: to fix beliefs or ideas in someone's mind, especially by repeating them often
examples:
Our coach has worked hard to inculcate a team spirit in/into the players.
我們的教練努力給運動員灌輸團隊精神。

blocks.def: a reporter for radio or television who provides a spoken description of and remarks on an event, especially a sports competition, as it happens
blocks.trans: （廣播或電視的）解說員，評論員
examples:
a radio commentator
電臺解說員
 a sports/football commentator.
體育節目／足球評述員

blocks.def: someone whose job is examining people's eyes and selling glasses or contact lenses to correct sight problems
the quality of being true, honest, or accurate
examples:
Doubts were cast on the veracity of her alibi.
她不在場證據的真實性開始受到懷疑。

blocks.def: to lower your head or body in fear, often while moving backwards
examples:
Stop cowering! I'm not going to hit you.
別往後縮了！我不會打你的。

blocks.def: a large, strong box in which money or valuable objects are kept
blocks.trans: （存放錢或貴重物品的）保險箱；貴重物品箱

blocks.def: the money that an organization has in its bank accounts and available to spend
blocks.trans: （某一組織的帳戶中可使用的）資金，金庫
examples:
government/party coffers
政府／政黨的資金儲備

blocks.def: real and not imaginary; able to be shown, touched, or experienced
blocks.trans: 真實的；非想像的；可觸摸的；可感知的
examples:
We need tangible evidence if we're going to take legal action.
如果我們要採取法律行動，就需要有實實在在的證據。
 Other tangible benefits include an increase in salary and shorter working hours.
其他實實在在的好處包括加薪和縮短工作時間。

blocks.def: a very stupid person
to persuade someone, for example by offering them money, to commit an illegal act, especially to tell lies in a court of law
examples:
He is a liar, and he suborned perjury from her early on in this investigation.
他是個騙子，在這次調查的早期就唆使她作偽證。
 Such agreements could undermine the justice system by providing an incentive to suppress evidence, or even to suborn witnesses. 
這種協定可能會破壞司法系統，因為它鼓勵壓制證據甚至收買證人。

blocks.def: to take control of a position of power, especially without having the right to
examples:
Local control is being usurped by central government.
地方的權力被中央政府攫取了。

blocks.def: an opening or hole, especially one in the body, such as the mouth
examples:
humorous I was stuffing cake into every available orifice.
我身上能塞的地方全都塞滿了蛋糕。
formal The driver was bleeding from every orifice.
司機七孔流血。

blocks.def: expressing an idea or opinion in a clear and direct way that shows good understanding of what is important
examples:
incisive questions/comments
尖銳的問題／深刻的評論

blocks.def: a long, wide hole that is dug all the way around a place such as a castle and usually filled with water, to make it more difficult to attack
to move a train or carriage onto a different track in or near a station using a special railway engine designed for this purpose
to move someone or something from one place to another, usually because that person or thing is not wanted, and without considering any unpleasant effects
examples:
I spent most of my childhood being shunted (about) between my parents who had divorced when I was five.
我五歲時父母離異，童年的大部分時間都在離婚的父母之間輾轉。
 He shunts his kids off to a camp every summer.
他每年夏天都送孩子們去參加夏令營。
 Viewers are sick of their favourite sitcoms being shunted to later times to make way for live sports coverage.
因現場直播體育比賽而把深受觀眾喜愛的情景喜劇往後順延，許多人對此表示不滿。

blocks.def: a hole or passage that allows liquid to move from one part of the body to another, either found naturally in the body or put into the body in an operation
blocks.trans: （身體不同部分之間自然或通過手術開啟的可讓液體流動）的通路

blocks.def: to laugh or shout insults at someone to show you have no respect for them
examples:
The people at the back of the hall jeered (at) the speaker.
坐在禮堂後面的人嘲笑發言者。

blocks.def: to remove parts of a piece of writing that are considered likely to cause offence
blocks.trans: 刪除（不當之處）；刪去（可能使人反感的地方）
examples:
The book was expurgated to make it suitable for children.
這本書是經過刪改的，以適合兒童閱讀。

blocks.def: surprised, confused, and not certain how to react
blocks.trans: 驚慌的；迷惑的；不知所措的
examples:
I was completely nonplussed by his reply.
他的回答令我完全不知所措。

blocks.def: a very deep, narrow opening in rock, ice, or the ground
blocks.trans: （岩石、地面或冰面的）裂隙；峽谷；深淵
examples:
They leaned over the rails and peered down into the dizzying chasm below.
他們靠在欄杆上向下凝視令人暈眩的深淵。

blocks.def: a very large difference between two opinions or groups of people
blocks.trans: （兩種觀點或兩個團體之間的）深刻分歧，顯著差別
examples:
There is still a vast economic chasm between developed and developing countries.
發達國家和發展中國家之間仍然存在著巨大的經濟差距。

blocks.def: a silly or stupid person
curving and twisting like a snake
blocks.trans: 像蛇一樣捲曲的；蜿蜒的
examples:
We followed the serpentine course of the river.
我們沿著彎彎曲曲的河道走。

blocks.def: complicated and difficult to understand
examples:
The film's serpentine plot was difficult to follow.
電影曲折的情節讓人難以理解。

blocks.def: complete and in the original state
blocks.trans: 完整無缺的；未經觸動的
examples:
The church was destroyed in the bombing but the altar survived intact.
教堂在轟炸中被毀，但神壇卻完好無損。

blocks.def: not damaged
examples:
It's difficult to emerge from such a scandal with your reputation still intact.
經歷這樣的醜聞難保你的名聲不受損害。

blocks.def: something that is offered as a religious sacrifice
examples:
Incense was used for purification and as an oblation to ancestors.
香用來滌罪，也用來祭祀祖先。

blocks.def: the giving of bread and wine to God in the Christian ceremony of the Eucharist
blocks.trans: （聖餐儀式中）麵包和酒的供奉；聖餐儀式

blocks.def: to make someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal
examples:
He will be extradited to Arizona from Florida.
他將被從佛羅里達州引渡到亞利桑那州。

blocks.def: a sudden and powerful expression of strong feeling, especially one that you cannot control
examples:
In a sudden paroxysm of jealousy he threw her clothes out of the window.
他突然妒火中燒，將她的衣服扔到窗外。
 paroxysms of laughter
陣陣狂笑

blocks.def: to press something such as soil or tobacco down firmly
to intentionally copy another person's characteristics, such as their behaviour, speech, appearance, or expressions, especially to make people laugh
examples:
She's the woman who impersonates all the celebrities on TV.
她是在電視上扮演各種名人的那個人。

blocks.def: to attempt to deceive someone by pretending that you are another person
examples:
He was fined for impersonating a police officer.
他因假冒員警而被罰款。

blocks.def: a person or thing that is perfect or has an extremely large amount of a particular good characteristic
blocks.trans: 完人，盡善盡美的模範（或典型）
examples:
In the novel, Constanza is a paragon of virtue.
在這本小說中，康斯坦薩是一個美德的典範。

blocks.def: a fashion or general liking, especially one that is temporary
examples:
In the 1920s, short hair for women became the vogue.
20世紀20年代，女性留短髮成為時尚。
 The postwar vogue for tearing down buildings virtually destroyed the city's architecture.
戰後盛行的拆毀建築行為實際上破壞了該城市的建築風格。
 The short hemline is very much in vogue (= fashionable) this spring.
今年春天短裙非常時興。
 "Community" is one of the vogue words of the new government.
「社區」是新政府使用最多的詞語之一。

blocks.def: strange; not seeming real; like a dream
blocks.trans: 離奇的；超現實的；夢幻般的
examples:
Driving through the total darkness was a slightly surreal experience.
在一片漆黑中開車，有點像在夢境一般。

blocks.def: to get money from someone unfairly or dishonestly
examples:
He bilked clients out of tens of millions of dollars.
他從客戶身上詐騙了幾千萬元。

blocks.def: the feeling of being annoyed, especially because you can do nothing to solve a problem
examples:
There is growing exasperation within the government at the failure of these policies to reduce unemployment.
由於這些減少失業的政策不能產生效用，政府內部越來越多人感到懊惱。
 After ten hours of fruitless negotiations, he stormed out of the meeting in exasperation.
經過十個小時徒勞無功的漫長談判，他憤然衝出會場。

blocks.def: (the performance of) words that are believed to have a magical effect when spoken or sung
examples:
Around the fire, tribal elders chanted incantations.
部族長老圍著火堆唸誦起咒語。

blocks.def: to make someone remember something or feel an emotion
examples:
That smell always evokes memories of my old school.
那種氣味經常喚起我對母校的回憶。
 a detergent designed to evoke the fresh smell of summer meadows
旨在使人想起夏天草地清爽氣息的清潔劑

blocks.def: someone who pretends to be something they are not, or to have qualities that they do not have
blocks.trans: 故作姿態的人，裝腔作勢的人
examples:
You look like a real poseur in your fancy sports car!
坐在昂貴的跑車裡，你看起來真夠招搖的！

blocks.def: an illegal drug such as heroin or cocaine
blocks.trans: 毒品（如海洛因或古柯鹼）
examples:
He faces three years in jail for selling narcotics.
他因出售毒品而面臨三年的監禁。

blocks.def: a drug that makes you want to sleep and prevents you feeling pain
examples:
Morphine is a narcotic.
嗎啡是一種麻醉劑。

blocks.def: relating to drugs that make you want to sleep and prevent pain
examples:
narcotic drugs
麻醉劑
 a narcotic effect
催眠效果

blocks.def: to say that someone has done something illegal or wrong without giving proof
examples:
[ + (that) ] The two men allege (that) the police forced them to make false confessions.
這兩名男子聲稱警方逼迫他們作假口供。
 [ + to infinitive ] She is alleged to have been at the centre of an international drug ring.
據稱她一直是某國際販毒集團的核心人物。
 [ + that ] It was alleged that Johnson had struck Mr Rahim on the head.
據稱約翰遜打了拉希姆先生的頭。

blocks.def: (of beliefs) so firmly held that they are not likely to change
examples:
Such ingrained prejudices cannot be corrected easily.
如此根深蒂固的偏見是不容易糾正的。
 The belief that you should own your house is deeply ingrained in our society.
在我們的社會中，應該擁有自己的住房這一觀念根深蒂固。

blocks.def: Ingrained dirt has got under the surface of something and is difficult to remove.
blocks.trans: （塵土等）深嵌著的，難以去除的
examples:
The oil had become ingrained in his skin.
油污已滲入他的皮膚。

blocks.def: (of a person) friendly and in a good mood, or (of a situation) enjoyable because of being friendly and pleasant
blocks.trans: （人）友善快活的；（情況）令人愉快的
examples:
He seemed a very jovial guy.
他看起來是個很和善快樂的人。
 a jovial time/evening/chat
愉快的時光／夜晚／閒談

blocks.def: (of a person's face) more pale than usual and tired-looking
abbreviation for Wide Area Network: a computer network that connects separate machines over a wide area, for example in different countries, using telecommunication systems
blocks.trans: 廣域網路（ Wide Area Network的縮寫）

blocks.def: a feeling of being bored and mentally tired caused by having nothing interesting or exciting to do
blocks.trans: （由於無所事事而感到的）無聊，厭倦，倦怠
examples:
The whole country seems to be affected by the ennui of winter.
冬天的倦怠感似乎影響著整個國家。

blocks.def: willing to do what other people want you to do
examples:
a compliant child
聽話的孩子

blocks.def: used to describe something that obeys a particular rule or law
examples:
The company expects to be reclassified as soon as its factories are fully compliant with the Federal Clean Air Act.
一旦屬下工廠完全符合《聯邦清潔空氣法案》定下的規則，這家公司預計將會盡快被重新定類。

blocks.def: the act or feeling of showing great happiness about something
examples:
There was much rejoicing at/over the good news.
聽到這個好消息大家都高興極了。

blocks.def: to spoil something or make it weaker so that it is less effective
examples:
A recurring knee injury may have impaired his chances of winning the tournament.
復發的膝傷可能降低了他在錦標賽中獲勝的機會。

blocks.def: to move slowly from side to side
examples:
The trees were swaying in the wind.
樹在風中搖曳。
 The movement of the ship caused the mast to sway from side to side/back and forth.
桅杆隨著船的行駛左右／前後搖擺。
 A drunk was standing in the middle of the street, swaying uncertainly and trying hard to stay upright.
一個醉漢搖搖晃晃地站在街道中間，努力想要站直身子。

blocks.def: to cause something to move or change
examples:
Recent developments have swayed the balance of power in the region.
最近的發展使這個地區的實力均勢產生了改變。

blocks.def: to persuade someone to believe or do one thing rather than another
examples:
Her speech failed to sway her colleagues into supporting the plan.
她的演說沒能說服她的同事們支持這個計劃。

blocks.def: control or influence
examples:
In the 1980s, the organization came under the sway of (= became strongly influenced by) Christian fundamentalism.
在1980年代，這個組織深受基督教基本教義的影響。
 Her parents no longer seem to have much sway over her.
她的父母似乎再也管不了她。
 The party could hold sway (= have an important influence) on some crucial votes.
該黨可對一些關鍵選票施加重要影響。

blocks.def: to collect something, usually after much work or with difficulty
blocks.trans: （通常指做大量工作或經歷很多困難而）收集，積累，獲得
examples:
Coppola garnered several Oscar awards for "The Godfather".
哥普拉以其執導的電影《教父》獲得數項奧斯卡奬。

blocks.def: a person who thinks and acts in an independent way, often behaving differently from the expected or usual way
blocks.trans: 特立獨行的人，行為不合常規的人
examples:
a political maverick
持不同政見者
 He was considered as something of a maverick in the publishing world.
他被認為是出版界的一個特立獨行者。

blocks.def: the study of birds
skilful hiding of the truth in order to trick people
examples:
The survey suggests nearly half the electorate believes the president won through electoral legerdemain. 
調查顯示，近一半選民認為總統是採用欺騙贏得大選的。

blocks.def: skilful tricks done as part of a performance
examples:
There are traditional acts of legerdemain with bright scarves and floating balls.
有傳統的變戲法表演，用的是鮮豔的圍巾和漂浮球。

blocks.def: the act of creating or using words that include sounds that are similar to the noises the words refer to
a piece of music that is an introduction to a longer piece, especially an opera
examples:
the overture to "The Magic Flute"
《魔笛》序曲

blocks.def: a communication made to someone in order to offer something
examples:
overtures of friendship.
友好的表示
 Neither side in the conflict seems willing to make peace overtures.
衝突雙方似乎都不願意主動向對方示好。
informal So he's been making overtures (= showing a sexual interest), has he?
那麼說他一直在示愛，是嗎？

blocks.def: a humorous poem with five lines
not measured, counted, or clearly known
examples:
An indeterminate number of workers have already been exposed to the danger.
一些工人已處在這種危險中，具體人數尚不清楚。
 a man of indeterminate age
年齡不詳的男子

blocks.def: a strange habit or characteristic that is seen as not important and not harming anyone
blocks.trans: （無傷大雅的）怪癖，小毛病，小缺點
examples:
We all have our little foibles.
我們都有自己的小毛病。

blocks.def: staying the same for a long time and not changing quickly or unexpectedly
blocks.trans: 長期不變的；堅定的，不動搖的
examples:
a steadfast friend/ally
忠實的朋友／盟友
 steadfast loyalty
毫不動搖的忠誠
 The group remained steadfast in its support for the new system, even when it was criticized in the newspapers.
這個團體始終堅定不移地支持新體制，即使遭到報紙批評的時候也毫不動搖。

blocks.def: something that makes you suffer
examples:
Malnutrition is one of the common afflictions of the poor.
營養不良是困擾窮人的常見問題之一。

blocks.def: likely to get angry and argue with people
examples:
He had been in an ornery mood all day, arguing with everyone who got in his way.
他一整天脾氣都很壞，跟每個妨礙了他的人都發生了爭吵。

blocks.def: unexpected and not convenient or unpleasant
examples:
Unless anything untoward happens we should arrive just before midday.
除非發生意外，否則我們應該是剛好在中午前到達。

blocks.def: the skill or act of saying or discovering what will happen in the future
having a very strong but not usually lasting feeling of love or attraction for someone or something
examples:
She was infatuated with her boss.
她對她的老闆很著迷。

blocks.def: a young bird that has grown feathers and is learning to fly
new and without experience
blocks.trans: 新的，剛開始的；缺乏經驗的
examples:
The current economic climate is particularly difficult for fledgling businesses.
目前的經濟氣候對剛起步的公司來說特別艱難。

blocks.def: to make something possible or easier
examples:
The new ramp will facilitate the entry of wheelchairs.
新的坡道將可方便輪椅進入。
 The current structure does not facilitate efficient work flow.
當前的體系不利於實施高效的工作流程。

blocks.def: to suddenly or unexpectedly see something, especially something a long distance away
blocks.trans: 突然（或意外地）看見（尤指遠處的東西）
examples:
She suddenly espied someone waving at her from the window.
她突然看到有人正在視窗向她揮手。

blocks.def: the general set of ideas, beliefs, feelings, etc. that is typical of a particular period in history
blocks.trans: （某一特定歷史時期的）時代思潮，時代精神

blocks.def: a person who praises and is artificially pleasant to people in authority, usually in order to get some advantage from them
a prayer
examples:
His orisons being concluded, he laid himself down and slept.
他禱告完，躺下睡去。

blocks.def: the best or most extreme example of something
blocks.trans: 典範；最完美的榜樣；極致
examples:
Most people agree that her acting career achieved its apotheosis in this movie.
多數人認為她的演藝事業透過這部電影達到了巔峰。
 Bad taste in clothes reached its apotheosis in the 1970s.
20世紀70年代，人們對於衣著的惡俗品味已經無以復加。

blocks.def: the act of making someone into a god
blocks.trans: 尊奉（某人）為神`（聖）；神化（某人）
examples:
the apotheosis of the Emperor Trajan
羅馬皇帝圖拉真冊封為神

blocks.def: a combination of sounds or musical notes that are not pleasant when heard together
examples:
the jarring dissonance of Klein's musical score
克萊茵樂譜中刺耳的不和諧音

blocks.def: disagreement
the feeling that you are going to vomit
examples:
Signs of the illness include fever, nausea, and vomiting.
這種病的癥狀包括發燒、噁心和嘔吐。

blocks.def: to fall towards the inside with force
examples:
The vacuum inside the tube caused it to implode when the external air pressure was increased.
隨著外部氣壓的增加，管內真空使管中發生內爆。

blocks.def: to fail suddenly and completely and be unable to operate
examples:
Their economy is in danger of imploding.
他們的經濟有崩潰的危險。

blocks.def: the quality of being spoken or written in a way that is direct, clever, and cruel
examples:
She was known for her acerbity.
她以刻薄著稱。
 "Do be quiet, Paul," Monica said, with unaccustomed acerbity.
“安靜，保羅，”莫妮卡說，語調裏帶著不尋常的尖酸刻薄。

blocks.def: intentionally keeping something secret
blocks.trans: 故作神秘的；遮遮掩掩的；含糊其詞的
examples:
She's very coy about her age.
她對自己的年齡遮遮掩掩。

blocks.def: (especially of women) being or pretending to be shy, or like a child
blocks.trans: （尤指女性）害羞的，靦腆的，忸怩作態的
examples:
She gave me a coy look from under her schoolgirl's fringe.
她透過她那學生式的瀏海羞答答地瞥了我一眼。

blocks.def: unpleasantly bright in colour or decoration
blocks.trans: 俗麗的；花哨的；過於鮮艶的
examples:
gaudy plastic flowers
俗麗的塑膠假花

blocks.def: an official statement that something must happen
examples:
The decree stopped short of a full declaration of independence.
這項法令差一點就宣佈完全獨立了。
 More than 200 people were freed by military decree.
軍方下令釋放200多人。

blocks.def: to officially decide or order that something must happen
blocks.trans: 頒佈法令，下達政令；發出命令
examples:
They decreed an end to discrimination on grounds of age.
他們下令不准再有年齡歧視。
 [ + that ] After the earthquake, the government decreed that all new buildings must be built according to the new standards.
地震之後，政府下達政令，要求所有新建樓房必須按照新的標準施工。

blocks.def: to tell someone about something
examples:
The president has been apprised of the situation.
總統已經獲知了這個情況。

blocks.def: to increase someone's interest in and wish for something, usually by giving them a small experience of it
blocks.trans: 勾起（某人）的興趣；增加（某人）的慾望
examples:
I've read an excerpt of the book on the Web and it's whetted my appetite.
我在網上讀過這部書的節選，引起了我強烈的興趣。
 That one kiss had whetted his appetite.
那個吻激起了他的慾望。

blocks.def: to sharpen the blade of a knife or similar tool
examples:
He whetted his knife against the stone.
他在石頭上磨刀。

blocks.def: to attract or please someone very much
examples:
The audience was clearly enchanted by her performance.
觀眾顯然陶醉於她的演出中。

blocks.def: to have a magical effect on someone or something
a person who is or seems to be interested in a subject, but whose understanding of it is not very deep or serious
blocks.trans: 一知半解者；半吊子；業餘愛好者
examples:
He's a bit of a dilettante as far as wine is concerned.
就對酒的研究而言，他只是有點愛好而已。

blocks.def: a person who pretends to have skills or knowledge that they do not have, especially in medicine
blocks.trans: 冒充內行的人；騙子；（尤指）江湖醫生

blocks.def: An acrid smell or taste is strong and bitter and causes a burning feeling in the throat.
blocks.trans: （氣味或味道）辛辣的，苦的；刺激的，嗆人的
examples:
Clouds of acrid smoke issued from the building.
樓內冒出陣陣刺鼻的濃煙。

blocks.def: a sudden attack on or act of going into a place, especially across a border
examples:
incursions into enemy territory
攻入敵方領土

blocks.def: an occasion when people suddenly involve themselves in another person's private situation
able to cause disease
to make something else seem better or more attractive when combining with it
blocks.trans: 補充；補足；使完善；為…增色
examples:
Strawberries and cream complement each other perfectly.
草莓加鮮奶油相得益彰。
 The music complements her voice perfectly.
音樂完美地襯托出她的嗓音。

blocks.def: a part of a clause that usually follows the verb in English and adds more information about the subject or object
a person who knows a lot about many different subjects
a line on cloth or paper where it has been folded or crushed
examples:
He ironed a crease down the front of each trouser leg.
他在每條褲腿的正面熨出一條褶痕來。

blocks.def: a line drawn on the ground where the player stands to hit the ball in cricket
blocks.trans: （板球打擊手擊球的）區域線，擊球線

blocks.def: If cloth, paper, etc. creases, or if you crease it, it gets a line in it where it has been folded or crushed.
examples:
The seat belt has creased my blouse.
安全帶把我的襯衫弄皺了。
 It's a nice dress, but it creases very easily.
這條裙子很漂亮，但很容易起皺。

blocks.def: the ability, especially of a medicine or a method of achieving something, to produce the intended result
examples:
They recently ran a series of tests to measure the efficacy of the drug.
他們最近進行了一系列的試驗來檢測這種藥的功效。

blocks.def: a slow way of speaking in which the vowel sounds are made longer and words are not separated clearly
blocks.trans: 說話拉長音，說話拉長調子
examples:
a southern/Texan/mid-Atlantic drawl
南方／得克薩斯州／中大西洋地區拉長音的說話腔調

blocks.def: soft and fat
examples:
flabby arms/thighs
肥胖的手臂／大腿
 I was starting to get a bit flabby around my waist.
我腰部的肉開始有點鬆弛了。

blocks.def: weak and without force
examples:
a flabby argument
說服力弱的論據

blocks.def: to make a law, agreement, order, or decision no longer have any (legal) power
examples:
The policy of charging air travellers for vegetarian meals proved unpopular and has already been rescinded.
事實證明，航空公司向素食乘客收取素餐費的做法不得人心，因而已被取消。

blocks.def: an economic, political, and social system in which property, business, and industry are privately owned, directed towards making the greatest possible profits for successful organizations and people
having a negative or harmful effect on something
examples:
The match has been cancelled because of adverse weather conditions.
由於天氣惡劣，這場比賽已被取消。
 They received a lot of adverse publicity/criticism about the changes.
這些變化為他們招致種種負面報導／非議。
 So far the drug is thought not to have any adverse effects.
迄今為止，人們一直認為這種藥物沒有任何副作用。

blocks.def: a large fire that causes a lot of damage
a large and violent event, such as a war, involving a lot of people
examples:
The government has turned a minor local problem into a full-blown regional conflagration.
政府把一個地方性的小問題演變爲一場全面的地區衝突。

blocks.def: a period when a country or organization does not have a leader
blocks.trans: （國家或組織的）權力空白期，空位期

blocks.def: feeling sad and sorry for yourself, especially after you have drunk a lot of alcohol
blocks.trans: （尤指醉酒後）感情脆弱的，傷感的

blocks.def: to get money dishonestly from someone by deceiving or cheating them
examples:
They swindled local businesses out of thousands of dollars.
他們詐騙了當地企業幾千美元。

blocks.def: to make someone tired and unable to think clearly
blocks.trans: 使疲憊而思維不清，使因疲勞而昏昏沉沉

blocks.def: to surprise or shock someone very much
a song, film, or piece of writing that praises someone or something very enthusiastically
blocks.trans: 讚歌；以頌揚為主題的影片（或短文）；頌讚
examples:
The song is a paean to solitude and independence.
這首歌是讚美獨處和獨立的。

blocks.def: total, or expressed in a clear and certain way
blocks.trans: 完全的；表達明確的；毫不含糊的
examples:
The prime minister, he said, had the party's unequivocal support.
他說首相得到了全黨堅定不移的支援。
 The church has been unequivocal in its condemnation of the violence.
教會明確譴責該暴力事件。

blocks.def: (of something bad) getting worse quickly and in an uncontrolled way
examples:
rampant corruption
腐敗猖獗
 Rampant inflation means that our wage increases soon become worth nothing.
通貨膨脹漲個不停，這意味著我們增長的工資很快就一錢不值了。
 He said that he had encountered rampant prejudice in his attempts to get a job.
他說他在找工作時，四處遭受歧視。
 Disease is rampant in the overcrowded city.
疾病在過分擁擠的城市中肆虐。

blocks.def: (of an animal represented on a coat of arms) standing on its back legs with its front legs raised
blocks.trans: （紋章上所繪的動物）用後腿站立的，躍立的
examples:
a lion rampant
躍立的雄獅紋章圖案

blocks.def: honest, not able to deceive
examples:
She regarded him with wide, guileless blue eyes.
她瞪著一雙純真無邪的藍色大眼睛看著他。

blocks.def: the quality of being truculent (= unpleasant and likely to argue a lot)
examples:
His good mood gradually gave way to truculence when she didn't pay him any attention.
在她不理會他的情況下，他的好心情逐漸變得好鬥易怒。
 Michael's truculence doesn't allow him to back down.
邁克爾的好鬥性格不允許他退縮。

blocks.def: energy and enthusiasm
examples:
At 87, Minna's still full of vim and vigour.
87歲的明娜仍然充滿了活力。

blocks.def: a spoken attack
examples:
The members of parliament hurled brickbats at the minister.
議員們氣勢洶洶地譴責部長。
 She responded angrily to the brickbats thrown at her.
她憤怒地回應對她的攻擊。
