If an action rebounds on you, it does not have the effect you hoped for but has an unpleasant effect on you instead.
blocks.trans: 産生事與願違的結果；適得其反
examples:
His continual demands for sympathy rebounded on him because his friends finally stopped listening.
他沒完沒了地希望從別人那裡得到同情，結果卻適得其反，因為最終他的朋友們都不願再聽他訴苦。

blocks.def: to rise in price after a fall
examples:
Cotton rebounded from declines early in the day to end at a higher price.
棉花價格在今天較早時下跌之後反彈收高。

blocks.def: the act of rebounding
examples:
I hit the ball on the rebound (= after it had hit the wall or ground once).
球反彈回來時被我擊中了。

blocks.def: in sports, a ball or puck (= small, round, hard object used in ice hockey) that becomes available after an unsuccessful attempt to score, or an occasion when this happens
blocks.trans: （體育比賽中）試圖得分未成功之後的反彈球

blocks.def: in basketball, an occasion when a player successfully gets the ball after a shot (= attempt to score) has been missed
blocks.trans: （籃球比賽中）成功搶得投籃未中之後的反彈球
examples:
Over three games he averaged 14.0 points and 8.7 rebounds.
三場比賽中他平均每場得分14.0分，獲反彈球8.7個。

blocks.def: a piece of spoken or written advice about how someone should behave
examples:
He launched into a homily on family relationships.
他開始就家庭關係進行說教。

blocks.def: near
examples:
She must have written nigh on (= nearly but not quite) 50 books.
她肯定已經寫了接近50本著作了。
 The time is nigh (= it is nearly time) for us to make a decision.
快到我們作決定的時候了。

blocks.def: farming
examples:
He gave a lecture on crop and animal husbandry.
他舉辦了一個關於農作物種植和動物養殖的講座。

blocks.def: the careful use of money, food, supplies, etc.
blocks.trans: （對金錢、食物、物資等的）妥善使用，節儉使用

blocks.def: lasting forever or for a very long time
examples:
The company is engaged in the eternal search for a product that will lead the market.
該公司一直在尋找可以引領市場的産品。
 Will you two never stop your eternal arguing!
你們倆永遠也爭吵不完！

blocks.def: a short pause in which nothing happens or is said, or a space where something is missing
examples:
The company expects to resume production of the vehicle again after a two-month hiatus.
該公司希望在中斷兩個月之後恢復生產這種車。

blocks.def: someone who strongly supports a particular belief or political movement
blocks.trans: （信仰或政治運動的）宣導者，鼓吹者，先驅
examples:
an apostle of world peace/liberty
世界和平／自由的宣導者

blocks.def: the group of early Christians who travelled to different places telling people about Jesus Christ
not intelligent
blocks.trans: 缺乏才智的；愚蠢的；無知的
examples:
He is lazy, unintelligent, and rude.
他懶惰、愚蠢而且粗魯。
 unintelligent journalism
愚蠢的新聞報導

blocks.def: someone, especially a member of a religious group, who lives by asking people they do not know for money
friendly, kind, or helpful, like the expected behaviour of an uncle
blocks.trans: 叔伯般的；慈祥的；關懷備至的
examples:
an avuncular, quietly spoken man
慈祥和善、談吐溫和的男子
 His avuncular image belies his steely determination.
他慈祥的外貌和他堅強的意志形成鮮明的對照。

blocks.def: a person who is very rich and successful in business or industry
examples:
a well-known shipping magnate
赫赫有名的船王

blocks.def: unable to be trusted, or showing no loyalty
examples:
She described the new criminal bill as a perfidious attack on democracy.
她稱新的刑法法案是對民主的肆意踐踏。

blocks.def: to come together in a large group of people or animals
examples:
A crowd congregated around the entrance to the theatre, hoping to catch a glimpse of the stars of the show.
一群人聚集在戲院門口，希望能看一眼演出的明星。

blocks.def: connected with the ability to smell
examples:
the olfactory nerve
嗅覺神經

blocks.def: belonging to a class of people who hold high social rank
examples:
an aristocratic family
貴族家庭
 His aristocratic manner alienated many voters.
他的貴族做派使很多選民對他敬而遠之。

blocks.def: using something or someone as a way of getting help, especially in a difficult or dangerous situation
blocks.trans: （尤指在艱難或危險的情況下）依靠，依賴，求助
examples:
It is hoped that the dispute will be settled without recourse to litigation.
人們希望這場爭端能夠不透過對簿公堂在私下解決。

blocks.def: a person who is guilty of heresy
likely to make sharp, slightly cruel remarks; having a slightly angry and unpleasant manner
blocks.trans: 尖刻的，刻毒的；暴躁的，易怒的
examples:
She had a waspish tongue which could hurt.
她說話尖刻，容易傷人。

blocks.def: area or length; amount
examples:
From the top of the Empire State Building, you can see the full extent of Manhattan (= the area it covers).
你可以從帝國大廈的頂樓看到曼哈頓全景。
 We don't yet know the extent of his injuries (= how bad his injuries are).
我們還不知道他的傷勢有多嚴重。
 Rosie's teacher was impressed by the extent of her knowledge (= how much she knew).
羅西的知識很豐富，給她的老師留下了深刻的印象。
 The River Nile is over 6,500 6,5000 kilometres in extent (= length).
尼羅河長6500多公里。

blocks.def: the degree to which something happens or is likely to happen
examples:
She had not realized the extent to which the children had been affected.
她還沒有意識到孩子們受影響的程度。

blocks.def: so strongly that
examples:
Some people hold their beliefs very strongly, even to the extent of being prepared to go to prison for them.
一些人信仰堅定，甚至為之入獄也在所不惜。

blocks.def: to a particular degree or stage, often causing particular results
examples:
Sales have fallen badly this year, to the extent that we will have to close some of our shops.
今年的銷售額大幅下降，情況差到不得不關閉一些店。

blocks.def: to the same degree as; as much as
blocks.trans: 在同樣的程度上；同樣，一樣
examples:
The rich will not benefit from the proposed changes to the tax system to the same extent as the lower paid.
如果實施了提議的稅制改革，有錢人和低收入戶的受益程度將會有所區別。

blocks.def: partly
examples:
To some extent, she was responsible for the accident.
她要為事故負部分責任。

blocks.def: so much
examples:
The car was damaged to such an extent that it couldn't be repaired.
汽車損毀嚴重，已經無法再維修了。

blocks.def: how much
examples:
To what extent will the budget have to be modified?
預算必須做多大程度的修改？
 To what extent do you think he's aware of the problem?
你認為他對問題的嚴重程度了解多少？

blocks.def: more than is usual or natural
examples:
Anger gave me preternatural strength, and I managed to force the door open.
我一氣之下使出不尋常的力氣，硬把門撞開了。

blocks.def: to be the father of
examples:
In the Bible it says that Adam begat Cain and Abel.
《聖經》中說亞當生了該隱和亞伯。

blocks.def: to cause
examples:
Poverty begets hunger, and hunger begets crime.
貧窮導致饑餓，饑餓則導致犯罪。

blocks.def: in a state of being upset, nervous, and worried
blocks.trans: 過度煩亂的，過度緊張的，過度焦慮的；神經質的
examples:
She was so tired and overwrought that she burst into tears.
她太累太緊張，突然大哭起來。
 He was in an overwrought state/condition for weeks after the accident.
事故發生後的好幾週，他都處於神經質狀態。

blocks.def: to drink something quickly or in large amounts
a feeling of spinning around and being unable to balance, often caused by looking down from a height
examples:
She can't stand heights and has always suffered from vertigo.
她恐高，總是會感到眩暈。

blocks.def: existing in a wild state, especially describing an animal that was previously kept by people
blocks.trans: 野生的（尤指原為家養的動物）
examples:
feral dogs/cats
野狗／貓

blocks.def: to give someone too much care or protection
examples:
You're not helping the children by mollycoddling them - they have to grow up sometime.
你嬌慣孩子對他們沒好處——他們總要長大的。

blocks.def: to make something last a longer time
examples:
We were having such a good time that we decided to prolong our stay by another week.
我們過得非常愉快，決定再多待一個星期。
 She chewed each delicious mouthful as slowly as she could, prolonging the pleasure.
她細嚼慢嚥，盡情地享受每一口美食。

blocks.def: unpleasant, or morally offensive
examples:
unsavoury sexual practices
不道德的性行爲
 an unsavoury reputation
聲名狼藉

blocks.def: a large, heavy book
examples:
She's written several weighty tomes on the subject.
她就這個主題寫過幾部鴻篇巨著。

blocks.def: happening or existing at the same time
blocks.trans: 並發的，同時發生的；並存的
examples:
The judge imposed concurrent sentences totalling 14 years for the attacks on the girls.
法官對其侵害少女的多宗罪行數罪並罰，判處其14年有期徒刑。

blocks.def: An abortive attempt or plan has to be stopped because it has failed.
blocks.trans: 失敗的；夭折的；無結果的
examples:
He made two abortive attempts on the French throne.
他兩次企圖登上法國王位，結果都以失敗告終。

blocks.def: (of something such as bad behaviour) not necessary, or with no cause
blocks.trans: （不良行為等）不必要的，無謂的，無理由的
examples:
A lot of viewers complained that there was too much gratuitous sex and violence in the film.
很多觀眾抱怨說影片中有太多無謂的色情和暴力鏡頭。

blocks.def: a person, especially a political leader, who wins support by exciting the emotions of ordinary people rather than by having good or morally right ideas
to force someone to leave somewhere
examples:
Tenants who fall behind in their rent risk being evicted.
拖欠房租的房客有被趕走的危險。
 He was evicted from the bar for drunken and disorderly behaviour.
他因為醉酒及暴力滋事被趕出酒吧。

blocks.def: a person who is poor and does not have a home or job
examples:
The town has shelters and food handouts for vagrants.
這個鎮為流浪者提供住處和食物。

blocks.def: A virulent disease or poison is dangerous and spreads or affects people very quickly.
examples:
A particularly virulent strain of flu has recently claimed a number of lives in the region.
一場有致命殺傷力的流感最近在這個地區奪去了許多人的生命。

blocks.def: full of hate and violent opposition
examples:
She is a virulent critic of US energy policy.
她是美國能源政策尖刻的批評者。

blocks.def: to have doubts about the honesty or abilities of someone
blocks.trans: 不信任，不相信；懷疑…的真實性
examples:
I've always mistrusted politicians.
我總是不信任政治家。

blocks.def: often in a bad mood, unfriendly, and not polite
blocks.trans: 脾氣壞的；不友好的，粗魯無禮的
examples:
We were served by a very surly waiter.
為我們服務的侍者態度很差。
 He gave me a surly look.
他很不友善地看了我一眼。

blocks.def: awkward and uncomfortable with other people, especially because young and without experience
blocks.trans: （尤指因年輕且經驗不足而）笨拙的，不善社交的，不老練的
examples:
She had grown from a gauche teenager to a self-assured young woman.
她從一個笨嘴拙舌的小姑娘變成一位自信的年輕女性。

blocks.def: to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties
blocks.trans: （尤指長期或不畏艱難地）努力，奮鬥，力爭
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] Mr Roe has kindled expectations that he must now strive to live up to.
羅先生激發了人們的期望，現在他必須努力不辜負這種期望。
 In her writing she strove for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.
她在寫作中力圖在創新和傳統散文形式之間取得平衡。

blocks.def: to give a new appearance to a person or thing, especially in order to hide its true form
blocks.trans: 給…化裝，給…喬裝打扮；將…偽裝起來
examples:
He disguised himself by wearing a false beard.
他粘上假鬍鬚偽裝自己。
 Minor skin imperfections can usually be disguised with a spot of make-up.
微小的皮膚瑕疵通常可以用化妝品來掩蓋。
 We tried to disguise the fact that it was just a school hall by putting up coloured lights and balloons.
我們掛上彩燈和氣球，不想讓人看出這裡實際上只是一個學校禮堂。

blocks.def: to hide an opinion, a feeling, etc.
examples:
I couldn't disguise my disappointment.
我無法掩飾自己的失望。

blocks.def: something that someone wears to hide their true appearance
blocks.trans: 化裝用具（服飾）；用於偽裝的東西
examples:
He put on a large hat and glasses as a disguise and hoped no one would recognize him.
他戴上大帽子和眼鏡來偽裝自己，希望沒人會認出他來。

blocks.def: If people, objects, or activities are in disguise, they appear to be something that they are not, especially intentionally.
examples:
She usually goes out in disguise to avoid being bothered by the public.
她外出時通常都要化裝，以免受到公眾的打擾。
 He claims that most Western aid to the Third World is just colonialism in disguise.
他說西方給第三世界提供的援助大多只是變相的殖民主義行為。

blocks.def: a long period when there is little or no rain
examples:
This year (a) severe drought has ruined the crops.
今年嚴重的旱災把莊稼都給毀了。

blocks.def: the belief that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere
examples:
He's often been accused of cynicism in his attitude towards politics.
人們常常指責他對待政治的態度有些玩世不恭。
 Such behaviour only bred cynicism about the business world.
這種行為只會催生對商業世界的冷嘲熱諷。

blocks.def: beauty, especially a woman's beauty
to make someone able to understand or recognize something
blocks.trans: 使合拍，使協調；使理解，使明白；使適應
examples:
My ears are beginning to attune to the subtle differences in intonation.
我的耳朵開始能夠辨別出音調間非常細微的不同。
 His previous experience attuned him to the limitations and possibilities of government service.
之前的經歷讓他可以根據政府服務的有限性和可能性進行自我調節。

blocks.def: best; most likely to bring success or advantage
examples:
A mixture of selected funds is an optimum choice for future security and return on investment.
同時選擇幾種基金是確保未來投資安全和投資收益的最佳選擇。

blocks.def: a rope, formed into a ring at one end, that can be tightened by pulling the other end
examples:
Lassos are used particularly by cowboys to catch cattle and horses.
套索是牛仔專門用來套捕牛和馬的工具。

blocks.def: to catch an animal by throwing the ring of a lasso over its head and then tightening it around its neck
smelling extremely bad and stale
examples:
fetid air/breath
臭氣／惡臭的口氣

blocks.def: a fairly high level of ability in a foreign language according to the Common European Framework (= a description of language ability levels created by the Council of Europe)
blocks.trans: （歐洲語言學習共同參考架構的）外語中高級

blocks.def: to (cause something to) break suddenly into very small pieces
examples:
The glass shattered into a thousand tiny pieces.
玻璃碎成無數塊細小的碎片。
 His leg was shattered in the accident.
他在事故中腿骨碎裂。

blocks.def: to end or severely damage something
examples:
The book shattered all her illusions about the Romans.
這本書讓她對羅馬人的幻想完全破滅。
 Noisy motorbikes shattered the peace/calm/stillness.
吵鬧的機車聲打破了寧靜／平靜／靜謐。

blocks.def: connected with monks or monasteries
blocks.trans: 修士的，僧侶的；修道院的，寺院的

blocks.def: A monastic way of living is simple with few possessions and no people near you.
blocks.trans: 隱修生活般的，遁世的；簡樸的
examples:
a monastic life
簡樸克己的生活

blocks.def: very good and suitable to be copied by other people
blocks.trans: 優異的；值得仿傚的；（可作）楷模的
examples:
His tact was exemplary, especially considering the circumstances.
他的策略堪稱典範，尤其是考慮到當時的情形。

blocks.def: An exemplary punishment is severe and intended as a warning to others.
examples:
The judge awarded exemplary damages.
法官判罰損害賠償金，以儆效尤。

blocks.def: the action of taking back property that was bought with borrowed money because the money was not being paid back as formally agreed, or an example of this
blocks.trans: 止贖; 取消抵押品贖回權
examples:
She is another homeowner facing foreclosure.
她是另一位面臨止贖的房主。
 His firm handles about 3,000 mortgage foreclosures a year.
他的公司每年處理大約 3,000 宗抵押止贖案。

blocks.def: a man who hates women or believes that men are much better than women
showing feelings of hating women or a belief that men are much better than women
blocks.trans: 厭惡女人的，認為男人比女人優越的人
examples:
She left the Church because of its misogynist teachings on women and their position in society.
她離開教會是因為它那套敵視女性、貶低女性社會地位的說教。
 a misogynistic attitude/writer
厭惡女人的態度／作家

blocks.def: to use something in a way that helps you
examples:
We need to make sure that we exploit our resources as fully as possible.
我們要確保盡可能充分利用資源。

blocks.def: to use someone or something unfairly for your own advantage
examples:
Laws exist to stop companies exploiting their employees.
法律規定禁止公司剝削其員工。

blocks.def: something unusual, brave, or funny that someone has done
blocks.trans: 不尋常的行為；英勇的行為；奇遇
examples:
She was telling me about her exploits while travelling around Africa.
她跟我講述了在非洲各地旅遊時的奇遇。

blocks.def: to give someone back their previous job or position, or to cause something to exist again
blocks.trans: 使重返崗位，使恢復原職；把…放回原處；使恢復原狀
examples:
A month after being unfairly dismissed, he was reinstated in his job.
在被不公正解職一個月後，他又重新返回工作崗位。
 The Supreme Court reinstated the death penalty in 1976.
最高法院於1976年恢復了死刑。

blocks.def: to feel sorry about an event and wish it had not happened
blocks.trans: 對…感到懊悔；對…感到後悔；因為…感到遺憾

blocks.def: a loud, unpleasant confused noise that lasts for a long time
examples:
the din of the traffic
車輛的嘈雜聲
 I had to shout to make myself heard above the din.
由於噪音太大我不得不扯著嗓門說話好讓別人聽到。
 The children were making a terrible din.
孩子們吵翻了天

blocks.def: strange and unpleasant, especially in a silly or slightly frightening way
blocks.trans: 怪誕的，荒謬的；奇形怪狀的；醜陋的
examples:
By now she'd had so much cosmetic surgery that she looked quite grotesque.
她現在因為作了太多的整容手術，看上去讓人覺得怪異可怖。
 Gothic churches are full of devils and grotesque figures.
哥德式的教堂到處都放有魔鬼和形狀怪誕的形象。

blocks.def: a painting or other artistic work with an image of a person that is ugly or unpleasant as its subject
blocks.trans: 表現怪誕主題的油畫（或藝術品）
examples:
Spencer's grotesques are his best works.
斯賓塞最好的作品是那些表現怪誕主題的油畫。

blocks.def: hidden or secret
examples:
covert actions
秘密活動
 The government was accused of covert military operations against the regime.
該政府被指責秘密組織推翻這一政權的軍事行動。

blocks.def: a group of bushes and small trees growing close together in which animals can hide, especially from people or other animals hunting them
blocks.trans: （尤指動物為躲避獵人而藏身的）叢林，小樹叢

blocks.def: a small, light boat for rowing or sailing, usually used by only one person
(of air) with little oxygen
without any of the problems of ordinary life
blocks.trans: 高深精妙的；曲高和寡的
examples:
the rarefied atmosphere of academia
學術界的清高氣氛
 She moves in rarefied circles.
她出入清高的圈子。

blocks.def: extremely happy and excited
blocks.trans: 狂喜的；亢奮的；異常興奮的
examples:
a euphoric mood
極其興奮的心情

blocks.def: public embarrassment
examples:
The incumbent party experienced the ignominy of total defeat in the last election.
執政黨在上次選舉中蒙受了大敗的恥辱。

blocks.def: relating to the earth
(of a planet) similar to Earth
examples:
the search for terrestrial planets
對類似地球星球的搜尋

blocks.def: (of animals) living on the land rather than in the water or air
Terrestrial television channels are broadcast from stations on the ground and do not use satellites.
blocks.trans: （電視頻道）陸地上的，地面上的（與衛星相對而言）

blocks.def: in a happy mood
Ribald language refers to sex in a rude but humorous way.
blocks.trans: （指言語）粗俗詼諧的；猥褻逗笑的
examples:
He entertained us with ribald stories.
他講了一些粗俗詼諧的故事逗我們。

blocks.def: used to describe beliefs that are strongly and sincerely felt or people who have strong and sincere beliefs
examples:
a fervent supporter of the communist party
共產黨的熱烈擁護者
 It is his fervent hope that a peaceful solution will soon be found.
他熱切地希望能很快找到和平解決的方案。

blocks.def: an urgent and emotional request
examples:
He made a plea for help/mercy.
他懇求得到幫助／寬恕。

blocks.def: the answer that a person gives in court when they have been accused of committing a crime
examples:
Mr Wilson entered a plea of not guilty.
威爾遜先生提出了無罪申訴。

blocks.def: something that you hope to achieve
blocks.trans: 志向，抱負；渴望達到的目標
examples:
I've never had any political aspirations.
我從來就沒甚麼政治抱負。
 It's a story about the lives and aspirations of poor Irish immigrants.
這個故事講述了窮苦的愛爾蘭移民的生活與抱負。

blocks.def: the noise that is made when air escapes after a plosive consonant sound
examples:
In English, aspiration is an important feature in whether we hear a sound as /p/ or /b/ at the beginning of a word.
在英語中，送氣與否跟一個詞的起始音是/p/還是/b/有重要關係。

blocks.def: stylish and tidy in every detail
examples:
He's always been a natty dresser.
他總是整潔瀟灑。

blocks.def: (of a person) calm and not showing emotion or excitement, or (of a thing) not interesting or attractive
blocks.trans: （人）不動感情的，淡漠的，無動於衷的；（事物）索然無趣的
examples:
He's a very stolid, serious man.
他是個喜怒不形於色、很嚴肅的人。
 The college is a stolid-looking building with no lawn.
這所學院外觀呆板，連草坪都沒有。

blocks.def: A vituperative spoken or written attack is full of angry criticism.
examples:
Miss Snowden yesterday launched a vituperative attack on her ex-boss and former lover.
斯諾登小姐昨天對她的前老闆兼前情人破口大罵。

blocks.def: to become smaller in size or amount, or fewer in number
examples:
The community has dwindled to a tenth of its former size in the last two years.
該社區在過去的兩年裡縮小到了原來的十分之一。
 Her hopes of success in the race dwindled last night as the weather became worse.
隨著昨晚天氣的惡化，她在比賽中獲勝的希望減小了。

blocks.def: (an example of) uncontrolled and excited behaviour or emotion that is sometimes violent
examples:
In a frenzy of rage she hit him.
她盛怒之下打了他。
 the media frenzy over the celebrity wedding
媒體對公眾人物婚禮表現出的極大興趣
 The audience worked/whipped themselves into a frenzy as they waited for her to come on stage.
觀衆在期待她登上舞臺的過程中情緒變得狂熱起來。
 There was a frenzy of activity in the financial markets yesterday.
昨天金融市場極度活躍。
 In a moment of jealous frenzy, she cut the sleeves off all his shirts.
她嫉妒得發瘋，把他所有的襯衫袖子都剪掉了。

blocks.def: speaking or using several different languages
blocks.trans: 說多種語言的，多種語言混合的
examples:
She was reading a polyglot bible, with the text in English, Latin and Greek.
她在看一本多種文字對照的《聖經》，經文由英語、拉丁語和希臘語寫成。

blocks.def: containing people from many different and distant places
blocks.trans: 由來自不同地方的人組成的
examples:
New York is an exciting polyglot city.
紐約是一個令人興奮的多元化城市。

blocks.def: to make or (especially of metal) become less bright or a different colour
blocks.trans: （使）（尤指金屬）失去光澤，（使）變暗淡；（使）褪色

blocks.def: to make people think that someone or something is less good
examples:
By this time a series of scandals had severely tarnished the candidate's image/reputation.
到這時，一連串的醜聞已使這名候選人的形象／名譽大大受損。

blocks.def: to seem to see, hear, feel, or smell something that does not exist, usually because you are ill or have taken a drug
examples:
Mental disorders, drug use, and hypnosis can all cause people to hallucinate.
精神失常、吸毒和催眠術都可以使人産生幻覺。

blocks.def: to look at someone with obvious sexual interest
examples:
I saw you ogling the woman in the red dress!
我看到你色迷迷地盯著那個穿紅色連衣裙的女人！

blocks.def: relating to the religious practice of praying to a picture or object
examples:
Authorities destroyed a number of statues that were deemed idolatrous.
當局摧毀了許多被認為是偶像崇拜的雕像。

blocks.def: showing very great admiration or respect for someone or something, often too great
blocks.trans: 盲目崇拜的，極其仰慕的
examples:
The modern obsession with health is idolatrous.
現代人對健康的癡迷是一種盲目崇拜。

blocks.def: a group within a larger group, especially one with slightly different ideas from the main group
blocks.trans: （大團體中的）派別，派系，小集團
examples:
the left-wing faction of the party
黨內左翼派別

blocks.def: not tight; loose
examples:
These tent ropes are too slack - they need tightening.
這些帳篷繩太鬆了——需要把它們拉緊。

blocks.def: showing little activity; not busy or happening in a positive way
blocks.trans: 蕭條的，不景氣的；冷清的；懈怠的
examples:
Business is always slack at this time of year.
每年的這個時候生意都很清淡。
UK disapproving Discipline in Mr Brown's class has become very slack recently.
布朗先生班上的紀律最近變得十分鬆懈。
UK disapproving The job is taking a long time because the workmen are so slack.
這項工作花費了很長時間，因爲工人很懶散。

blocks.def: the fact that something is too loose
examples:
There's too much slack in these ropes.
這些繩子有太多鬆弛的地方。
 The men pulled on the ropes to take up the slack (= to tighten them).
男人們拉繩子將其收緊。

blocks.def: a pair of trousers, that are not part of a suit
examples:
wool slacks
羊毛長褲

blocks.def: very small pieces and dust from coal
to work more slowly and with less effort than usual, or to go more slowly
examples:
Everyone slacks off/up at the end of the week.
每個人到了週末都有些懈怠。
disapproving You'll be in trouble if you're caught slacking on the job.
如果你被抓到工作時偷懶，那你就麻煩了。
 Slack off your speed as you approach the corner.
接近轉角時，你要放慢速度。

blocks.def: to try to do something
examples:
Engineers are endeavouring to locate the source of the problem.
工程師們正竭盡全力查找問題的根源。

blocks.def: an attempt to do something
examples:
In spite of our best endeavours, it has proven impossible to contact her.
儘管我們盡了最大的努力，但最後還是未能聯繫上她。
 Crossing the North Pole on foot was an amazing feat of human endeavour.
徒步穿越北極是人類探索領域的一次壯舉。
 artistic endeavour
對藝術的探索

blocks.def: showing strong disapproval and not showing respect
examples:
He made some derogatory comment/remark about her appearance.
他對她的相貌貶低了一番。

blocks.def: to praise someone in order to make them feel attractive or important, sometimes in a way that is not sincere
examples:
I knew he was only flattering me because he wanted to borrow some money.
我知道他只是在討好我，因為他想借些錢。

blocks.def: to believe something good about yourself although it might not be true
examples:
[ + that ] Steve flatters himself that he's an excellent speaker.
史蒂夫自認為是個優秀的演說家。

blocks.def: to give the appearance of being better than the true situation
examples:
I suspect these statistics flatter to deceive.
我懷疑這些數字是掩人耳目的。

blocks.def: to feel very pleased and proud because someone has said good things about you or has made you feel important
blocks.trans: 被奉承得高興；感到榮幸
examples:
She was flattered by his attention.
他的關注使她格外高興。
 They were flattered to be invited to dinner by the mayor.
市長邀請他們共進晚餐，他們深感榮幸。
 We felt flattered that so many people came to our party.
這麽多人來參加我們的派對，我們感到十分榮幸。

blocks.def: to make someone look more attractive than usual
examples:
That new hairstyle really flatters her.
那個新髮型讓她顯得漂亮多了。
 Short skirts don't flatter me at all.
我穿短裙根本不好看。

blocks.def: of many different types
examples:
The newspaper report detailed the fraudster's multifarious business activities.
報紙上的這篇報道詳述了騙子形形色色的商業詐騙活動。

blocks.def: to pull something, especially with a sudden movement, in order to remove it
examples:
Caged birds sometimes pluck out their breast feathers.
關在籠子裡的鳥有時會拔下自己的胸羽。
 He plucked the letter from/out of my hand, and ran off with it.
他從我手中搶過信後就跑開了。
 Do you pluck your eyebrows (= remove some of the hairs from them to give them a better shape)?
你修眉嗎？

blocks.def: to remove the feathers from a chicken or other bird so that it can be cooked and eaten
to remove someone suddenly from a situation that is ordinary
examples:
He was plucked from obscurity to star in the film.
他脫穎而出成為這部電影的主角。

blocks.def: to remove someone quickly from a dangerous or difficult situation
examples:
The last passengers were plucked from the ship just seconds before it sank.
最後一批遊客在船沉沒前幾秒鐘被救起。

blocks.def: to collect flowers by breaking or cutting their stems; pick
to pull and then release the strings of a musical instrument with your finger to play notes
examples:
He sat on the bed, idly plucking (at) the strings of his guitar.
他坐在床上，隨意地撥著吉他琴弦。

blocks.def: courage and a strong wish to succeed
examples:
She showed a lot of pluck in standing up to her boss.
她頂撞老闆，表現出很大的勇氣。

blocks.def: an old person who is often in a bad mood
blocks.trans: 脾氣乖戾的老人，壞脾氣的老人

blocks.def: a piece of music written by a particular musician and given a number relating to the order in which it was published
blocks.trans: （由某一作曲家創作、按發表順序編號的）音樂作品；編號作品
examples:
Carl Nielsen's Opus 43 quintet
卡爾‧尼爾森的第43號五重奏曲

blocks.def: any work of art
examples:
He showed us his latest opus, a truly awful painting of a vase of flowers.
他向我們展示了他的最新作品——一幅畫有一瓶花的相當糟的油畫。

blocks.def: a piece of rope, chain, etc. tied to an animal, especially to a dog at its collar when taking it for a walk
examples:
Please keep your dog on a leash when on the beach.
在海灘上請牽住你的狗。

blocks.def: an energetic happy person who enjoys being with other people
examples:
Most sales people are extroverts.
大多數推銷員都是性格外向的人。

blocks.def: expressing severe criticism and blame
examples:
We denied the opprobrious charges published against us.
我們否認那些針對我們發表的令人不齒的指控。
 They called me by opprobrious names.
他們用惡毒的話罵我。

blocks.def: to prove that something is not true
examples:
The allegations have been disproved.
那些指稱已被證明是不實之詞。

blocks.def: to pay out money, usually from an amount that has been collected for a particular purpose
examples:
The local authorities annually disburse between £50 million and £100 million on arts projects.
當地政府每年都為藝術項目撥款5000萬到一億英鎊。

blocks.def: a piece of a broken glass, cup, container, or similar object
blocks.trans: （玻璃杯、茶杯、容器或類似物品的）碎片
examples:
Shards of glass have been cemented into the top of the wall to stop people climbing over.
牆頭上用水泥黏著玻璃碎片，以防止人們翻牆過去。

blocks.def: an unusual habit or part of someone's personality, or something that is strange and unexpected
examples:
You have to get used to other people's quirks and foibles.
你要習慣別人的怪癖和小缺點。
 There is a quirk in the rules that allows you to invest money without paying tax.
這些規章的奇怪之處在於其允許人們投資而不必繳稅。
 By some strange quirk/By an odd quirk of fate (= unexpectedly), we ended up on the same train.
說來奇怪，我們結果上了同一列火車。

blocks.def: willingness to give money, or money given to poor people by rich people
blocks.trans: 慷慨捐助，施捨；（給窮人的）善款
examples:
The medical foundation will be the main beneficiary of the millionaire's largesse.
這個醫藥基金會將是那位百萬富翁慷慨捐助的主要受益者。

blocks.def: past simple and past participle of bend
curved and not straight or flat
examples:
The metal bars were bent and twisted.
金屬棒不直而且扭曲了。

blocks.def: (especially of a person in a position of authority) dishonest
examples:
a bent copper
不誠實的員警

blocks.def: (especially of men) gay
a natural skill
examples:
She has a scientific bent/a bent for science.
她在理科方面有天賦。

blocks.def: existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object
blocks.trans: 抽象的；純理論的；純概念的
examples:
Truth and beauty are abstract concepts.
真和美都是抽象的概念。

blocks.def: An abstract argument or discussion is general and not based on particular examples.
blocks.trans: （辯論或討論）抽象的；空泛的；空洞的
examples:
This debate is becoming too abstract - let's have some hard facts!
這場辯論變得太空洞了，拿出一些具體的事實根據來吧！

blocks.def: general ideas
examples:
I have difficulty dealing with the abstract - let's discuss particular cases.
我難以理解抽象概念，我們討論一些具體的事例吧。
 So far we've only discussed the question in the abstract (= without referring to any real examples).
目前我們只是泛泛地討論過這個問題。

blocks.def: used to refer to a type of painting, drawing, or sculpture that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
examples:
abstract art
抽象藝術
 an abstract painter
抽象派畫家

blocks.def: a short form of a speech, article, book, etc., giving only the most important facts or ideas
examples:
There is a section at the end of the magazine that includes abstracts of recent articles/books.
雜誌的最後一部分收錄了近期發表的文章／出版的書籍的摘要。

blocks.def: a painting that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
blocks.trans: 抽象畫；抽象派藝術作品

blocks.def: making you feel that something bad or evil might happen
examples:
The ruined house had a sinister appearance.
那棟倒塌的房子外觀給人一種不祥之感。
 A sinister-looking man sat in the corner of the room.
一個神情陰險的男子坐在房間的角落裡。

blocks.def: a warning to consider something before taking any more action, or a statement that limits a more general statement
blocks.trans: （進一步行動前的）警告，告誡；限制條款
examples:
He agreed to the interview, with the caveat that he could approve the final article.
他答應接受訪問，條件是訪問稿刊登前須經他同意。

blocks.def: discovering what is true by considering opposite theories
examples:
dialectical materialism/logic
辯證唯物主義/邏輯
 the dialectal method of questioning established thought
質疑既定思想的辯證的方法

blocks.def: to look carefully or with difficulty
examples:
When no one answered the door, she peered through the window to see if anyone was there.
沒有人開門，她就費力地透過窗戶往裡望去，看是否有人在。
 The driver was peering into the distance trying to read the road sign.
司機費力地看著遠方，想要看清路標。

blocks.def: a person who is the same age or has the same social position or the same abilities as other people in a group
blocks.trans: 同齡人；同輩；同儕；同等社會地位（或能力）的人
examples:
Do you think it's true that teenage girls are less self-confident than their male peers?
你是否認為十幾歲的女孩子不如同年齡的男孩子自信？
 He wasn't a great scholar, but as a teacher he had few peers (= not as many people had the same ability as him).
他算不上偉大的學者，但作為教師沒有幾個人能與他相提並論。

blocks.def: in the UK, a person who has a high social position and any of a range of titles, including baron, earl, and duke, or a life peer
examples:
a hereditary peer
世襲貴族
 a Conservative peer
保守黨推薦任命的上議院議員

blocks.def: to spread and develop many parts or branches, or to make something do this
blocks.trans: （植物）分枝；使分支，成為枝椏狀
examples:
An elaborate system of canals was built, leading away from the Thames and ramifying throughout the UK.
建立了一個精心設計的運河系統，從泰晤士河引出，呈枝椏狀向英國各地延伸。
 Younger branches of the family moved beyond the parish boundaries and ramified the surname widely.
該家族年輕的幾支遷出了教區邊界，使這個姓氏的人廣泛分佈各處。

blocks.def: to leave someone for ever, especially when they need you
blocks.trans: （尤指在他人需要時）離開，拋棄，遺棄
examples:
Do not forsake me!
不要拋棄我！

blocks.def: to stop doing or having something
examples:
He decided to forsake politics for journalism.
他決定離開政界，轉向新聞界。

blocks.def: (of a substance) more liquid than it should be, often in a way that is unpleasant
examples:
The batter was a bit sloppy so I added some more flour.
麵糊有點稀，於是我又加進了一些麵粉。

blocks.def: not taking care or making an effort
examples:
Spelling mistakes always look sloppy in a formal letter.
在正式信函中出現拼寫錯誤總讓人感覺寫信者草率馬虎。
 Another sloppy pass like that might lose them the whole game.
再來一次那樣的草率傳球，他們可能會輸掉整場比賽。

blocks.def: Sloppy clothes are large, loose, and do not look neat.
examples:
At home I tend to wear big sloppy sweaters and jeans.
在家裡，我一般穿寬鬆的套衫和牛仔褲。

blocks.def: expressing feelings of love in a way that is silly or embarrassing
examples:
a sloppy love song
庸俗傷感的情歌

blocks.def: badly or carelessly
examples:
a sloppily written letter
字跡潦草的信

blocks.def: to watch people taking an exam in order to check that they do not cheat
examples:
Miss Jekyll will be proctoring (your chemistry exam) today.
今天將由傑基爾小姐監考（你們的化學考試）。

blocks.def: a person whose job is to watch people taking an exam in order to check that they do not cheat
examples:
If you need more paper, please ask the proctor.
如果需要更多的紙，請向監考人員索取。

blocks.def: extremely fat in a way that is dangerous for health
examples:
She was not just overweight; she was clinically obese.
她不僅只是體重偏高，而是醫學定義上的肥胖。

blocks.def: to join the armed forces
examples:
They both enlisted (in the navy) a year before the war broke out.
他們兩個人都是在戰爭爆發前一年加入（海軍）的。

blocks.def: to ask for and get help or support from someone
examples:
We enlisted some people to help prepare the food.
我們請了一些人來幫忙做飯。
 The organization has enlisted the support of many famous people in raising money to help homeless children.
這個組織募款幫助無家可歸的兒童的活動已經得到了很多名人的支持。

blocks.def: a person whose job is to protect a forest or natural park
examples:
a forest ranger
護林員

blocks.def: a young woman aged 14-19 who belongs to the international organization for young women called the Guides
blocks.trans: 國際女童軍成員（國際女童軍是名為 Guides 的一個國際組織，其成員為年齡14-19歲的年青女孩）

blocks.def: the part of philosophy that is about understanding existence and knowledge
to cause a fire to start burning by lighting paper, wood, etc.
to cause strong feelings or ideas in someone
blocks.trans: 激起（熱情等）；使產生想法
examples:
Her imagination was kindled by the exciting stories her grandmother told her.
她祖母給她講述的精彩故事激發了她的想像力。

blocks.def: extremely unpleasant and causing or deserving hate
examples:
an odious crime
可憎的罪行
 an odious little man
可惡透頂的小個子男人

blocks.def: to fight, especially in order to win something
blocks.trans: （尤指為了得到某物而）扭打，搏鬥
examples:
The children grappled for the ball.
孩子們為了爭球打成一團。

blocks.def: an act of breaking a law, promise, agreement, or relationship
examples:
They felt that our discussions with other companies constituted a breach of/in our agreement.
他們認為我們與別的公司談判違反了我們之間的協定。
 He was sued for breach of contract.
他因為違約而被起訴。
 There have been serious security breaches (= breaks in our security system).
保安系統出了大問題。

blocks.def: (an example of) illegal noisy or violent behaviour in a public place
to be breaking a particular law or rule
examples:
The theatre was in breach of the safety laws for having no fire doors.
由於沒有消防門，這家劇院違反了安全法規。

blocks.def: a hole that is made in a wall or in another structure being used for protection during an attack
blocks.trans: （攻擊牆或防禦工事時打出的）缺口
examples:
A cannon ball had made a breach in their castle walls.
一顆炮彈在他們城堡的牆上打出了一個缺口。

blocks.def: to break a law, promise, agreement, or relationship
examples:
They breached the agreement they had made with their employer.
他們違反了曾與僱主達成的協議。

blocks.def: to make an opening in a wall or fence, especially in order to attack someone or something behind it
blocks.trans: （尤指為從背後突襲）在…上打開缺口
examples:
Their defences were easily breached.
他們的防線輕而易舉就被突破了。

blocks.def: in stories for children, a creature like a little man with magical powers
blocks.trans: （兒童故事裡有魔法的）小矮人
examples:
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
《白雪公主和七個小矮人》

blocks.def: a person who is much smaller than the usual size
very small
examples:
You can grow dwarf conifers in pots on the patio.
你可以在陽臺上種些矮小的針葉樹盆栽。

blocks.def: If one thing dwarfs another, it makes it seem small by comparison.
blocks.trans: 使…相形見絀；使…顯得矮小
examples:
The new skyscraper will dwarf all those near it.
新建的摩天大樓會讓周圍的建築都顯得很矮小。
 This new crisis may well dwarf most that have gone before.
這場新的危機可能比以往的大多數危機都嚴重得多。

blocks.def: a complete change
examples:
Under the new editor, the magazine has undergone a metamorphosis.
在新主編的領導下，這本雜誌徹底改頭換面了。

blocks.def: the process by which the young form of insects and some animals, such as frogs, develops into the adult form
covering a large area; having a great range
blocks.trans: 廣闊的，大面積的；覆蓋範圍廣的
examples:
a school with extensive grounds
操場很大的學校
 extensive repairs to the motorway
對高速公路的大規模維修
 Her knowledge of music is extensive (= she knows a lot about music).
她的音樂知識非常淵博。
 The wedding received extensive coverage in the newspapers (= it was written about a lot).
報紙對這場婚禮進行了全面報道。

blocks.def: behaving in a rude, unpleasant way
blocks.trans: 粗魯的，不雅的，沒教養的
examples:
She thought he was loud-mouthed and uncouth.
她覺得他說話粗聲大氣，沒有教養。

blocks.def: to feel very angry but to be unable or unwilling to express it clearly
examples:
The rest of the class positively seethed with indignation when Julia won the award.
茱莉亞得獎的時候，全班明顯很不服氣。
 By the end of the meeting he was seething.
會議結束時他氣呼呼的。

blocks.def: (of a large number or amount) to move around energetically in a small space
blocks.trans: （大量人或物在狹小的空間內）密集，雲集；充滿
examples:
The streets were seething (= busy and crowded) with tourists.
街道上遊客摩肩接踵。

blocks.def: an introduction to a speech or piece of writing
something that happens before or leads to something else
examples:
The agreement between the warring parties to talk may be a preamble to peace.
交戰雙方同意對話的舉動可能是和平的前兆。

blocks.def: to entertain someone with stories, jokes, etc.
blocks.trans: （透過講故事、笑話等）使愉悅，使高興
examples:
The sailor regaled us all night with stories of his adventures.
水手整夜講述他的奇遇，令我們大飽耳福。

blocks.def: the nest of an eagle or other large bird that eats meat, usually built in a high place that cannot be easily reached
doubting that something is true or useful
examples:
Many experts remain skeptical about/of his claims.
很多專家對他的主張仍然持懷疑態度。

blocks.def: based on deep feeling and emotional reactions rather than on reason or thought
blocks.trans: 發自內心的；發自肺腑的
examples:
visceral hatred/excitement
刻骨銘心的仇恨／發自內心的興奮
 His approach to acting is visceral rather than intellectual.
他的表演重真情實感，而不是只講技巧。

blocks.def: relating to the large organs inside the body, including the heart, stomach, lungs, and intestines
an event, or the rate at which something happens
examples:
There have been quite a few incidences of bullying in the school this year.
今年該校發生了好幾次欺淩弱小的事件。
 an increased incidence of cancer near nuclear power stations
核電站附近癌症發病率的上升

blocks.def: extremely happy and excited, often because something has happened or been achieved
blocks.trans: 興高采烈的；喜氣洋洋的；歡欣鼓舞的
examples:
The prince was reported to be elated at/by the birth of his daughter.
據報道，王子喜得千金。

blocks.def: to remove the shell or natural covering from something that is eaten
examples:
to shuck corn/oysters
剝玉米／牡蠣

blocks.def: of great value because of being rare, expensive, or important
examples:
a precious gift
珍貴的禮物
 a precious moment/memory
寶貴的時刻／記憶
 Clean water is a precious commodity in many parts of the world.
在世界上很多地方潔淨的水是昂貴的商品。
 You're so precious to me.
你對我來說就是珍寶。

blocks.def: behaving in a very formal and unnatural way by giving too much attention to details that are not important and trying too hard to be perfect
examples:
He's so precious about his work that he never gets anything done.
他對自己的工作太講究了，反而甚麼都做不成。
 Don't you hate the precious way she speaks, pronouncing each single consonant so precisely.
她講話做作的樣子真讓人討厭，每個子音都發得那麼準確。

blocks.def: used to express dislike and/or anger
blocks.trans: （表示討厭和／或惱怒）寶貝似的
examples:
You and your precious car - it's all you're interested in!
你心裡只有你和你那輛寶貝車！

blocks.def: very
examples:
Lots of people will start, but precious few will finish.
許多人即將開始去做，但極少數能完成。
 Be careful - you'll be precious little help if you come back injured.
小心——如果你受了傷回來就幫不上甚麼忙了。

blocks.def: (of a person or animal) to run taking long, relaxed steps
blocks.trans: （人或動物輕鬆地））大步跑，大步跳躍
examples:
The lion loped across the grass.
獅子大步跳躍著跑過了草地。

blocks.def: A submissive person allows themselves to be controlled by other people.
examples:
He was looking for a quiet, submissive wife who would obey his every word.
他想找一個溫順嫻靜的妻子，對他百依百順。

blocks.def: beautiful in a way that suggests that someone is morally good and pure
examples:
a seraphic smile
天使般的微笑

blocks.def: to use a law in order to achieve something, or to mention something in order to explain something or to support your opinion or action
examples:
Police can invoke the law to regulate access to these places.
警方可以借助有關法律來約束人們進入這些地方。

blocks.def: to request help from someone, especially a god, when you want to improve a situation
blocks.trans: 求助於，借助於（尤指法律或神靈）
examples:
Their sacred dance is performed to invoke ancient gods.
他們表演聖舞以祈求古代神靈保佑。

blocks.def: to make someone have a particular feeling or remember something
producing an unpleasant sound
to look or sound different or wrong compared with everything else
blocks.trans: 顯出不一致的樣子；發出不和諧的聲音
examples:
The contemporary dialogue struck a slightly discordant note.
對話顯得略微有些不和諧。

blocks.def: very annoying
all the animals that live wild in a particular area
examples:
While she was in Hawaii, she studied the local flora and fauna.
她在夏威夷的時候，研究了當地的動植物群。

blocks.def: producing a bright light from a heated filament or other part
examples:
an incandescent lamp
白熾燈

blocks.def: extremely bright
examples:
The mountain's snow-white peak was incandescent against the blue sky.
雪白的山頂在藍天的映襯下十分耀眼。

blocks.def: showing extreme anger or happiness
blocks.trans: 極度憤怒的；極度高興的
examples:
He was incandescent with rage.
他大發雷霆。
 Her beauty had an incandescent quality to it.
她貌美絕倫，光彩照人。

blocks.def: extremely good, special, or skilled
examples:
an incandescent performance/career
爐火純青的表演／輝煌的事業

blocks.def: showing great respect and admiration
examples:
A reverent silence fell over the crowd.
人們肅然起敬，鴉雀無聲。

blocks.def: to lie or sit enjoying the warmth especially of the sun
examples:
We could see seals on the rocks, basking in the sun.
我們可以看到海豹在岩石上曬太陽。

blocks.def: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
blocks.trans: 隱約的；暗淡的；不易察覺的，不明顯的；微妙的
examples:
The room was painted a subtle shade of pink.
房間被刷成了淡粉色。
 The play's message is perhaps too subtle to be understood by young children.
這部戲的內涵過於隱晦，小孩子可能難以理解。

blocks.def: small but important
examples:
There is a subtle difference between these two plans.
兩個計劃之間有一點細微的差別。

blocks.def: achieved in a quiet way that does not attract attention to itself and is therefore good or clever
examples:
a subtle plan/suggestion
巧妙的計劃／建議
 subtle questions
巧妙的問題

blocks.def: a substance that is part of a chemical reaction
blocks.trans: （化學反應中的）反應體，反應物

blocks.def: to control or limit something that is not wanted
examples:
The government should act to curb tax evasion.
政府應該採取行動抑制逃稅。

blocks.def: a limit on something that is not wanted
examples:
You must try to put a curb on your bad temper/spending habits.
你必須儘量控制你的壞脾氣／揮霍無度的習慣。

blocks.def:
US spelling of
kerb UK
a phrase or other feature that is repeated often in a work of art, literature, or music and that tells you something important about it
blocks.trans: （指藝術、文學或尤指音樂作品中反復出現的）主題，中心思想，主旋律
examples:
Death and renewal are leitmotivs running through the whole novel.
死亡與新生是貫穿這部小說的主題。

blocks.def: to give a lot of attention to making someone comfortable and to protecting them from anything unpleasant
examples:
Children sometimes need to be cosseted.
孩子是需要疼愛的。
disapproving The country has been cosseted (= too protected) by the government for so long that people have forgotten how to take responsibility for themselves.
長久以來，這個國家一直受到政府的過度保護，人們已經忘了自己該如何承擔責任。

blocks.def: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organization that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully
blocks.trans: 官僚作風；官僚主義；官僚體制
examples:
I had to deal with the university's bureaucracy when I was applying for financial aid.
我申請助學金時不得不應對大學裡的官僚體系。

blocks.def: the act of using your influence to make someone in authority forgive someone else or save them from punishment
examples:
Several political prisoners have been released through the intercession of Amnesty International.
經國際特赦組織的斡旋，幾名政治犯獲釋了。

blocks.def: a prayer that asks God or a god to help or cure other people
behaviour or speech that is not sincere
blocks.trans: 矯揉造作，做作，裝模作樣；假裝
examples:
She has so many little affectations.
她身上有好多矯揉造作的小毛病。
 His manner reeks of affectation.
他的舉止做作至極。
 "It doesn't concern me," he said with an affectation of nonchalance.
「這不關我的事，」他故作冷漠地說。

blocks.def: If a substance is permeable, it allows liquids or gases to go through it.
examples:
Certain types of sandstone are permeable to water.
某些類型的砂岩可透水。
 The solvent passes through the permeable membrane to the solution.
溶劑透過滲透膜與溶液混合。
 Soft and gas-permeable contact lenses are kinder to the eyes than hard lenses.
柔軟透氣的隱形眼鏡比硬鏡片的對眼睛更好。

blocks.def: to get back money that you have spent or lost
examples:
It takes a while to recoup the initial costs of starting up a business.
要收回開創新公司投入的先期成本需要一段時間。
 The gambler recouped his losses in the next game.
這個賭徒在隨後一局中贏回了輸掉的錢。

blocks.def: including many different types of thing
examples:
As a young person he had more catholic tastes than he does now.
他年輕的時候興趣比現在要廣泛得多。

blocks.def: Roman Catholic
examples:
Is he (a) Catholic?
他是天主教徒嗎？
 a Catholic school/church
天主教學校／教堂

blocks.def: Arable farming land is used for, or is suitable for, growing crops.
blocks.trans: 適於耕種的，可耕的；耕作的
examples:
arable farming/farmers/farms/land
耕作農業／從事耕作農業的人／適宜墾植的農場／可耕地

blocks.def: exact and accurate
examples:
The bunker's precise location is a closely guarded secret.
掩體的確切位置嚴格保密。
 He caught me at the precise moment that I fainted.
他正好在我暈倒的那一刻抓住了我。
 There was a good turnout for the meeting - twelve of us to be precise.
出席會議的人不少——確切地說有我們12個人。

blocks.def: very careful and accurate, especially about small details
blocks.trans: （尤指在細節上）嚴謹的，細緻的
examples:
Years of doing meticulous research had made her very precise in her working methods.
多年來一絲不苟的研究使她養成了嚴謹的工作方法。

blocks.def: always determined and energetic in trying to achieve something and never willing to admit defeat
examples:
Annie was an indefatigable campaigner for better community services.
安妮曾為改善社區服務而不懈奔走。

blocks.def: the act or way of leaving a place
examples:
The main egress from the restaurant had been blocked off.
飯館的主要出口被堵住了。

blocks.def: a false report or piece of information that is intended to deceive people
the state of being completely forgotten
examples:
He was another minor poet who was consigned to oblivion.
他又是一位湮沒無聞的小詩人。
 These toys will be around for a year or two, then fade/slide/sink into oblivion.
這些玩具會風行一兩年，然後漸漸被人遺忘。

blocks.def: the state of being completely destroyed
blocks.trans: 完全被毀滅；徹底被消滅
examples:
The planes bombed the city into oblivion.
飛機將該市炸成一片廢墟。

blocks.def: the state of being unconscious
blocks.trans: 無知覺，無意識；不省人事
examples:
He sought oblivion in a bottle of whisky.
他試圖用一瓶威士卡酒來忘卻一切。

blocks.def: a musical note with a time value equal to two quavers or half a minim
the condition of being dealt with before other things or of being considered more important than other things
blocks.trans: （時間、順序、重要程度等的）居前，領先
examples:
Precedence must be given to the injured in the evacuation plans.
在疏散計劃中應優先考慮傷者。
 Business people often think that fluency and communication take precedence over grammar when speaking.
商界人士常認為說話的流利程度和表達能力比文法重要。

blocks.def: the order of importance given to people in particular societies, groups, or organizations
examples:
The order of precedence for titled nobility in Britain is duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron.
在英國有爵位的貴族級別依次為公爵、侯爵、伯爵、子爵和男爵。

blocks.def:
formal for
predate
fashionable
to make a hole in something in a rough or violent way
examples:
He drove into some railings and gouged a hole in the back of his car.
他開車撞到欄杆上，把車的後部撞了個大洞。

blocks.def: a hole that has been made roughly or violently
to make an urgent, emotional statement or request for something
examples:
He was on his knees, pleading for mercy/forgiveness.
他跪在地上，乞求寬恕／原諒。
 She appeared on television to plead with the kidnappers.
她出現在電視上，向綁架者求情。
 [ + speech ] "Give us more time," they pleaded.
「請多給我們一些時間，」他們請求道。

blocks.def: to make a statement of what you believe to be true, especially in support of something or someone or when someone has been accused in a law court
blocks.trans: （尤指在法庭上）為…辯護；申辯；認（罪）
examples:
The defendant pleaded not guilty/innocent to robbery with violence.
被告不承認暴力搶劫。
 They paid a high-powered attorney to plead their case (= argue for them in court).
他們聘請了一位很有能力的律師為自己辯護。
 The judge ruled her unfit to plead (= to answer a legal charge) on the grounds of insanity.
法官認定她精神失常，不適合在法庭上答辯。

blocks.def: to say something as an excuse or explanation
examples:
She left early, pleading pressure of work.
她以工作壓力為由，較早就走了。

blocks.def: to say that you do not know about something
examples:
He pleaded ignorance when they found the package in his suitcase.
他們在他的手提箱裡發現該包裹時，他辯解說自己對此一無所知。

blocks.def: to separate something into its different parts
examples:
This video shows you how to disassemble a television set.
這個錄影演示怎麼拆開電視機。

blocks.def: to lower someone or something in rank or position
examples:
The captain was demoted (to sergeant) for failing to fulfil his duties.
上尉因為沒有完成任務被降職（為中士）。

blocks.def: to come to live in a different country
examples:
He immigrated with his parents in 1895 and grew up on Long Island.
1895年，他與父母一起移民，並在長島長大。

blocks.def: The literal meaning of a word is its original, basic meaning.
examples:
The literal meaning of "television" is "seeing from a distance".
television 的字面意思是「從遠處看」。
 You will need to show more than just a literal understanding of the text.
你需要顯示自己對文本的理解沒有僅僅停留在字面含義上。

blocks.def: A literal translation of a text is done by translating each word separately, without looking at how the words are used together in a phrase or sentence.
examples:
Her translation is too literal, resulting in unnatural-sounding prose.
她的譯文太拘泥於字面了，結果成了冗長而不自然的行文。

blocks.def: producing or reflecting bright light (especially in the dark)
blocks.trans: （尤指在黑暗中）發亮的，放光的；夜光的
examples:
luminous clothing
夜光服

blocks.def: an area of water next to the coast, often protected from the sea by a thick wall, where ships and boats can shelter
examples:
Our hotel room overlooked a pretty little fishing harbour.
我們從旅館的房間可以俯瞰一個美麗的小漁港。

blocks.def: to think about or feel something, usually over a long period
examples:
He's been harbouring a grudge against her ever since his promotion was refused.
自從升職要求被拒絕後，他就一直對她懷恨在心。
 There are those who harbour suspicions about his motives.
有人對他的動機心存懷疑。
 Powell remains non-committal about any political ambitions he may harbour.
鮑威爾仍未明確表態自己胸懷何種政治抱負。

blocks.def: to protect someone or something bad, especially by hiding that person or thing when the police are looking for him, her, or it
blocks.trans: 庇護，窩藏，藏匿（罪犯或贓物）
examples:
to harbour a criminal
窩藏罪犯

blocks.def: to contain the bacteria, etc. that can cause a disease to spread
blocks.trans: 攜帶（細菌等，可導致疾病的傳播）
examples:
Bathroom door handles can harbour germs.
廁所門把手上可能帶有病菌。

blocks.def: the accepted way of spelling and writing words
(the quality of often having) a sudden and usually silly wish to have or do something, or a sudden and silly change of mind or behaviour
blocks.trans: 異想天開；反覆無常；突發奇想
examples:
The $300 million palace was built to satisfy the caprice of one man.
用三億美元建造這座宮殿就是為了滿足一個人的心血來潮。

blocks.def: a country that has agreed officially to give help and support to another one, especially during a war
examples:
The US is one of Britain's staunchest allies.
美國是英國最忠實的盟友之一。
 During the First World War, Turkey and Germany were allies/Turkey was an ally of Germany.
在第一次世界大戰期間，土耳其和德國是盟國／土耳其是德國的盟國。

blocks.def: someone who helps and supports someone else
examples:
He is generally considered to be the prime minister's closest political ally.
人們普遍認為他是首相最親密的政治盟友。

blocks.def: strong cloth made from the fibres of the flax plant
examples:
a linen jacket
亞麻上衣
 the crumpled charm of linen
亞麻特有的皺褶效果

blocks.def: sheets, tablecloths, etc. made from linen or a similar material
blocks.trans: （桌布、床單等）亞麻製品；仿亞麻製品
examples:
bed linen
床上用品
 table linen
餐桌布

blocks.def: courage over a long period
examples:
I thought she showed remarkable fortitude during that period.
我認為她在那段時期表現出了驚人的勇氣。

blocks.def: strong walls, towers, etc. that are built to protect a place
examples:
Some of the old fortifications still exist.
一些古老的防禦工事仍然屹立不倒。
 The fortifications of the castle were massive and impenetrable.
城堡的防禦工事巨大厚實，堅不可摧。

blocks.def: the act of fortifying something
When an animal migrates, it travels to a different place, usually when the season changes.
examples:
These animals migrate annually in search of food.
這些動物為尋找食物每年都遷徙。
 In September, these birds migrate 2,000 miles south to a warmer climate.
九月，這些鳥會向南遷徙2000英里到更溫暖的地方。

blocks.def: If people migrate, they travel in large numbers to a new place to live temporarily.
blocks.trans: （指人）大批外出；（暫時）移居，遷移
examples:
Mexican farm workers migrate into the US each year to find work at harvest time.
每年收穫季節來臨時，大批墨西哥農場工人都會湧入美國找工作。

blocks.def: to move from one place to another
examples:
Trade has migrated from local shops to the larger chain stores.
貿易正從當地的商店轉移到更大的連鎖商店。

blocks.def: to begin using a new computer system, or to move information from one type of system to another
blocks.trans: 轉移（使用新的作業系統，或將資料從一種作業系統移至另一種作業系統）
examples:
Migrating to Windows XP shouldn't cause you any problems.
改用 Windows XP 應該不會給你帶來任何不便。

blocks.def: the part of philosophy that is about the study of how we know things
the number of the house, name of the road, and name of the town where a person lives or works, and where letters can be sent
examples:
her business/home address
她的公司地址／家庭住址
 a change of address
地址變更

blocks.def: a series of letters and symbols that tell you where to find something on the internet or show where an email is sent to
examples:
What's your email address?
你的電子郵件地址是什麼？
 Do you have their Web address?
你知道他們的網址嗎？

blocks.def: the place where a piece of information is stored in a computer's memory
blocks.trans: （電腦記憶體儲存資訊的）位址

blocks.def: a formal speech
examples:
She gave an address to the Royal Academy.
她在皇家藝術院作了場演講。

blocks.def: to speak or write to someone
blocks.trans: 對…講話，對…發表演說，致辭；給…寫信，致函
examples:
He addressed a few introductory remarks to the audience.
他向觀眾說了幾句開場白。
 He likes to be addressed as "Sir" or "Mr Partridge".
他喜歡被稱為「先生」或「派特裡奇先生」。

blocks.def: to give attention to or deal with a matter or problem
examples:
The issue of funding has yet to be addressed.
資金問題尚未得到解決。

blocks.def: to write a name or address on an envelope or parcel
blocks.trans: 在（信封或包裹）上寫上姓名（或地址）
examples:
The parcel was wrongly addressed.
這個包裹上面的地址寫錯了。
 So why did you open a letter that was addressed to me?
那你為甚麼要拆寫給我的信呢？

blocks.def: to agree to do what people have asked you to do
examples:
He graciously acceded to our request.
他通情達理地同意了我們的請求。
 It is doubtful whether the government will ever accede to the nationalists' demands for independence.
政府不太可能會同意民族主義者的獨立要求。

blocks.def: to become king or queen, or to take a position of power
examples:
The diaries were written in 1837, when Queen Victoria acceded to the throne.
日記寫於1837年，時值維多利亞女王即位之年。

blocks.def: very pale, in a way that looks unhealthy and not attractive
examples:
Next to his tanned face, hers seemed pallid and unhealthy.
與他那張曬得黑黑的臉相比，她的臉顯得蒼白不健康。

blocks.def: showing no enthusiasm or excitement
examples:
This is a pallid production of what should be a great ballet.
本該是一齣精彩的芭蕾舞，卻被表演得了無生趣。

blocks.def: (of something bad, such as damage, cruelty, waste) extreme and showing no care at all
blocks.trans: 無節制的，過分的，恣意的；不負責的
examples:
wanton destruction of human life
草菅人命
 a wanton disregard for safety
對安全極不負責
 wanton extravagance
過度的鋪張

blocks.def: (of a woman) behaving or appearing in a very sexual way
relating to an autocrat
blocks.trans: 獨裁的；專制的；獨斷專行的；專橫的
examples:
an autocratic ruler/regime
獨裁統治者／政體
 an autocratic style of government/leadership/management
獨斷專行的統治方式／領導風格／管理方法
 The president resigned after 30 years of autocratic rule.
這位總統在進行了30年的獨裁統治後辭職下臺。

blocks.def: to behave as if sexually attracted to someone, although not seriously
examples:
Christina was flirting with just about every man in the room.
克莉絲蒂娜幾乎在跟房間裡的每一個男人調情。

blocks.def: someone who behaves as if they are sexually attracted to a lot of people
examples:
He's a compulsive flirt.
他不能自拔地到處跟人調情。

blocks.def: behaving as if you are sexually attracted to someone, although not seriously
examples:
flirty comments
輕佻的言語
 a flirty woman
一個賣弄風情的女人

blocks.def: a part of the coast where the land curves in so that the sea is surrounded by land on three sides
examples:
We sailed into a beautiful, secluded bay.
我們駛進了一個美麗、僻靜的海灣 。
 San Francisco Bay
舊金山灣（三藩市灣）
 the Bay of Naples
那不勒斯海灣

blocks.def: a partly surrounded or marked space
examples:
A truck pulled into the loading bay.
卡車停進了裝卸區。
UK Visitors must park their cars in the marked bays.
來訪者必須把車停在劃定的區域內。

blocks.def: a small evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that has leaves that are used to add flavour to food
a brown horse
(of dogs and wolves) to make a long, deep cry repeatedly
serious, sad, and without humour or entertainment
examples:
a sombre atmosphere/voice/face
嚴肅的氣氛／聲音／臉
 The funeral was a sombre occasion.
葬禮是嚴肅的場合。
 I left them in a sombre mood.
我滿心憂鬱地離開了他們。

blocks.def: dark and plain
examples:
He wore a sombre black suit.
他穿著一套深黑色套裝。

blocks.def: a confusing set of connecting passages or paths in which it is easy to get lost
examples:
Finally, through a labyrinth of corridors she found his office.
穿行過迷宮般的走廊後，她最終找到了他的辦公室。

blocks.def: something that is very confusing
blocks.trans: 令人迷惑的東西，迷宮一樣的東西
examples:
He was no stranger to the labyrinth of love.
他經常為情所困。

blocks.def: to bury a dead body
examples:
Many of the soldiers were interred in unmarked graves.
許多士兵的遺體都埋葬在無名墓下。

blocks.def: used to form adjectives meaning "between or among the people, things, or places mentioned"
examples:
international
國際的
 an interdepartmental meeting
部門間的會議
 intercontinental missiles
洲際導彈

blocks.def: a long period of time, especially one in which there are new developments and great change
blocks.trans: （尤指出現新進步和大變革的）時代，紀元，時期
examples:
The president said that his country was moving into a new epoch, which would be one of lasting peace.
總統說他的國家正在步入一個長治久安的新時代。

blocks.def: to remove the moisture from something so it becomes completely dry; to lose all moisture and become completely dry
examples:
Intensive farming has dessicated the land.
高度耕作使土地乾涸。
 Some plants wither quickly and lose their power of recovery if allowed to desiccate. 
有些植物如果任其缺水變乾，很快就會枯萎並失去恢復能力。

blocks.def: to become damaged or destroyed by losing an important quality; to damage or destroy something in this way
examples:
The global economy is desiccating by the day.
全球經濟日益枯竭。
 He was politically and emotionally desiccated by the scandal.
他在政治上和情感上都被這椿醜聞弄得一籌莫展。

blocks.def: to make the usual sound of a duck
examples:
The ducks started quacking loudly when we threw them some bread.
當我們向那些鴨子扔麵包時，它們便呱呱地大叫起來。

blocks.def: a person who dishonestly pretends to have medical skills or knowledge
blocks.trans: 冒牌醫生，江湖醫生，庸醫，江湖郎中

blocks.def: a doctor
examples:
Have you seen a quack about that cough?
你去醫生那兒看咳嗽了嗎？

blocks.def: the sound that a duck makes
blocks.trans: （鴨子）呱呱的叫聲，嘎嘎的叫聲

blocks.def: a period in which you convalesce
without knowledge or morals
examples:
Some of the early explorers thought of the local people as benighted savages who could be exploited.
一些早期的開發者認為當地人愚昧無知未開化，完全可以任由他們剝削。

blocks.def: money or property that you receive from someone after they die
examples:
An elderly cousin had left her a small legacy.
一位堂兄留給她一小筆遺産。

blocks.def: something that is a part of your history or that remains from an earlier time
examples:
The Greeks have a rich legacy of literature.
希臘人有豐富的文學遺産。
 The war has left a legacy of hatred.
那場戰爭給人們留下了仇恨。

blocks.def: easy to see, recognize, or understand
blocks.trans: 清楚的；顯然的，明顯的；明白的
examples:
[ + (that) ] It's obvious (that) she doesn't like him.
顯然她不喜歡他。
 They have a small child so for obvious reasons they need money.
他們有個年幼的孩子，所以顯然很需要錢。
 I know you don't like her, but do you have to make it so obvious?
我知道你不喜歡她，但有必要表現得那麼露骨嗎？
 Am I stating the obvious (= saying what everyone already knows)?
我說的大家早就知道了嗎？
 There is no obvious solution.
還沒有明顯的解決辦法。

blocks.def: to strongly criticize something or someone
examples:
There were politicians who inveighed against immigrants to get votes.
有些政客透過猛烈抨擊移民來獲取選票。

blocks.def: an offer or suggestion, usually in business
examples:
He wrote to me last week regarding a business proposition he thought might interest me.
他上週寫信給我，提出一項他認為我會感興趣的提案。
 I've put my proposition to the company director for his consideration.
我已將我的提議交給公司主管考慮。

blocks.def: an idea or opinion
examples:
They were debating the proposition that "All people are created equal".
他們正就「人人生而平等」這一命題展開辯論。

blocks.def: a statement or problem that must be solved or proved to be true or not true
blocks.trans: 命題：需要求解的題目或需通過論證而得出真值的陳述句
examples:
Pythagoras's theorem is the mathematical proposition that in any right-angled triangle, the square on the hypotenuse is equal to the sum of the squares on the other two sides.
畢達哥拉斯定理是一個數學命題，即在任何直角三角形中，斜邊的平方等於其他兩條邊的平方和。

blocks.def: in some states of the United States, a new plan that is voted on by the people of a state
blocks.trans: （美國某些州由人民投票決定的）州級提案
examples:
He proposed an unsuccessful state proposition.
他提出了一個州級提案，但沒有獲得通過。
 Under Proposition 71, the state will commit $3 billion to studying stem cells over the next 10 years.
根據第71號州級提案，該州將在未來10年內投入30億美元用於幹細胞研究。

blocks.def: to ask someone who you are not in a relationship with if they would like to have sex with you
blocks.trans: 要求與（某人）發生性關係，向…提出猥褻的要求
examples:
I was propositioned by a complete stranger.
一個素不相識的人提議想和我上床。

blocks.def: quick and usually funny answers and remarks in conversation
blocks.trans: 機敏的應答；妙語如珠的話
examples:
Oscar Wilde's plays are full of witty repartee.
奧斯卡‧王爾德的戲劇充滿了機智幽默的巧談妙語。

blocks.def: to lie, sit, or hang down in a relaxed, informal, or uncontrolled way
examples:
I spent most of the weekend lolling about/around on the beach.
週末的大部分時間我都懶洋洋地躺在海灘上。
 a dog with its tongue lolling out
伸著舌頭的狗

blocks.def: to arrange or call people to attend a large formal meeting
examples:
He has convoked a summit conference in Brussels.
他在布魯塞爾召集了一次高峰會議。

blocks.def: to plan secretly and dishonestly for something to happen that will be to your advantage
examples:
Officials were accused of conniving with the company in the supply of arms to Sierra Leone.
官員們被指控與該公司串通為塞拉里昂提供武器。
 [ + to infinitive ] They connived to break the school rules at every opportunity.
他們一有機會就密謀違反校規。

blocks.def: to allow something bad to happen although you know about it
examples:
She had murdered or connived at the murder of one of her lovers.
她謀殺或者默許他人謀殺了她的一個情人。
 He called for an independent investigation to find out whether corrupt officials are being bribed to connive in shoddy construction.
他要求調查腐敗官員是否接受了賄賂而對質量低劣的建築工程聽之任之。

blocks.def: humorous, especially in an unusual way
blocks.trans: 滑稽可笑的，古怪離奇的
examples:
a droll remark/expression/person
離奇可笑的說法／表情／人

blocks.def: to make something happen more quickly
examples:
Something needs to be done to expedite the process.
需要採取措施以加快進度。

blocks.def: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea
examples:
He drew an analogy between the brain and a vast computer.
他把大腦比作一台龐大的電腦。
 It is sometimes easier to illustrate an abstract concept by analogy with (= by comparing it with) something concrete.
有時用具體事物作比擬來闡釋抽象概念會更容易些。

blocks.def: a decision by a government that allows political prisoners to go free
examples:
Most political prisoners were freed under the terms of the amnesty.
大多數政治犯按照大赦的條款獲得了自由。

blocks.def: a fixed period of time during which people are not punished for committing a particular crime
examples:
People who hand in illegal weapons will not be prosecuted during the amnesty.
在赦免期內交出非法武器的人將不會受到起訴。
 The government refused to declare an amnesty for people who had not paid the disputed tax.
對於那些未繳納有爭議的稅款者，政府拒絕給予寬限。

blocks.def: behaviour that is a social mistake or is not polite
examples:
to commit a social solecism
社交上失禮

blocks.def: a grammatical mistake
examples:
a grammatical solecism
文法錯誤

blocks.def: Something that is opalescent reflects light and changes colour like an opal.
blocks.trans: 乳色的；髮乳光的；像蛋白石的；色彩變幻的
examples:
the opalescent scales of a fish
像蛋白石一樣發光變色的魚鱗

blocks.def: the act of pretending to be someone else in order to deceive others
to bring your eyebrows together so that there are lines on your face above your eyes to show that you are annoyed or worried
examples:
She frowned at me, clearly annoyed.
她皺著眉頭看著我，顯然是生氣了。
 He frowned as he read the instructions, as if puzzled.
他看說明書時皺著眉頭，一副迷惑不解的樣子。

blocks.def: lasting for a long time or made to last longer than necessary
examples:
protracted negotiations
持久的談判
 a protracted argument/discussion
曠日費時的爭論／討論

blocks.def: to be unable to make a decision about doing something
examples:
Stop dithering and choose which one you want!
別猶豫了，趕快決定你想要哪個！
 She's still dithering over whether to accept the job she's just been offered.
她還在猶豫要不要接受剛剛給她的那份工作。

blocks.def: to be very nervous, excited, or confused about something
blocks.trans: 對…感到緊張（或激動、困惑等）
examples:
Gideon is in a bit of a dither about what to wear for the interview.
吉迪恩緊張得有些不知穿甚麽衣服去參加面試才好。

blocks.def: bored or not excited, or wishing to seem so
examples:
He flies first class so often, he's become blasé about it.
他經常坐飛機頭等艙，所以已經是司空見慣了。

blocks.def: to defend or keep a principle or law, or to say that a decision that has already been made, especially a legal one, is correct
blocks.trans: 支援，維護，贊成（尤指法律上的決議）
examples:
As a police officer you are expected to uphold the law whether you agree with it or not.
作爲員警，不管你贊成與否都應該維護法律。
 Judge Davis upheld the county court's decision.
戴維斯法官維持了郡法院的判決。

blocks.def: to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something
examples:
The insurers will need to assess the flood damage.
保險公司需要對洪水造成的損失進行評估。
 They assessed the cost of the flood damage at £2,500.
他們估計洪水造成的損失為1500英鎊。
 Exams are not the only means of assessing a student's ability.
考試並不是評定學生能力的唯一手段。
 It's too early to assess the long-term consequences of the two countries' union.
現在判定兩國聯盟的長期影響還為時過早。
 [ + question word ] We need to assess whether the project is worth doing.
我們需要評估一下這個企劃案是否值得去做。

blocks.def: someone who has given up their religion or left a political party
a dishonest man

a 
jack
a silly or stupid person
to cause a lot of problems or difficulties for someone
examples:
We have issues in our community that continue to plague and beleaguer us.
一些社會問題不斷困擾、折磨著我們。

blocks.def: to surround someone in order to attack them
examples:
They were beleaguered by enemy armies.
他們遭到敵軍圍困。

blocks.def: simple and not wanting to deceive
blocks.trans: 單純的，直率的；不詭詐的
examples:
"Why did you take the money?" she asked the child. "Because I wanted it," came the artless reply.
「你為甚麼要拿這些錢？」她問那個孩子。「因為我想要。」孩子天真地回答。

blocks.def: in grammar, the part of a sentence that contains the verb and gives information about the subject
examples:
In the sentence "We went to the airport", "went to the airport" is the predicate.
在 We went to the airport 這句話中，went to the airport 是謂語。

blocks.def: to say that something is true
examples:
[ + that ] It would be unwise to predicate that the disease is caused by a virus before further tests have been carried out.
在進一步化驗前就斷言這種病由病毒引起是不明智的。

blocks.def: If an idea or argument is predicated on something, it depends on the existence or truth of this thing.
examples:
The sales forecast is predicated on the assumption that the economy will grow by four percent.
銷售預測是基於經濟將會增長4％這一假設之上的。

blocks.def: a speech or piece of writing that praises someone very much and does not mention anything bad about them
examples:
She delivered a panegyric on the president-elect.
她為當選總統獻上了一段頌詞。

blocks.def: lying down
examples:
She looked at Timothy's recumbent form beside her.
她看著躺在自己身邊的蒂莫西。

blocks.def: extremely stupid
examples:
an asinine comment
愚蠢透頂的意見

blocks.def: to hit someone hard and repeatedly with a heavy weapon
examples:
The two boys had been mercilessly bludgeoned to death.
那兩個男孩被殘忍地重撃致死。

blocks.def: to force someone to do something
examples:
The managers bludgeoned us into agreeing to the changes.
經理們逼迫我們同意所做的修改。

blocks.def: a heavy stick that is thick at one end and is used as a weapon
to tie something around your body or part of your body
blocks.trans: 將…圍在身上；將…纏在身上；（用某物）束…
examples:
The knights girded themselves for battle (= put on their swords and fighting clothes).
騎士們披甲佩劍準備戰鬥。

blocks.def: belonging to a low social class
examples:
He used to make fun of what he called her "plebeian origins".
他過去常拿她所謂的「平民出身」來開玩笑。
 He retained a plebeian taste in food and drink.
他在飲食方面的品味仍然很低俗。

blocks.def: If a slope is precipitous, it is very steep.
examples:
a precipitous mountain path
陡峭的山路

blocks.def: If a reduction or increase is precipitous, it is fast or great.
examples:
Over the past 18 months, there has been a precipitous fall in car sales.
在過去的18個月內汽車銷量暴跌。

blocks.def: one of the parts or layers into which something is separated
examples:
The report shows that drugs have penetrated every stratum of American society.
報告顯示，毒品已經滲入美國社會的各個階層。

blocks.def: a layer of rock, soil, or similar material
examples:
The cliffs are characterized by remarkable zigzagging strata of shale and sandstone.
這些懸崖的特徵是它們由一層層清晰易辨的頁岩、石灰岩和砂岩交錯構成。

blocks.def: agreement between and support for the members of a group, especially a political group
examples:
The situation raises important questions about solidarity among member states of the UN.
當前形勢對聯合國成員國能否團結一致這一重要問題提出了質疑。
 The purpose of the speech was to show solidarity with the country's leaders.
這場演講的目的是為了表示與國家領導人團結一致。

blocks.def: a wise saying
examples:
He remembered the old adage "Look before you leap".
他想起了那句老話「三思而後行」。

blocks.def: to move further away into the distance, or to become less clear or less bright
blocks.trans: 逐漸遠離；變得模糊，逐漸淡漠
examples:
As the boat picked up speed, the coastline receded into the distance until finally it became invisible.
船越開越快，海岸線漸漸遠去，直至最後從視線中消失。
 The painful memories gradually receded in her mind.
痛苦的記憶逐漸在她腦海中變得淡漠了。

blocks.def: a wall made of soil or other materials that is built next to a river to stop the river from overflowing (= coming out of a place because it is too full)
blocks.trans: 防洪堤（在河邊由土等材料築成的牆，以防止河水溢出）

blocks.def: a situation in which a lot of people complain about something angrily or make a lot of noise
examples:
The book caused an uproar in France.
該書在法國引起了軒然大波。
 The whole hall was in uproar after the announcement.
宣佈完後，整個大廳一片譁然。

blocks.def: a stylish, original, and very confident way of doing things that makes people admire you
examples:
The orchestra played with great panache.
管弦樂團的演奏氣勢磅礴。
 He dressed with panache.
他衣著十分瀟灑。

blocks.def: a person of bad character and habits
examples:
Every time I see you, you're drunk, you old reprobate!
我每次撞見你，你都酩酊大醉，你這個老惡棍。

blocks.def: to make unreasonable complaints, especially about things that are not important
blocks.trans: 無端指責；挑剔，吹毛求疵

blocks.def: to forcefully or angrily tell someone they should not have done a particular thing and criticize them for having done it
examples:
In newspaper articles she consistently upbraided those in authority who overstepped their limits.
在報載文章裡，她不斷譴責那些越權行事的當權者。

blocks.def: moving or speaking slowly with little energy, often in an attractive way
examples:
a languid manner/voice
徐緩從容的舉止／聲音

blocks.def: unable to be separated, released, or escaped from
blocks.trans: 分不開的；無法擺脫的；無法逃離的
examples:
In the case of King Arthur, legend and truth are often inextricable.
說起亞瑟王，傳說和真相常常交織在一起。

blocks.def: (of an angle) more than 90° and less than 180°
stupid and slow to understand, or unwilling to try to understand
examples:
The answer's obvious - or are you being deliberately obtuse?
答案很明顯——要不你們就是在故意裝傻？

blocks.def: someone involved in a skilled job or activity
examples:
Elizabeth Quan is a London-based practitioner of traditional Chinese medicine.
伊莉莎白‧康是一位在倫敦執業的中醫醫師。
 She was a medical practitioner (= a doctor) before she entered politics.
從政前她是個醫生。

blocks.def: being too proud or confident in yourself
blocks.trans: 傲慢的；自負的；過於自信的
examples:
overweening pride/arrogance/vanity
咄咄逼人的傲氣／傲慢／虛榮
 She is driven by overweening ambition.
她被不可一世的野心所驅使。

blocks.def: small, rounded stones, often mixed with sand
examples:
a gravel path
石子路

blocks.def: to explain something more than necessary
examples:
There's no need to belabour the point.
不必過多強調這一點。

blocks.def: to hit someone or something hard and repeatedly
examples:
She belaboured him with her walking stick.
她用拐杖把他痛打了一頓。

blocks.def: to criticize someone
understood without being expressed directly
examples:
tacit agreement/approval/support
默契／默許／暗中支持

blocks.def: a detailed plan or route of a journey
examples:
The tour operator will arrange transport and plan your itinerary.
旅行社工作人員將負責安排交通和行程計劃。

blocks.def: a very serious event resulting in great destruction and change
examples:
The book offers a vision of the future in which there is a great nuclear apocalypse.
這本書描述了未來核戰爭帶來的滅頂之災。

blocks.def: in the Bible, the total destruction and end of the world
listening carefully
examples:
an attentive audience
全神貫注的聽眾

blocks.def: If someone is attentive, they are very helpful and take care of you.
blocks.trans: 關心的；體貼的，照顧周到的
examples:
He was very attentive to her when she was ill.
她生病時，他對她體貼入微。
 A good teacher is always attentive to their students' needs.
一個好的老師總是對學生的需要很關心。

blocks.def: a short statement of a general truth, principle, or rule for behaviour
blocks.trans: 格言；基本原理；行為準則

comprise.pos: verb [ T,  L only + noun,  not continuous ]

blocks.def: to have as parts or members, or to be those parts or members
examples:
The course comprises a class book, a practice book, and a CD.
這門課的教材包括一冊課本、一本練習用書和一張光碟。
 The class is comprised mainly of Italian and French students.
這個班主要由義大利和法國學生組成。
 Italian students comprise 60 percent of the class.
義大利學生佔全班人數的60%。

blocks.def: saying correctly what will happen in the future
examples:
Much of Orwell's writing now seems grimly prophetic.
歐威爾的許多文學作品現在看來似乎是冷酷的預言。

blocks.def: a group of young birds all born at the same time
examples:
The blackbird flew back and forth to its brood.
畫眉飛來飛去的，忙於哺育幼雛。

blocks.def: a person's young children
examples:
Ann was at the party with her brood.
安和她的孩子們參加了聚會。

blocks.def: to think for a long time about things that make you sad, worried, or angry
examples:
I wish she wouldn't sit brooding in her room all day.
我希望她不要整天呆在房間裡憂心忡忡的。

blocks.def: to compete in order to win something
examples:
There are three world-class tennis players contending for this title.
有三位世界頂級網球選手爭奪這項冠軍。
 He's contending against someone with twice his experience.
他在和經驗比他豐富一倍的人競爭。

blocks.def: to say that something is true or is a fact
examples:
The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.
該律師聲稱她的委託人從未走近過犯罪現場。

blocks.def: A pungent smell or taste is very strong, sometimes unpleasantly strong.
examples:
the pungent whiff of a goat
山羊發出的刺鼻膻味
 I sat down to a cup of wonderfully pungent Turkish coffee.
我坐下來喝了一杯味道濃醇的土耳其咖啡。

blocks.def: Pungent speech or writing is very strongly felt.
examples:
pungent criticism/commentary
尖刻的批評／評論

blocks.def: friendliness and happiness
examples:
There was a lot of cheerful bonhomie amongst the people on the trip.
一路上，人們都十分友好，融洽相處。

blocks.def: to speak or write about something in great detail or for a long time
examples:
She expatiated on/upon her work for the duration of the meal.
她一直在飯桌上滔滔不絕地談論她的工作。

blocks.def: to shock someone, usually by telling that person something they were not expecting
blocks.trans: 使大吃一驚，使目瞪口呆
examples:
He was flabbergasted when we told him how cheap it was.
我們告訴他這東西有多便宜時，他驚得目瞪口呆。

blocks.def: a Christian priest with special duties in a cathedral
a rule, principle, or law, especially in the Christian Church
blocks.trans: 原則；準則；法規；（尤指）基督教教規

blocks.def: all the writings or other works known to be by a particular person
examples:
the Shakespearean canon
莎士比亞作品全集

blocks.def: not able to be changed or improved
blocks.trans: 最終的，決定性的；不可更改的
examples:
a definitive judgment/ruling
最終判決
 There are no definitive answers/solutions to this problem.
這個問題沒有決定性的答案/徹底的解決辦法。
 The police have no definitive proof of her guilt.
警察並未掌握她犯罪的確鑿證據。

blocks.def: considered to be the best of its type
examples:
He's written the definitive guide to Thailand.
他寫出了最完整可靠的泰國旅遊指南。

blocks.def: the quality of being patient and being able to forgive someone or control yourself in a difficult situation
examples:
[ + (that) ] He thanked his employees for the forbearance (that) they had shown during the company's difficult times.
他感謝員工們在公司的困難時期所表現出的耐心和寬容。

blocks.def: difficult to please
examples:
a finicky eater
挑食的人
 He's terribly finicky about his food.
他吃東西十分挑剔。

blocks.def: needing a lot of attention to detail
blocks.trans: 需細心的，需注意細節的
examples:
Repairing watches must be a very finicky job.
修錶一定是種需要細心的工作。

blocks.def: a carefully planned way of achieving or dealing with something, often involving a trick
examples:
Her stratagem for dealing with her husband's infidelities was to ignore them.
她對待丈夫不忠的策略就是佯裝不知。
 He was a master of stratagem.
他很有謀略。

blocks.def: a situation in which there is no organization and control, especially in society, because there is no effective government
blocks.trans: （尤指政府消亡或垮臺而引起的）無政府狀態，混亂狀態
examples:
What we are witnessing is the country's slow slide into anarchy.
我們現在親眼目睹著該國慢慢陷入無政府狀態。
 The country has been in a state of anarchy since the inconclusive election.
自那次了無結果的大選以來，該國一直處於混亂狀態。
 If the pay deal isn't settled amicably there'll be anarchy in the factories.
如果工資問題不能友好地解決，這些工廠將會一片混亂。

blocks.def: A palatial house is very large and beautiful.
A voluptuous woman has a soft, curved, sexually attractive body.
examples:
a voluptuous body/mouth/figure
性感的身體／嘴唇／身材

blocks.def: A voluptuous experience or object gives you a lot of pleasure because it feels extremely soft and comfortable or it sounds or looks extremely beautiful.
blocks.trans: 令人愉悅的；令人舒服的；滿足感官的
examples:
such voluptuous pleasure
如此舒適的享受
 I sank into the bed's voluptuous warmth.
我躺在溫暖舒適的床上。

blocks.def: attractively thin and able to move quickly and smoothly
to damage or show no respect towards something holy or very much respected
examples:
The mosque/shrine was desecrated by vandals.
清真寺／神殿遭到破壞分子的褻瀆。
 It's a crime to desecrate the country's flag.
褻瀆國旗是一種罪行。

blocks.def: a small case usually made of leather and fixed on a belt or a strap, used for carrying a gun
very great or to the largest degree possible
blocks.trans: 完全的；全部的；絕對的；毋庸置疑的
examples:
a man of absolute integrity/discretion
剛正不阿／極度審慎的人
 I have absolute faith in her judgment.
我完全相信她的判斷。
 There was no absolute proof of fraud.
沒有確鑿的證據能證明是詐騙行為。

blocks.def: used when expressing a strong opinion
blocks.trans: （用於強調觀點）道地的，十足的
examples:
He's an absolute idiot!
他是個十足的白癡！
 That's absolute rubbish!
那完全是一派胡言！

blocks.def: true, right, or the same in all situations and not depending on anything else
blocks.trans: 絕對的；不會更改的；獨立的；不受制於外部條件的
examples:
an absolute law/principle/doctrine
放之四海而皆準的法則／原則／學說
 Do you think there's such a thing as absolute truth/beauty?
你認為絕對的真理／美存在嗎？
 Her contribution was better than most, but in absolute terms (= without comparing it with anything else) it was not very good.
她的稿件比大部分人的都好，但就其本身而言還不夠好。

blocks.def: An absolute ruler has unlimited power.
blocks.trans: 不受任何限制（或約束）的；專制獨裁的
examples:
an absolute monarch
專制君主

blocks.def: having or showing the stated type of temper
examples:
even-tempered
性情平和的
 bad-tempered
脾氣暴躁的

blocks.def: a large cave
