to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility
examples:
to neglect your appearance/the house
不修邊幅／疏於整理花園
 He neglects that poor dog - he never takes him for walks or gives him any attention.
他對那隻可憐的狗漠不關心——從不帶牠散步，也從不關心牠。
 She's been neglecting her studies this semester.
她這個學期荒疏了自己的學業。

blocks.def: to not do something, often because you forget
examples:
I'd neglected to give him the name of the hotel where I'd be staying.
我忘記告訴他我住的賓館的名字。
 He neglected to mention the fact that we could lose money on the deal.
他忘記提及我們做這筆交易可能會虧本。

blocks.def: a situation in which you do not give enough care or attention to someone or something, or the state of not receiving enough care or attention
examples:
Both parents were found guilty of neglect and their child was taken away from them.
父母雙方均被判定對其子女未盡照顧義務，於是他們的孩子被帶走了。
 Over the years the church has fallen into a state of neglect.
多年來，這座教堂已淪落到無人理會的地步。

blocks.def: happening or done at a time that is not suitable or convenient
examples:
I'm sorry, you've called at an inopportune moment.
對不起，你的電話來得不是時候。

blocks.def: a person who has changed their feelings of support and duty from one political, religious, national, etc. group to a new one
blocks.trans: 叛徒；變節者；背叛者；叛教者
examples:
A band of renegades had captured the prince and were holding him to ransom.
一群叛變分子俘獲了王子，將其扣押索要贖金。

blocks.def: not military or religious, or relating to the ordinary people of a country
blocks.trans: 文職的；民用的；平民的，國民的
examples:
Helicopters are mainly used for military rather than civil use.
直升機主要用於軍事而非民用。
 After ten years of military dictatorship, the country now has a civil government.
經歷了十年軍事專制統治後，該國現在有了一個文人政府。
 We weren't married in church, but we had a civil ceremony in a registry office.
我們沒在教堂結婚，不過在婚姻登記處舉行了非宗教的儀式。

blocks.def: relating to private arguments between people or organizations rather than criminal matters
examples:
The matter would be better dealt with in the civil court rather than by an expensive criminal proceeding.
這事最好在民事法庭處理，而不要進行昂貴的刑事訴訟。

blocks.def: polite and formal
blocks.trans: 有禮貌的；文明的；客氣的
examples:
His manner was civil, though not particularly friendly.
他的態度很客氣，儘管不是特別友好。

blocks.def: hard boring work
examples:
the drudgery of housework
繁重乏味的家務

blocks.def: a short statement, especially one expressing advice or a general truth
examples:
He followed the famous American dictum "Don't get mad, get even".
他信奉那條著名的美國格言：「光生氣沒用，拿出行動來。」

blocks.def: understanding or realizing something
examples:
We should be cognizant of the fact that every complaint is not a justified complaint.
我們應該認識到並非每一樁投訴都是合理的。

blocks.def: to make someone have strong feelings of shock or of disapproval
examples:
I was appalled at/by the lack of staff in the hospital.
醫院裡人手之少令我震驚。
 The state of the kitchen appalled her.
廚房的髒亂讓她目瞪口呆。

blocks.def: to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe
examples:
They threatened to smother the animals with plastic bags.
他們威脅要用塑膠袋把這些動物悶死。

blocks.def: to kill something by covering it and preventing it from receiving the substances and conditions it needs for life
examples:
Snow soon smothered the last of the blooms.
不久大雪便扼殺了最後的花朵。
figurative I tried desperately to smother a sneeze (= I tried not to sneeze) during his speech.
他發言的時候，我努力控制自己不打噴嚏。

blocks.def: to stop a fire from burning by covering it with something that prevents air from reaching it
examples:
I threw a blanket over the stove to smother the flames.
我丟了一條毯子蓋在爐子上，把火悶熄。

blocks.def: to prevent something from developing or growing freely
examples:
The latest violence has smothered any remaining hopes for an early peace agreement.
最新的暴力事件扼殺了及早締結和平協定的僅存希望。

blocks.def: to give someone too much love and attention so that they do not feel independent or free
examples:
I think she broke off their engagement because she felt smothered by him.
我想她解除婚約是因爲她感覺他的愛快要讓她窒息了。

blocks.def: not having interest or losing interest because you have experienced something too many times
examples:
Flying is exciting the first time you do it, but you soon become jaded.
第一次坐飛機你會很興奮，但很快你就會厭倦了。
 Perhaps some caviar can tempt your jaded palate.
也許來些魚子醬能讓沒有食慾的你胃口大開。

blocks.def: freedom from punishment or from the unpleasant results of something that has been done
examples:
Criminal gangs are terrorizing the city with apparent impunity.
犯罪集團使市民人心惶惶卻顯然沒有受到懲罰。

blocks.def: a particular level or group of people within an organization such as an army or company
blocks.trans: （軍隊、企業等組織的）等級，階層，某一等級（或階層）的所有人
examples:
These salary increases will affect only the highest echelons of local government.
這些加薪措施僅僅會涉及到當地政府的最高層。
 the upper echelons of society
社會上層

blocks.def: a special arrangement of soldiers, aircraft, or ships
blocks.trans: （士兵、飛機或船隻的）梯形編隊，梯隊

blocks.def: an idea that a lot of people think is true but is in fact false
examples:
[ + that ] It is a common fallacy that women are worse drivers than men.
女性開車不如男性開得好，這是人們常有的謬見。

blocks.def: a statement or principle that is generally accepted to be true, but need not be so
examples:
It is a widely held axiom that governments should not negotiate with terrorists.
政府不應與恐怖分子談判，這是一個普遍認可的原則。

blocks.def: a formal statement or principle in mathematics, science, etc., from which other statements can be obtained
examples:
Euclid's axioms form the foundation of his system of geometry.
歐幾裡得公理構成了其幾何體系的基礎。

blocks.def: a piece of healthy skin or bone cut from one part of a person's body and used to repair another damaged part, or a piece cut from one living plant and attached to another plant so that it grows there
blocks.trans: 移植的皮膚（或骨骼）；嫁接用的枝條（或芽）
examples:
He has had a skin graft on his badly burned arm.
他的手臂嚴重燒傷，已經進行了植皮手術。

blocks.def: work
examples:
I've never been afraid of hard graft.
我從來就不怕做繁重的工作。

blocks.def: the act of getting money or advantage through the dishonest use of political power and influence
blocks.trans: （濫用政治權力進行的）貪汙，受賄，以權謀私
examples:
The whole government was riddled with graft, bribery, and corruption.
政府內到處充斥著以權謀私、行賄受賄和貪汙腐敗的行為。

blocks.def: to take and put in place a graft
examples:
Skin was removed from her leg and grafted on/onto her face.
從她的腿上取下皮膚移植到了她的臉上。

blocks.def: to join or add something new
blocks.trans: 使緊密結合；將（新的事物）移植於
examples:
The management tried unsuccessfully to graft new working methods onto the existing ways of doing things.
管理階層試圖將新的工作方法和現有的經營方式相結合，但是並未成功。

blocks.def: to work hard
examples:
It was very sad that after spending all those years grafting (away), he died so soon after he retired.
他拼命工作了那麼多年，可剛退休就去世了，真是讓人傷感。

blocks.def: a hard worker
the surface in a cookerthat can be heated to very high temperatures and under which you put food to be cooked
a frame of metal bars over a fire on which food can be put to be cooked
an informal restaurant that sells grilled food such as hamburgers, steak, and chicken
to cook food over fire or hot coals, usually on a metal frame
examples:
Dad was grilling chicken in the back yard.
爸爸在後院烤雞。

blocks.def: to cook something under a very hot surface in a cooker
blocks.trans: （將食物置於烤箱中溫度極高的炙烤架下）燒烤，烤制
examples:
I'll grill the bacon rather than fry it.
我會炙烤培根，而不是油煎。

blocks.def: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time
examples:
After being grilled by the police for two days, Johnson signed a confession.
被警方審問了兩天後，約翰遜在供狀上簽字認罪。
 Her parents would grill her about where she'd been.
她父母會盤問她到哪裡去了。

blocks.def: to defend yourself from a weapon or an attack by pushing the weapon away or by putting something between your body and the weapon
to manage cleverly to avoid dealing with a difficult question or some criticism
examples:
Predictably the president parried enquiries about the arms scandal.
正如所料，總統迴避了有關武器醜聞的種種查問。

blocks.def: a remark or action that is a social mistake and not considered polite
examples:
I made a real gaffe - I called his new wife "Judy", which is the name of his ex-wife.
我一時失言出了大醜——把他的新任妻子叫成了「裘蒂」，那可是他前妻的名字啊。
 You started eating before anyone else had been served? What a gaffe!
沒等其他人的飯菜上桌你就開始吃了，那是不是有點失禮啊？

blocks.def: When a solid deliquesces, it becomes liquid as it absorbs moisture from the air.
present or having an effect everywhere at the same time
blocks.trans: 無所不在的，遍及各處的
examples:
The singer became an omnipresent icon of style and beauty.
這位歌手成了一個時尚與美麗的符號，無所不在。

blocks.def: an animal, plant, or person that lives in or is often in a particular place
blocks.trans: （特定地區的）居民，常住者，動物，植物
examples:
Deer and squirrels are among the denizens of the forest.
鹿和松鼠是森林地帶的常見動物。

blocks.def: the fact that something is incongruous
(especially in the past in South Africa) a political system in which people of different races are separated
examples:
the long-awaited dismantling (= end) of apartheid
盼望已久的對種族隔離制度的廢除

blocks.def: the people, physical, and social conditions and events that provide the environment in which someone acts or lives
blocks.trans: 社會背景；周圍環境；出身背景
examples:
It is a study of the social and cultural milieu in which Michelangelo lived and worked.
這是一項對米開朗基羅生活和工作所處的社會與文化背景的研究。

blocks.def: a piece of music at the end of a longer piece of music, usually separate from the basic structure
blocks.trans: （樂曲、樂章的）結束樂段，結尾，尾聲
examples:
The coda is often more technically difficult than the rest of the piece.
樂章的尾聲在演奏技巧上的難度一般比其他部分要高。

blocks.def: the final or extra part of a speech, event, or piece of writing
blocks.trans: （演講、事件、文章的）結尾，尾聲，附加部分
examples:
In a coda to the main exhibition are various works that were once attributed to Rembrandt.
作為主展覽的附加展覽，還展出了許多曾被認為出自林布蘭之手的作品。

blocks.def: the end of a syllable
in danger of being damaged or destroyed
examples:
The lives of thousands of birds are in jeopardy as a result of the oil spill.
石油洩漏使成千上萬隻鳥兒的生命受到威脅。

blocks.def: the quality of showing a clear and deep understanding of serious matters
examples:
the profundity of his remarks
他話語的深刻性

blocks.def: a remark or thought that shows, or is intended to show, great understanding
examples:
We would sit up all night exchanging profundities.
我們會整晚不睡，交談著深奧的哲理。

blocks.def: the quality of being felt or experienced very strongly
a system of government in which the richest people in a country rule or have power
examples:
It's time we put an end to plutocracy.
到了該終結財閥統治的時候了。

blocks.def: a country where the richest people have power
blocks.trans: 富豪（或財閥）統治的國家

blocks.def: the richest people in a country who have power in it
a chemical used for preventing infection in an injury, especially by killing bacteria
blocks.trans: 防腐劑；（尤指）殺菌劑，消毒劑
examples:
Antiseptic is used to sterilize the skin before giving an injection.
消毒劑用於注射前給皮膚消毒。
 Many of the ingredients for antiseptics come from the rainforests.
很多殺菌劑的原料產自熱帶雨林。

blocks.def: completely free from infection
blocks.trans: 不受感染的；消過毒的；無菌的
examples:
In the 1870s and 1880s, doctors began to follow the principles of antiseptic surgery.
在19世紀70和80年代，醫生開始遵循無菌外科手術原則。

blocks.def: too clean and showing no imagination and character
blocks.trans: 過分整潔而顯得單調的，過於整潔而呆板的
examples:
There's an antiseptic feeling to the new town centre, with its covered shopping mall.
新建的市中心購物廣場上面架了棚頂，一切過於整潔而顯得有些呆板。

blocks.def: happiness, luck, or a condition that produces positive results
blocks.trans: 幸福；幸運；令人幸福的事
examples:
the dubious felicity of marriage
婚姻的憂喜未蔔

blocks.def: the fact that words or remarks are suitable and express what was intended
blocks.trans: （文字或語言的）貼切，恰當，得體
examples:
As a songwriter, he combined great linguistic felicity with an ear for a tune.
作為一名詞曲作者，他既深諳樂曲的曲調又有著不俗的文采。

blocks.def: a word or remark that is suitable or right and expresses well the intended thought or feeling
blocks.trans: 恰當的語句；精妙的評論
examples:
Her article contained one or two verbal felicities that will stay in my mind for years.
她的文章中有一兩句精妙之語，會令我多年難以忘懷。

blocks.def: a person who helps an enemy that has taken control of his or her country
expressing personal thoughts and feelings in a beautiful way
examples:
The book contains lyrical descriptions of the author's childhood.
這本書裡有對作者童年的抒情性描寫。

blocks.def: to talk about something with a lot of interest or excitement
blocks.trans: 興致勃勃地談話，眉飛色舞地說
examples:
I recall Rosie waxing lyrical about the flatness of his stomach.
我想起了羅西說起他平坦的腹部時眉飛色舞的樣子。

blocks.def: very strong public criticism or blame
blocks.trans: 公開的嚴厲批評（或責駡）
examples:
His controversial essays have brought him much obloquy.
他帶有爭議的文章招來了許多公開的責駡。

blocks.def: to return to an older and worse state
evil
examples:
acts/crimes of moral turpitude
道德敗壞的行為／罪行

blocks.def: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
blocks.trans: 易於遭受（疾病）的；有（消極）傾向的
examples:
I've always been prone to headaches.
我總是容易頭痛。
 He was prone to depression even as a teenager.
甚至在青少年時期他就容易情緒抑鬱。
 She's prone to exaggerate, that's for sure.
她喜歡誇大其詞，這一點是肯定的。

blocks.def: lying face down
examples:
The photograph showed a man lying prone on the pavement, a puddle of blood around his head.
這張照片上一名男子趴在人行道上，頭部周圍有一灘血。

blocks.def: likely to experience a particular problem more often than is usual
examples:
accident-prone
易出事故的
 injury-prone
易受傷的

blocks.def: empty, simple, or obvious, especially without decoration or anything that is not necessary
blocks.trans: 赤裸的；簡單的；明顯的；（尤指）毫無修飾的，粗陋的；嚴重的；極端的
examples:
It was a stark room with a bed and chair as the only furniture.
這個房間很簡陋，僅有的傢俱就是一張床和一把椅子。
 The stark reality is that we are operating at a huge loss.
嚴酷的事實是我們的經營虧損非常嚴重。
 In the suburbs the spacious houses stand in stark (= extreme) contrast to the slums of the city's poor.
郊區寬敞的大房子和城裡的貧民窟形成了鮮明的對比。

blocks.def: completely or extremely
examples:
The children were splashing in the river, stark naked.
孩子們一絲不掛地在河裡玩水。
 If I didn't exercise, I think I'd go raving mad (UK also stark staring mad) from sitting at a desk all day.
如果不做運動的話，我想整天坐在辦公桌面前會讓我完全發瘋的。

blocks.def: a very deep hole that seems to have no bottom
a difficult situation that brings trouble or destruction
examples:
The country is sinking/plunging into an abyss of violence and lawlessness.
這個國家正陷入暴力和法制崩潰的深淵。
 She found herself on the edge of an abyss.
她發現自己岌岌可危。

blocks.def: extreme unhappiness caused by physical or mental suffering
blocks.trans: （肉體或精神上的）極度痛苦，劇痛，悲痛
examples:
His anguish at the outcome of the court case was very clear.
得知案件的庭審結果，他痛苦欲絕，這是顯而易見的。
 In her anguish she forgot to leave a message.
萬分悲痛之中，她忘了留個口信。

blocks.def: to travel along a route that was not originally intended, or to move outside a limited area
blocks.trans: 偏離原路；越過限定區域
examples:
A herd of cattle had strayed into the road.
一群牛偏道了，上了公路。
 They got lost when they strayed too far from the path.
他們偏離小路太遠，迷了路。
 The ship strayed off course during the storm.
船在暴風雨中偏離了航道。

blocks.def: to start thinking or talking about a different subject from the one you should be giving attention to
examples:
I think we've strayed too far from our original plan.
我想我們偏離原來的計劃太遠了。
 Sorry - I've strayed from the subject.
對不起——我離題了。

blocks.def: a pet that no longer has a home or cannot find its home
examples:
a stray dog
流浪狗
 "Who owns that cat?" "I don't know. I think it must be a stray."
「那隻貓是誰的？」「我不知道。我覺得牠肯定是隻流浪貓。」

blocks.def: Stray things have moved apart from similar things and are not in their expected or intended place.
examples:
There are still a few stray spots of paint on the window pane.
窗戶玻璃上還有零星的幾個油漆點。
 Several journalists have been killed or injured by stray bullets while reporting on the civil war.
有幾位記者在報導內戰時因被流彈打中而喪命或負傷。

blocks.def: serious, boring, and slightly old-fashioned
blocks.trans: 嚴肅無趣的；一本正經的；古板的
examples:
In an attempt to change its staid image, the newspaper has created a new section aimed at younger readers.
那家報紙爲改變其古板的形象，開設了一個針對年輕讀者的新版面。

blocks.def: the quality of being soft enough to be changed into a new shape
to remember officially and give respect to a great person or event, especially by a public ceremony or by making a statue or special building
blocks.trans: （尤指舉行公開儀式或豎立雕塑或特別建築）紀念，緬懷
examples:
Gathered all together in this church, we commemorate those who lost their lives in the war.
我們聚集在這座教堂裡，緬懷那些在大戰中喪生的人。
 A statue has been built to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the poet's birthday.
為紀念詩人百年誕辰建起了一尊雕像。

blocks.def: to suggest, without being direct, that something unpleasant is true
examples:
[ + (that) ] Are you insinuating (that) I'm losing my nerve?
你是在暗示我膽怯了嗎？
 What are you insinuating, Daniel?
丹尼爾，你究竟在影射甚麼？

blocks.def: a present given to someone to thank them for helping you, or payment given to someone because of slight problems or because of the loss of or damage to their property
examples:
I received £500 from my neighbour in recompense for the damage to my wall.
鄰居支付了我500英鎊，作為損壞牆壁的賠償。

blocks.def: a very powerful attack
examples:
It is unlikely that his forces could withstand an enemy onslaught for very long.
他的軍隊不大可能長時間抵禦聯軍的強攻。
 Scotland's onslaught on Wales in the second half of the match earned them a 4–1 victory.
蘇格蘭隊在下半場猛攻威爾斯隊，以4比1贏取勝利。

blocks.def: An inflammable substance or material burns very easily.
examples:
a highly inflammable liquid such as petrol
汽油之類極易燃的液體

blocks.def: likely to become violent or angry very quickly and in an uncontrolled way
examples:
an inflammable situation/region
一觸即發的局勢／地區
 a highly inflammable mix of outrage and bitterness
夾雜著憤怒和怨恨的一觸即發的情緒

blocks.def: a type of joint used to fix two pieces of wood firmly together
to cause something to fit exactly together
examples:
Their results dovetail nicely with ours.
他們的結果與我們的非常吻合。
 We tried to dovetail our plans with theirs.
我們試圖把我們的計劃與他們的計劃銜接起來。

blocks.def: used to say how bad something is
examples:
He dismissed the rumours as `arrant nonsense'.
他把那些傳聞斥為「一派胡言」。

blocks.def: something that you say or do that shows you do not respect God or a religion
blocks.trans: （對上帝或宗教的）褻瀆；褻瀆的言行；侮慢的言行
examples:
to be accused of blasphemy
被譴責褻瀆上帝
figurative humorous Madonna fans think that any criticism of her is blasphemy.
瑪丹娜的歌迷們認為對她的任何批評都是對她的不敬。

blocks.def: Internecine war or fighting happens between members of the same group, religion, or country.
examples:
internecine war/warfare
內戰

blocks.def: (lying) flat on your back, looking up
examples:
We walked along the beach, past the rows of supine bodies soaking up the sun.
我們沿著海灘漫步，一路上到處都是一排排仰臥在海灘上曬太陽的人。

blocks.def: If you are supine, you are weak and willing to accept the control of others.
blocks.trans: 軟弱的，易受他人控制的
examples:
The new director has introduced a series of changes against little opposition from the supine staff.
新任主管進行了一系列改革，並沒有遭到軟弱消極的員工多少反對。

blocks.def: to embarrass someone or make them feel uncomfortable
examples:
Her elder cousins abashed her by commenting on her shyness.
她的堂兄弟們她腼腆性格的議論使她感到羞愧。
 They tried not to be abashed by the unfamiliar luxury.
他們盡量不因難得一見的奢華而感到窘迫。

blocks.def: An apocryphal story is probably not true although it is often told and believed by some people to have happened.
blocks.trans: （一些廣為流傳的故事）可疑的，不足為信的，杜撰的
examples:
an apocryphal story
杜撰的故事
 It's a good story but I dare say it's apocryphal.
故事不錯，但很可能是杜撰的。

blocks.def: people with a good education who know a lot about literature
examples:
Her novels are popular with university literati, but they have failed to attract a wider audience.
她的小說受到大學裡文人學者的歡迎，但對更廣泛的讀者卻沒有甚麽吸引力。

blocks.def: a temporary change from the typical or usual way of behaving
blocks.trans: （暫時的）脫離常規；反常現象；異常行為
examples:
In a moment of aberration, she agreed to go with him.
她一反常態，竟然答應跟他一起去了。
 I'm sorry I'm late - I had a mental aberration and forgot we had a meeting today.
對不起，我遲到了。我一時糊塗，竟然忘了今天有會。

blocks.def: giving all your attention to something
blocks.trans: 全神貫注的；專心致志的
examples:
She was so engrossed by/in the book that she forgot the cookies in the oven.
她看書看得太入迷了，以至於忘了烤箱中正烤著餅乾。
 They were so engrossed in/with what they were doing that they didn't hear me come in.
他們全神貫注地做著手上的事，連我進去都沒有聽見。

blocks.def: a person who behaves in an extremely stupid way
examples:
What an imbecile that boy is!
那個男孩真笨！

blocks.def: very angry or easily annoyed
blocks.trans: 暴怒的；易怒的，性情暴躁的

blocks.def: getting pleasure from food and drink of high quality

an 
epicure formal
a written record of historical events
examples:
the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle
《盎格魯－撒克遜人編年史》
 a chronicle of the French Revolution
法國大革命編年史

blocks.def: part of the name of a newspaper
examples:
the Hampshire Chronicle
《漢普郡記事報》

blocks.def: to make a record or give details of something
blocks.trans: 記述，紀錄（大事）；把…載入編年史
examples:
The book chronicles the writer's coming to terms with his illness.
這本書記述了作者慢慢學會忍受自己病痛的前後過程。

blocks.def: Palatable food or drink has a pleasant taste.
examples:
a very palatable wine
美酒
 The meal was barely palatable.
這頓飯根本談不上可口。

blocks.def: acceptable
blocks.trans: 可以接受的，合乎趣味的
examples:
I'm afraid the members won't find all these changes very palatable.
恐怕會員不會覺得這些改變全都很合他們的心意。

blocks.def: a person who is too interested in formal rules and small details that are not important
to (try to) get something from someone else without paying for it
examples:
He's always cadging free meals and free trips from/off his clients.
他吃飯和出行都總愛佔客戶的便宜。
 Can I cadge a lift home?
能讓我搭個順風車回家嗎？

blocks.def: light and delicate, especially in an unnatural way
blocks.trans: 輕飄的，縹緲的；優雅的；（尤指）超凡的
examples:
an ethereal being
精靈
 ethereal beauty
超凡的美

blocks.def: having suffered someone ending a romantic relationship with you suddenly and unkindly
examples:
Her jilted boyfriend has sworn revenge on her new husband.
被她拋棄的男朋友發誓要報復她的新婚丈夫。
 The jilted bride-to-be had to return the $17,000 engagement ring.
被拋棄的準新娘不得不歸還價值1.7萬美元的訂婚戒指。

blocks.def: very thin, or easily broken or destroyed
blocks.trans: 很薄的；易破的；易損壞的
examples:
You won't be warm enough in that flimsy dress.
你穿那麽薄的衣服不夠暖和。
 We spent the night in a flimsy wooden hut.
我們在一個不太堅固的小木屋裡過了一夜。
 a flimsy cardboard box
薄紙板箱

blocks.def: A flimsy argument, excuse, etc. is weak and difficult to believe.
blocks.trans: （論點、藉口等）不足信的，站不住腳的
examples:
When I asked him why he was late, he gave me some flimsy excuse about having car trouble.
我問他為甚麽遲到時，他給了個很不足信的藉口，說車出毛病了。

blocks.def: behaviour that shows no interest or energy and shows that someone is unwilling to take action, especially over something important
blocks.trans: 無興趣，懈怠；（尤指對重要事情的）漠不關心，無動於衷
examples:
widespread apathy among students
學生中普遍的懈怠情緒
 voter apathy
選民的冷漠態度

blocks.def: the disagreement that results from opposing arguments
examples:
There's a lot of contention about that issue - for every person firmly in favour, there's someone fiercely against it.
那個問題爭議很多——有一人堅決支持，就有一人激烈反對。
 The issue has been settled - it's no longer in contention.
這個問題已經解決——不再有爭議。

blocks.def: an opinion expressed in an argument
examples:
[ + that ] It is her contention that exercise is more important than diet if you want to lose weight.
她的看法是，要想減肥，鍛煉比節食更重要。

blocks.def: to be able/not able to achieve or win something, especially in sports
blocks.trans: （尤指在體育運動中）有／（沒有）機會贏得…
examples:
This loss puts them out of contention for the playoffs this year.
這次失利使他們失去了贏得今年的季後賽的機會。

blocks.def: If you condescend to do something, you agree to do something that you do not consider to be good enough for your social position.
examples:
I wonder if Michael will condescend to visit us?
我不知道麥可是否會屈尊造訪我們？

blocks.def: forming the bottom layer of something
examples:
cells in the basal layer of skin
皮膚基底細胞

blocks.def: not trusting someone or something and usually avoiding him, her, or it if possible
blocks.trans: 不信任的；戒備的，防備的
examples:
I've always been a little leery of authority figures.
我對權威人物一直存有戒心。

blocks.def: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect
examples:
As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done, we would like you to accept this small gift.
為了表示我們對你們所做的一切的感謝，希望你們接受我們這份小小的禮物。
 It doesn't have to be a big present - it's just a token.
禮物不必大——只是為了表示一下。

blocks.def: a piece of paper with a particular amount of money printed on it that can be exchanged in a shop for goods of that value
examples:
a £20 book/gift/record token
一張價值20英鎊的書券／禮券／唱片券

blocks.def: a round metal or plastic disc that is used instead of money in some machines
blocks.trans: （某些機器中用以代替紙幣的）代幣，專用輔幣

blocks.def: Token actions are done to show that you are doing something, even if the results are limited in their effect.
blocks.trans: 有標誌性的；有象徵意義的
examples:
The troops in front of us either surrendered or offered only token (= not much) resistance.
我們前面的軍隊要麼投降，要麼只作了象徵性的抵抗。
 They were the only country to argue for even token recognition of the Baltic states' independence.
他們是唯一為波羅的海沿岸國家爭取哪怕是象徵性承認的國家。

blocks.def: used to refer to something that is done to prevent other people complaining, although it is not sincerely meant and has no real effect
examples:
The truth is that they appoint no more than a token number of women to managerial jobs.
事實上他們只裝裝樣子，任命了一些女性擔任管理工作。

blocks.def: to solve or end a problem or difficulty
examples:
Have you resolved the problem of transport yet?
你們解決交通問題了嗎？
 The couple resolved their differences and made an effort to get along.
這對夫妻消除了他們之間的分歧，盡力融洽相處。

blocks.def: to make a decision formally or with determination
examples:
[ + that ] She resolved that she would never speak to him again.
她決心再也不理他。
 [ + adv/prep ] After hours of argument, they resolved against taking legal action.
經過幾個小時的爭論，他們決定不提起訴訟。
 [ + to infinitive ] The company resolved to take no further action against the thieves.
公司決定不再繼續追究這些竊賊。

blocks.def: strong determination
examples:
to weaken/strengthen/test someone's resolve
削弱／增強／考驗某人的決心

blocks.def: the responsibility or duty to do something
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] The onus is on the landlord to ensure that the property is habitable.
房東有責任保證房子適宜居住。
 We are trying to shift the onus for passenger safety onto the government.
我們正試圖把保證旅客安全的責任交給政府。

blocks.def: to make a serious decision to stop doing something
examples:
to forswear all violence
發誓停止所有暴力行為

blocks.def: to use or spend time, effort, or money
blocks.trans: 花費，消費，耗費（尤指時間、精力或錢）
examples:
You expend so much effort for so little return.
你費了那麼大功夫，回報卻這麼微不足道。
 Governments expend a lot of resources on war.
各國政府在戰爭上消耗了大量資源。

blocks.def: a very steep side of a cliff or a mountain
examples:
The film opens with a shot of a climber dangling from a precipice.
電影開始時是一個登山者懸在峭壁上的鏡頭。

blocks.def: a dangerous situation that could lead to harm or failure
examples:
This latest tax increase may push many small companies over the financial precipice.
最近的這次增稅可能會使許多小公司的財務陷入險境。

blocks.def: proudly refusing to obey authority
examples:
a defiant attitude/gesture
挑釁的態度／姿態
 The protesters blocking the entrance to the offices remained defiant this morning.
堵在辦公室入口的抗議者今天早晨態度依然強硬。

blocks.def: not willing to accept criticism or disapproval
blocks.trans: 不接受批評的；不接受不同意見的
examples:
The CEO was in a defiant mood as she entered the boardroom.
執行長進入會場的時候一副聽不進意見的樣子。

blocks.def: a person who studies birds
relating to brothers
examples:
fraternal rivalry
兄弟間的競爭

blocks.def: friendly, like brothers
blocks.trans: 友好的，兄弟般的，親如手足的
examples:
The president's official visit marks the start of a more fraternal relationship between the two countries.
總統的正式訪問標誌著兩國間開始建立起一種更加親密友好的關係。

blocks.def: connected with feelings of pleasure
examples:
Many purchases are related to hedonic impulses.
許多購物行為和享樂衝動有關。

blocks.def: a person who enjoys high quality food and drink
If light dazzles you, it makes you unable to see for a short time.
blocks.trans: 使感到刺眼，使感到目眩
examples:
I was dazzled by the sunlight.
陽光刺得我張不開眼。

blocks.def: If you are dazzled by someone or something, you think they are extremely good and exciting.
examples:
I was dazzled by his charm and good looks.
我為他的魅力和堂堂相貌所傾倒。

blocks.def: to experience great difficulties or be completely unable to decide what to do or say next
blocks.trans: 困難重重；艱苦掙扎；不知所措
examples:
He lost the next page of his speech and floundered around/about for a few seconds.
他把演講稿的下一頁弄丟了，支支吾吾了幾秒鐘。
 Although his business was a success, his marriage was floundering.
他雖然事業有成，可婚姻卻陷入了困境。
 Richardson resigned as chairman, leaving the company floundering.
理查森辭去了董事長職務，公司因此在困境中苦苦掙扎。

blocks.def: a flat sea fish that can be eaten
connected with the meanings of words
having a loud and high sound that is unpleasant or painful to listen to
examples:
She had a shrill high-pitched voice.
她的聲音尖銳而刺耳。

blocks.def: used to describe a way of arguing or criticizing that seems too forceful
examples:
He launched a shrill attack on the prime minister.
他對首相進行了刻薄的批評。

blocks.def: likely to argue or disagree
examples:
The Lisbon Treaty was the result of long negotiations among the factious states of Europe.
《里斯本條約》是歐洲各派國家長期談判的結果。

blocks.def: the quality of being very great in amount or degree
examples:
The exhibit confirms the prodigality of Leonardo da Vinci's genius. 
這次展覽證實了李奧納多·達·文西天偉大的創造能力。
 It is the sheer prodigality of Stoppard's wit and invention that first enchants.
最令人著迷的是斯託帕德偉大的智慧和發明本身。

blocks.def: to cut off the head of a person
to keep someone completely interested
examples:
The baseball game completely enthralled the crowd.
棒球賽使得觀眾們完全著了迷。
 The audience was enthralled for two hours by a sparkling, dramatic performance.
兩個小時的表演妙趣橫生，高潮迭起，觀眾們看得如醉如癡。
 They listened enthralled to what he was saying.
他們沈醉在他的敘述中。

blocks.def: a short piece of writing or a poem about a dead person, especially one written on their gravestone
blocks.trans: 悼文；悼亡詩；（尤指）墓誌銘

blocks.def: a part or share of something, especially when it is divided into two parts
blocks.trans: 部分（尤指兩個組成部分中的一部分）

blocks.def: a part of a molecule
to please and make calm a god or person who is annoyed with you
examples:
In those days people might sacrifice a goat or sheep to propitiate an angry god.
在那個時候，人們可能會祭獻一隻山羊或綿羊以祈求發怒的神明息怒。
 The radicals in the party were clearly sacked to propitiate the conservative core.
開除政黨中的激進分子顯然是為了安撫保守的核心成員。

blocks.def: to make a long speech in order to delay or prevent a new law being made
blocks.trans: （為拖延或阻止新法律的通過而）發表冗長的演說
examples:
Conceivably, supporters of the law could filibuster to prevent it from being revised.
可以想像，該法律的支持者會用冗長的演說去阻止其被修訂。

blocks.def: to make a building look new again by doing work such as painting, repairing, and cleaning
examples:
The developers refurbished the house inside and out.
開發商把這座房子裡外翻修一新。

blocks.def: a very clear message or instruction about what action is needed
examples:
to issue/sound a clarion call for change
吹響變革的號角

blocks.def: wise, especially as a result of great experience
blocks.trans: （尤指因經驗豐富而）明智的，睿智的
examples:
sage advice
明智的忠告
 my sage old grandfather
我那睿智的老祖父

blocks.def: a plant whose greyish-green leaves are used as a herb to give flavour to some foods
blocks.trans: 鼠尾草，洋蘇草（其灰綠色的葉子可用作香草調味）
examples:
sage-and-onion stuffing
鼠尾草和洋蔥製成的餡

blocks.def: a person, especially an old man, who is wise
to make someone feel worried or angry
examples:
I didn't want to agitate her by telling her.
我不想告訴她，免得她焦慮。

blocks.def: to argue forcefully, especially in public, in order to achieve a particular type of change
blocks.trans: （尤指公開）煽動，鼓動，大聲疾呼
examples:
The unions continue to agitate for higher pay.
工會繼續大聲疾呼要求加薪。
 As a young man, he had agitated against the Vietnam war.
他年輕時曾公開反對越南戰爭。

blocks.def: to shake a liquid
examples:
Pour the powder into the solution and agitate it until the powder has dissolved.
將粉末倒入溶液中，攪動到溶解為止。

blocks.def: a set of seats arranged in rising rows, sometimes covered by a roof, from which people can easily watch sports or other events
done or said without any preparation or thought
blocks.trans: 即興的；無準備的；即席的
examples:
an extemporaneous speech
即席演講

blocks.def: a loud shout or whistle (= high sound) expressing disapproval, especially made by people in a crowd
blocks.trans: （尤指人群中表示反對的）尖叫聲，噓聲，口哨聲

blocks.def: to make food or drink weaker or to lower its quality, by adding something else
examples:
There were complaints that the beer had been adulterated with water.
有多人投訴說這啤酒裡面混了水。

blocks.def: (especially of a person) round or rounded in shape
blocks.trans: 圓形的；（尤指人）圓胖的，矮胖的

blocks.def: connected with horses, or appearing similar to a horse
examples:
equine flu
馬流感
 The portraits showed an aristocratic family with long equine faces.
這是一套貴族家庭的畫像，所有人都長著長長的馬臉。

blocks.def: a liquid that is painted onto wood or paintings to protect the surface, or the hard shiny surface it produces when it dries
examples:
Polyurethane varnish provides a tough, scratch-resistant finish.
聚胺酯罩光漆可以形成一層堅硬防劃的表面。
 a final coat of (clear) varnish
最後一層清漆

blocks.def: to put varnish on a surface
examples:
They decided to spend the weekend varnishing their boat.
他們決定用週末的時間給他們的船上清漆。

blocks.def: to use nail varnish
very great size or importance
examples:
Nobody fully understands the enormity and complexity of the task of reviving the country's economy.
沒有人完全認清振興該國經濟這一任務的艱巨性和複雜性。
 I don't think you realize the enormity of the problem.
我覺得你沒有真正意識到問題的嚴重性。

blocks.def: an extremely evil act or the quality of being extremely evil
morally bad and making you feel ashamed
examples:
an ignoble action/idea
卑鄙的行為／想法

blocks.def: easily upset or shocked by things that you find unpleasant or that you do not approve of
blocks.trans: 容易心煩意亂的；易受驚的；神經質的
examples:
She's really squeamish and can't stand the sight of blood.
她神經很脆弱，見不得血。
 Many cooks are squeamish about putting live shellfish into boiling water.
很多廚師把活生生的貝類放進滾水中時都於心不忍。

blocks.def: to smile in a silly or annoying way
examples:
She gave her teacher a simpering smile.
她對著自己的老師傻笑。

blocks.def: to refuse to give something or to keep back something
examples:
to withhold information/support
拒絕提供消息／給予支援
 During the trial, the prosecution was accused of withholding crucial evidence from the defence.
審判期間，原告被指控對被告隱瞞了十分重要的證據。
 Police are withholding the dead woman's name until her relatives have been informed.
在通知女性死者的親屬之前，警方拒絕透露她的名字。
 She withheld her rent until the landlord agreed to have the repairs done.
她拒付房租，直到房東答應進行維修。
 The government is planning to withhold benefit payments from single mothers who refuse to name the father of their child.
對於那些拒絕說出自己孩子的父親是誰的單身母親，政府正計劃取消她們的救濟金。

blocks.def: An indelible mark or substance is impossible to remove by washing or in any other way.
examples:
indelible ink
洗不掉的墨水漬
 The blood had left an indelible mark on her shirt.
她襯衫上留下的血跡洗不掉。

blocks.def: Indelible memories or actions are impossible to forget, or have a permanent influence or effect.
blocks.trans: （記憶或行為）不可磨滅的，忘不掉的
examples:
I have an indelible memory of that meeting with Anastasia.
我永遠忘不了那次與安娜塔西亞的會面。
 In his 20 years working for the company, Joe Pearson made an indelible impression on it.
在為公司工作的20年中，喬‧皮爾遜給公司留下了難以磨滅的印象。

blocks.def: to try to persuade someone to do something or give you something by praising them or being intentionally charming
blocks.trans: 哄騙；用花言巧語說服；誆騙
examples:
She's one of those children who can wheedle you into giving her anything she wants.
她這個孩子，可以用甜言蜜語哄得你給她任何她想要的東西。
 She wasn't invited, but somehow she managed to wheedle her way in.
她沒有被邀請，可她不知怎麼連哄帶騙地混了進來。
 I tried different approaches - I wheedled, threatened, demanded, cajoled.
各種辦法我都試過了——連哄帶騙、威逼利誘、強烈要求、甜言蜜語。

blocks.def: too noticeable
examples:
The logo was still visible but less obtrusive this time in beige.
標識這次改用米色，不那麼扎眼但也能看清。
 The soldiers were in civilian clothes, to make their presence less obtrusive.
為了在現場不那麼引人注目，士兵們穿著便裝。

blocks.def: very bad
examples:
an execrable performance
極拙劣的表演
 Some critics praised the acting, but all condemned the execrable plot.
。

blocks.def: very bad, dangerous, or uncertain
blocks.trans: 糟糕的；危險的；不可預測的
examples:
Relations between the two countries have been in a parlous state for some time.
兩國之間的關係已經僵持了一段時間。
 I'd like to buy a new car, but my finances are in such a parlous state that I can't afford to.
我想買輛新車，但我的財務狀況非常糟糕，買不起。

blocks.def: physical and not spiritual
relating to the body
the process of giving people social or political freedom and rights
blocks.trans: 解放；給予人們政治或社會自由權利
examples:
women's/female emancipation
婦女／女性解放
 black emancipation
黑人的解放

blocks.def: having a very pleasant taste or smell
examples:
Her jam was ambrosial, syrupy with honeyed fruit, and scented with elderflower.
她做的果醬美味芬芳，浸蜜的水果甘甜美味，接骨木花增添了芬芳。
 The shop was full of ambrosial smells.
店裡芬芳四溢。

blocks.def: to cut off branches from a tree, bush, or plant, especially so that it will grow better in the future
examples:
She spent the afternoon pruning roses.
她用下午的時間修剪了玫瑰。

blocks.def: to reduce something by removing things that are not necessary
examples:
Arco has reacted to the loss in revenue by pruning (back) its expansion plans.
大西洋里奇菲爾德公司通過縮減擴張計畫以應對收益虧損。
 I felt his essay needed a little pruning.
我認為他的文章需要稍作刪改。

blocks.def: a dried plum
a slow sad song or piece of music, sometimes played because someone has died
having no energy and enthusiasm and unwilling to do anything needing effort
blocks.trans: 懈怠的，懶散的，無精打采的
examples:
He's seemed listless and a little depressed ever since he got his exam results.
自從得知自己的考試分數後他就一直無精打采，心情也有些低落。

blocks.def: hate and strong disapproval
someone who spends a lot of money in a way that wastes it
A grandiloquent style or way of using language is complicated in order to attract admiration and attention, especially in order to make someone or something seem important.
blocks.trans: （尤指為了使某人或者某物顯得重要而）賣弄詞藻的，言辭浮誇的，過分華麗的
examples:
Her speech was full of grandiloquent language, but it contained no new ideas.
她的演講雖然充滿了華麗的詞藻，但卻沒有甚麼新意。

blocks.def: a strong, often sudden, feeling that something is extremely unpleasant
examples:
I turned away in revulsion when they showed a close-up of the operation.
當他們播放動手術的特寫鏡頭時，我感到噁心馬上轉過身去。
 She looked at him with revulsion.
她厭惡地看著他。
 He expressed his revulsion at/against/towards the whale hunting.
他表達了對捕鯨行為的憎惡。

blocks.def: a person who has very strong opinions about something, and tries to make other people have them too
examples:
a religious zealot
宗教狂熱分子

blocks.def: (the period of) the development of a child or young animal while it is still inside its mother's body
examples:
The baby was born prematurely at 28 weeks gestation.
胎兒在懷孕的第28周早產。
 The period of gestation of rats is 21 days.
老鼠的妊娠期是21天。

blocks.def: (the period of) the development of ideas, thoughts, or plans
blocks.trans: （想法、思想或計劃的）醞釀（期），孕育（期）
examples:
The project had a very long gestation period.
這個方案經過了很長時間的醞釀。

blocks.def: unconscious
examples:
We found her lying on the floor, drunk and insensible.
我們發現她躺在地板上，爛醉如泥，毫無知覺。

blocks.def: to not care about something or be unwilling to react to it
examples:
I think he's largely insensible to other people's distress.
我覺得他對別人的苦惱大多無動於衷。

blocks.def: an uncomfortable feeling in the stomach caused by feelings of nervousness or slight fear
blocks.trans: （由於緊張或略有不安而引起的）肚子痛
examples:
I've got the collywobbles about my exam this afternoon.
我擔心今天下午的考試，肚子都不舒服了。

blocks.def: a small fat bird, shot for sport and food
an angry complaint
to complain angrily
examples:
She's always grousing about how she's been treated by the management.
她老是抱怨管理層待她如何不公。

blocks.def: showing no kindness and no wish to hide the unpleasant truth
blocks.trans: 無情的；不避諱的，不隱藏的
examples:
The documentary went through all the graphic details of the operation in unsparing detail.
該紀錄片記錄下了手術過程中所有翔實的細節，未經刪節。

blocks.def: extremely generous with money, time, help, etc.
examples:
Last of all, our thanks go to the caterers who have been unsparing in their efforts to make this afternoon such a success.
最後，我們要感謝各位酒宴承辦人員，他們不辭辛勞的服務使今天下午的活動大獲成功。

blocks.def: strongly disliking or opposed to
blocks.trans: 反對的；嫌惡的；不願意的
examples:
Few people are averse to the idea of a free holiday.
幾乎沒有人會反對免費假期這個主意。
 I'm not averse to (= I like) the occasional glass of champagne myself.
我樂得偶爾自己來一杯香檳。

blocks.def: honest or lasting support, or loyalty, especially to a sexual partner
blocks.trans: （尤指對性伴侶的）忠誠，忠實，忠貞
examples:
Somerset Maugham's comedy of marital fidelity, "The Constant Wife"
薩默塞特‧毛姆關於婚姻忠貞的喜劇《堅貞太太》
 How important do you think sexual fidelity is in a marriage?
你認為婚姻中肉體上的忠誠有多重要？

blocks.def: the degree to which the detail and quality of an original, such as a picture, sound, or story, is copied exactly
examples:
The best ink-jet printers can reproduce photographs with amazing fidelity.
最好的噴墨印表機輸出的照片效果會非常逼真。

blocks.def: a flag on a ship that shows which country the ship belongs to
blocks.trans: （船隻上懸掛表明國籍的）艦旗，商船旗

blocks.def: not intentional
examples:
All authors need to be wary of inadvertent copying of other people's ideas.
所有作者都需注意不要在無意中抄襲了他人的觀點。

blocks.def: not intentionally
examples:
He inadvertently deleted the file.
他不小心把檔案刪除了。

blocks.def: a statement, made without giving proof, that someone has done something wrong or illegal
examples:
Several of her patients have made allegations of professional misconduct about/against her.
她治療的幾位病人指責她失職。
 [ + that ] Allegations that Mr Dwight was receiving money from known criminals have caused a scandal.
有指控稱德懷特先生收取已知犯罪分子錢財，這已成為一樁醜聞。

blocks.def: a person who has captured a person or animal and refuses to release them
an almost solid piece of something
examples:
He had a blood clot removed from his brain.
他顱內的一個血塊被取了出來。

blocks.def: a stupid person
examples:
Look what you've done, you clot!
看看你做了甚麼，笨蛋！

blocks.def: to form clots
examples:
He was rushed into hospital because his blood wasn't clotting properly.
他被匆忙送進醫院，因為他的血液不能正常凝結。
 an anti-clotting agent
抗凝血劑

blocks.def: to cause trouble to develop
examples:
The song was banned on the grounds that it might foment racial tension.
這首歌因可能挑起種族衝突被禁播了。

blocks.def: something that is said or done in order to be funny
examples:
His proposal was no jest - he was completely sincere.
他的建議不是開玩笑，他絕對是認真的。

blocks.def: intended as a joke and not said seriously
examples:
I only said it in jest - you're obviously not fat.
我那麼說是開玩笑——顯然你並不胖。

blocks.def: to say something intended to be funny
examples:
Would I jest about something so important?
我會拿這麼重要的事開玩笑嗎？

blocks.def: to remove something or set something free with difficulty
examples:
It took hours to extricate the car from the sand.
用了幾個小時才把陷入沙地中的車拉出來。
 I tried to extricate myself from the situation.
我試圖從這種局面中擺脫出來。

blocks.def: someone whose job is examining people's eyes and selling glasses or contact lenses to correct sight problems
a person whose job is fitting and selling glasses and contact lenses to correct sight problems, but who does not examine people's eyes
someone who does not know, or believes that it is impossible to know, if a god exists
blocks.trans: 不可知論者（對神存在與否不能肯定或認為不可知）
examples:
Although he was raised a Catholic, he was an agnostic for most of his adult life.
他雖然從小接受的是天主教教育，但成年後基本上是個不可知論者。

blocks.def: having the beliefs of an agnostic
relating to hardware or software that can be used with many different types of platform (= system)
blocks.trans: （硬體和軟體）跨平臺的，適用不同平臺的

blocks.def: the activity of lending someone money with the agreement that they will pay back a very much larger amount of money later
a formal statement of the rights of a country's people, or of an organization or a particular social group, that is agreed by or demanded from a ruler or government
blocks.trans: 憲章，章程（由統治者或政府批准或要求制定，闡明公民、組織或社會團體的權利）
examples:
a charter of rights
人權憲章
 Education is one of the basic human rights written into the United Nations Charter.
受教育權是寫入《聯合國憲章》的基本人權之一。
 The government has produced a Citizen's/Parents'/Patients' Charter.
政府制定了一套公民／家長／病人權利章程。

blocks.def: the renting of a vehicle
examples:
boats for charter
供租賃的船隻
 a charter flight
包機航班
 a major charter operator
大包租營運商

blocks.def: to rent a vehicle, especially an aircraft, for a special use and not as part of a regular service
blocks.trans: 包租（交通工具，尤指飛機）
examples:
They've chartered a plane to take delegates to the conference.
他們包了一架飛機送代表參加會議。

blocks.def: to officially start a new organization by giving it a charter
examples:
Cambridge University Press was chartered in 1534.
劍橋大學出版社是於1534年特許成立的。

blocks.def: to (cause something to) lose value, especially over time
blocks.trans: （尤指隨時間的推移）（使）貶值，（使）跌價
examples:
Our car depreciated (by) $1,500 in the first year we owned it.
我們買的車在第一年就貶值了1500美元。
 In the last year our house has depreciated in value.
我們的房子在過去一年間貶值了。

blocks.def: the state of being very poor
examples:
There is a reason you see someone riding a second-rate bike, and it's not indigence.
看見有些人騎二流車，並不是因為貧窮，而是另有原因。
 He claimed indigence and is being .
他曾報稱自己是特困戶，現在也是。

blocks.def: A diaphanous substance, especially cloth, is so delicate and thin that you can see through it.
blocks.trans: （尤指布料）又透又薄的，薄如蟬翼的
examples:
a diaphanous silk veil
透明絲綢面紗

blocks.def: a person with a high level of knowledge or skill, especially someone who is less able in other ways
blocks.trans: （尤指在其他方面缺乏能力的）博學之士，學者，專家
examples:
There are musical savants who are very awkward physically - until they sit at the piano.
有些音樂專家平時舉止顯得不自然，但一旦坐在鋼琴面前就大不一樣。

blocks.def: to put someone or something into a lower or less important rank or position
blocks.trans: 貶職；使降級；降低…的地位
examples:
She resigned when she was relegated to a desk job.
因被降職做文書，她就辭了職。
 The story was relegated to the middle pages of the paper.
這篇報道從重要版面撤下，刊登在中間的版面上。

blocks.def: If a football team is relegated, it is moved down to a lower division.
examples:
If Southampton lose again they may be relegated from the Premier League to the First Division.
如果南安普敦隊再輸掉比賽的話，就要從英超降級到英甲了。

blocks.def: (of places) extremely dirty and unpleasant, often because of lack of money
blocks.trans: （地方常因缺錢）極其骯髒的，汙穢的
examples:
Many prisons, even today, are overcrowded and squalid places.
時至今日，許多監獄仍舊擁擠不堪，骯髒至極。

blocks.def: (of situations and activities) not moral; involving sex and drugs, etc. in an unpleasant way
blocks.trans: （情形、活動）道德敗壞的，墮落的，醜惡的，淫穢的
examples:
It's the usual squalid rock star tale of drugs, sex, and overdoses.
那是常見的搖滾歌星墮落的故事——吸毒、縱欲、過量服用麻醉劑。

blocks.def: an illness of the body tissues that is caused by not having enough vitamin C
blocks.trans: （由於缺乏維生素C引起的）壞血病

blocks.def: to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable, especially more than is good for you
examples:
The soccer fans indulged their patriotism, waving flags and singing songs.
足球迷搖著旗唱著歌，縱情抒發他們的愛國熱情。
 I love champagne but I don't often indulge myself.
我愛喝香檳，但一般都有節制。
 We took a deliberate decision to indulge in a little nostalgia.
我們特意決定好好追憶一下往事。

blocks.def: to give someone anything they want and not to mind if they behave badly
examples:
My aunt indulges the children dreadfully.
我嬸嬸太縱容孩子了。

blocks.def: an uncomfortable feeling when you doubt if you are doing the right thing
examples:
She had no qualms about lying to the police.
她向警方說謊但一點也不覺得不安。

blocks.def: the act or process of ending an official organization or legal agreement
blocks.trans: （官方組織的）解散；（法律合約的）解除
examples:
the dissolution of parliament
議會的解散
 the dissolution of their marriage
他們婚姻關係的解除

blocks.def: (of a tune) having a rhythm in which strong notes are not on the beat
examples:
syncopated jazz rhythms
爵士樂切分節奏

blocks.def: to shake slightly, often because of strong emotion
examples:
Lennie's bottom lip quivered and tears started in his eyes.
雷尼的下唇顫抖著，眼裡湧出了淚光。

blocks.def: a long, thin container for carrying arrows
a slight shake, often because of strong emotion
examples:
The opening bars of the music sent a quiver of excitement through the crowd.
音樂起始的幾小節讓人群頓時興奮激動起來。

blocks.def: willingness to give money, or money given to poor people by rich people
blocks.trans: 慷慨捐助，施捨；（給窮人的）善款
examples:
The medical foundation will be the main beneficiary of the millionaire's largesse.
這個醫藥基金會將是那位百萬富翁慷慨捐助的主要受益者。

blocks.def: A grudging action or feeling is one that you do or have unwillingly.
examples:
She won the grudging respect of her boss.
她的老闆也不由得敬重她。

blocks.def: to officially make someone a priest or other religious leader, in a religious ceremony
examples:
He was ordained (as) a priest in Ely cathedral in 1987.
他於1987年在伊利大教堂被授予聖職。

blocks.def: (of God or someone in authority) to order something to happen
examples:
There is strong support here for the tough economic reforms ordained in the federal capital, Prague.
這裡的人們堅決支持由聯邦首都布拉格下令進行的強力經濟改革。
 [ + that ] humorous I don't know who came up with the idea, but the city council has ordained that all the local libraries will close on Mondays.
我不知道這是誰的主意，但是市政會命令本地所有的圖書館每逢星期一閉館。

blocks.def: generally thought to be or to exist, even if this may not really be true
blocks.trans: 假定存在的，被認為存在的
examples:
The putative leader of the terrorist cell was arrested yesterday.
被認定為該恐怖組織頭目的人昨天被警方逮捕了。

blocks.def: belonging or relating to the cat family
examples:
feline leukaemia
貓白血病

blocks.def: appearing or behaving like a cat
examples:
She had pretty, almost feline features.
她長得俊俏標緻，像小貓一樣嬌媚可愛。

blocks.def: a member of the cat family
examples:
a wildlife park with tigers and various other felines
有老虎和其他各種貓科動物的野生動物園

blocks.def: a share or a financial involvement in something such as a business
examples:
He holds (= owns) a 40 percent stake in/of the company.
他擁有公司40%的股份。

blocks.def: If you have a stake in something, it is important to you because you have a personal interest or involvement in it.
blocks.trans: 對…有強烈的興趣；與…有利害關係
examples:
Employers have a stake in the training of their staff.
僱主很重視員工訓練。

blocks.def: the amount of money that you risk on the result of something such as a game or competition
examples:
She spent two weeks in Las Vegas playing high-stakes blackjack at the casinos.
她在拉斯維加斯的賭場裡玩了兩個星期高賭注的二十一點。

blocks.def: In an activity or competition, the stakes are the reward for the person who wins or succeeds in it.
blocks.trans: （活動或比賽的）獎金，獎品，回報
examples:
The team is playing for enormous stakes - the chance to play in the final.
這支球隊正在為無上的回報，即進入決賽，而拼命一搏。

blocks.def: used in the names of horse races in which the prize money is provided by all the owners of the horses that are competing in the race
blocks.trans: （獎金由全部參賽馬主提供的）賽馬

blocks.def: a situation where someone is judged on how much of a particular quality they have
examples:
The prime minister is not very high in the popularity stakes (= he is not very popular) at the moment.
首相當前的人氣並不是很旺。

blocks.def: to increase the prize or reward in a competition or any activity in which you are competing
to make a situation more urgent or more difficult to ignore
blocks.trans: 使情況更緊急；使事態擴大
examples:
The stowaways are trying to raise the stakes by refusing to eat until they are given money and aid.
偷渡者正試圖透過絕食來使事態擴大，直到他們得到錢和援助為止。

blocks.def: a strong stick or metal bar with a pointed end
examples:
The stakes are pushed or hammered into the ground and can be used for supporting a plant or forming part of a fence.
將木樁插入地下，可以用來支撐植物或構成圍欄。

blocks.def: in the past, a wooden post to which people were tied before being burned to death as a punishment
examples:
In medieval Europe, many women were accused of being witches and were burned at the stake.
在中世紀的歐洲，許多女人被指控爲女巫而被燒死在火刑柱上。

blocks.def: to risk an amount of money
examples:
At the roulette table, he staked $10,000 on number 21.
他在輪盤賭臺上押了一萬美元賭21號。

blocks.def: to hold up and support something by fastening it to stakes
examples:
Tomato plants should be staked.
番茄植株得用架子架起來。

blocks.def: very ordinary, or having no interesting or exciting features or qualities
blocks.trans: 平常的；平庸的；平淡無奇的
examples:
Their offices are in a nondescript building on the edge of town.
他們的辦公室在城郊一座不起眼的建築內。

blocks.def: friendly and making you feel happy and welcome
examples:
a convivial atmosphere/host
歡樂的氣氛／熱情的主人

blocks.def: good at noticing and understanding things
blocks.trans: 目光敏銳的；洞察力強的

blocks.def: very bad or evil, or morally wrong
examples:
He was guilty of numerous disreputable and flagitious acts.
他犯下了許多臭名昭著、窮凶極惡的罪行。

blocks.def: the quality of being shy and not confident of your abilities
examples:
The biggest difficulty is overcoming natural British diffidence
最大的困難是克服英國人天生的不自信心態。
 There was a diffidence in her soft voice.
她輕柔的聲音裏透著一絲羞怯。

blocks.def: not able or willing to take decisions or actions
blocks.trans: 猶豫不決的，優柔寡斷的
examples:
an irresolute reply
猶豫不決的回答

blocks.def: intended to avoid causing offence or disagreement, especially by not expressing strong feelings or opinions
blocks.trans: （尤指透過不表達強烈的感情或意見而）不得罪人的，一團和氣的；溫和的
examples:
This is daytime television at its most anodyne.
這就是不痛不癢到了極點的日間電視節目。
 Somehow this avoids being just another silly pop song with anodyne lyrics about love and happiness.
這首歌總算沒有淪為又一首愚蠢無聊的甚麼愛啊、幸福啊之類的流行歌曲。

blocks.def: to fail to do something, such as pay a debt, that you legally have to do
examples:
People who default on their mortgage repayments may have their home repossessed.
未能按期償還抵押貸款者，其房屋可能會被沒收。

blocks.def: the thing that exists or happens if you do not change it intentionally by performing an action
blocks.trans: 默認結果，既定結果；預設值；缺省值
examples:
Unless something else is agreed, the default is to meet at the hotel at 7.00 p.m. 
如果沒有變化，按約定下午七點在飯店見面。
 The computer will take 0 as the default value, unless you type in something different.
如果不輸入其他數值，電腦就把0當作預設值。
formal In default of (= because there is not) any better alternative, we will have to proceed with the original plan.
由於沒有更好的方案，我們只好按原定計劃行事。

blocks.def: a failure to do something, such as pay a debt, that you legally have to do
examples:
Defaults on loan repayments have reached 52,000 a month.
拖欠貸款的現象每月已達52 000宗。
 Any default on your mortgage payments may mean you will lose your house.
不按時償還抵押貸款就意味著可能會失去房子。
 Since they refuse to reply, I think we've won the argument by default (= because of their failure to act).
由於他們拒絕回答，我認為我們在這場辯論中自動勝出。
 The national student loan default rate (= the number of people failing to pay) is estimated at one in ten.
據估計，約有十分之一的人拖欠償還國家助學貸款。

blocks.def: a wide range or collection of different things
examples:
There is a whole panoply of remedies and drugs available to the modern doctor.
當今有各式各樣的治療方法和藥物可供醫生選擇。

blocks.def: to supply a building or a device with water pipes, or to connect a building or a device to a water pipe
examples:
We've discovered that our house isn't plumbed properly.
我們發現我們房子裡的水管安裝得有問題。
 I think we can plumb the new bath into the existing pipes.
我想我們可以把新浴缸接到現有的水管上。
 Have you plumbed the dishwasher in yet?
你給洗碗機接上水管了嗎？

blocks.def: to measure how deep something is, especially water
to understand or discover all about something
examples:
Now that she had begun, she wanted to plumb her own childhood further.
既然已經開始了，她就想深入發掘一番自己童年的故事。

blocks.def: exactly
examples:
The hotel is plumb in the middle of the town.
那家旅館就在城鎮中心。
 He hit me plumb on the nose.
他正好打在我的鼻子上。

blocks.def: completely
examples:
I plumb forgot your birthday.
我把你的生日忘得一乾二淨。

blocks.def: exactly straight, usually describing a vertical surface or line
examples:
When you hang a door, you need to make sure that it is both level and plumb.
裝門的時候，必須保證門是橫平豎直的。

blocks.def: not straight vertically
examples:
The external wall is out of plumb by half a metre.
外牆偏斜了0.5公尺。

blocks.def: If a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans and arranges its feathers using its beak.
to spend time making yourself look attractive
examples:
Roald always spends ages preening (himself) before he goes out.
羅阿爾德出門前總是花很長時間精心打扮。

blocks.def: to feel very proud or satisfied with yourself because of an action or quality
blocks.trans: （因為某一行動或特質）非常自豪(或滿意)
examples:
The government is publicly preening itself on the latest trade figures.
政府因為最近的貿易數字而在大眾面前洋洋得意。
 The company preened itself for having taken on so many new employees last year.
該公司為去年招收了那麼多新員工而感到頗為滿意。

blocks.def: to walk slowly and with difficulty because of having an injured or painful leg or foot
examples:
Three minutes into the game, Jackson limped off the pitch with a serious ankle injury.
比賽剛剛開始三分鐘，傑克遜就因腳踝嚴重受傷而下場。

blocks.def: to move or develop slowly and with difficulty
examples:
The little boat limped slowly towards the shore.
那艘小船緩慢地向岸邊靠近。
 After limping along for almost two years, the economy is starting to show signs of recovery.
經過差不多兩年的徘徊，經濟開始出現了復甦的跡象。

blocks.def: soft and neither firm nor stiff
examples:
a limp lettuce leaf/salad
軟塌塌的萵苣葉／沙拉
 a limp handshake
軟弱無力的握手

blocks.def: a way of walking slowly and with difficulty because of having an injured or painful leg or foot
blocks.trans: （因為腿腳受傷或疼痛）艱難緩慢的行走
examples:
She has a slight limp.
她有點瘸。
 He walks with a limp.
他走路一瘸一拐的。

blocks.def: extremely small
examples:
The amounts of radioactivity present were infinitesimal.
存在的放射量極小。

blocks.def: increasing again, or becoming popular again
blocks.trans: 復興的；再次增長的；再度流行的
examples:
resurgent inflation
再度爆發的通貨膨脹
 Many people were critical of the resurgent militarism in the country.
很多人對該國軍國主義再度興風作浪持批判態度。

blocks.def: annoying
examples:
The vibration can become irksome after a while.
震動持續一會兒後會變得令人厭煩。

blocks.def: a document signed by a large number of people demanding or asking for some action from the government or another authority
examples:
I signed a petition against the proposed closure of the local hospital today.
今天我在反對關閉當地醫院的請願書上簽了名。

blocks.def: a formal letter to a law court asking for a particular legal action
examples:
She's filing a petition for divorce.
她將要遞交離婚訴狀。

blocks.def: to make a formal request for something, especially in a law court
examples:
They're petitioning for/about better facilities for disabled people.
他們正在請願，希望當局能為殘障人士安裝更好的設施。
 [ + obj + to infinitive  ] I think we should petition the government to increase the grant for the project.
我認為我們應該請求政府增加對該專案計劃的撥款。
 She is petitioning for a re-trial.
她將上訴要求重審。

blocks.def: very strong, especially in character; producing respect and a little fear in others
blocks.trans: （尤指性格方面）強的；可敬的；令人敬畏的
examples:
Tonight he faces the most redoubtable opponent of his boxing career.
今晚他面對的是他拳擊生涯中最強大的對手。

blocks.def: (of a container) so tightly closed that no air can leave or enter
examples:
a hermetic seal
密封墊

blocks.def: If a particular group is hermetic, the people who live within it don't often communicate with those who live outside it.
blocks.trans: （人群）與世隔絕的，不與外界往來的
examples:
He entered the hermetic world of the monastery at a young age.
他很年輕時就進了與世隔絕的修道院。

blocks.def: connected with cows
examples:
a bovine virus
牛（痘）病毒

blocks.def: slow or stupid in a way that a cow is thought to be
examples:
He had a gentle, slightly bovine expression.
他表情溫和，略顯木訥。

blocks.def: Someone, especially a young person, who is callow behaves in a way that shows they have little experience, confidence, or judgment.
blocks.trans: （尤指年輕人）幼稚的；不自信的；不諳世事的
examples:
Mark was just a callow youth of 16 when he arrived in Paris.
馬克到巴黎的時候還是個不諳世事的16歲少年。

blocks.def: behaviour in which you refuse to obey someone or something
examples:
The demonstration is a pointless act/gesture of defiance against the government.
透過示威來對抗政府是一種毫無意義的行為／姿態。
 In defiance of the ceasefire, rebel troops are again firing on the capital.
叛軍違反停火協定再次向首都開火。

blocks.def: to spend time thinking very carefully about a subject
blocks.trans: 仔細考慮；深思熟慮；沉思

blocks.def: someone who does not live in their own country
examples:
A large community of expatriates has settled there.
已經有一大批僑民在那邊定居了。

blocks.def: to use force or law to remove someone from their own country
blocks.trans: （強行或依法）把…逐出本國，使移居國外
examples:
The new leaders expatriated the ruling family.
新的領導人把統治家族驅逐出境。

blocks.def: to chew (= crush with the teeth) food
complicated and difficult to understand
examples:
rules of byzantine complexity
複雜難懂的規則

blocks.def: a fight or argument
examples:
Some couples seem to like confrontation, but Josh and I hardly ever argue.
有的夫妻似乎很喜歡爭吵，我跟喬許卻幾乎沒有吵過嘴。
 There were violent confrontations between police and demonstrators.
警察和示威人士之間發生了激烈的衝突。

blocks.def: to say that something is true or is a fact, although you cannot prove it and other people might not believe it
examples:
[ + (that) ] The company claims (that) it is not responsible for the pollution in the river.
公司聲稱對該河流污染沒有責任。
 [ + to infinitive ] He claims to have met the president, but I don't believe him.
他聲稱見過總統，可是我不信。
 All parties have claimed success in yesterday's elections.
所有黨派都聲稱在昨天的選舉中取得了勝利。
 An unknown terrorist group has claimed responsibility for this morning's bomb attack.
一個不知名的恐怖組織聲稱對今天上午的炸彈襲擊事件負責。

blocks.def: If an organization or group claims a particular number of members, that number of people are believed to belong to it.
to ask for something of value because you think it belongs to you or because you think you have a right to it
examples:
The police said that if no one claims the watch, you can keep it.
警方說如果沒人認領這隻錶，你可以留著它。
 When King Richard III died, Henry VII claimed the English throne.
理查三世去世後，亨利七世繼承了英格蘭王位。

blocks.def: to make a written demand for money from a government or organization because you think you have a right to it
blocks.trans: （向政府或組織）索取（錢）；索（款）；索賠
examples:
The number of people claiming unemployment benefits has risen sharply this month.
這個月要求領取失業救濟金的人數激增。
 Don't forget to claim (for) your travelling expenses after the interview.
面試後別忘了報銷你的旅費。
UK When my bike was stolen, I claimed on the insurance and got £150 back.
我的腳踏車被偷後，我按保險索賠，拿回了150英鎊。
UK If the shop won't give me a replacement TV, I'll claim my money back.
如果商店不給我換一台電視，我就要求退款。

blocks.def: to make an official request for money after an accident, from the person who caused your injuries
a statement that something is true or is a fact, although other people might not believe it
examples:
He said the police assaulted him while he was in custody, a claim that the police deny.
他說員警在他被拘留期間毆打了他，但警方否認了這種說法。
 [ + that ] The government's claim that it would reduce taxes proved false.
政府要減稅的說法被證實是假的。
 Can you give any evidence to support your claim?
你能提供證據支持你的說法嗎？
 He made wild claims about being able to cure cancer.
他誇下海口說自己能治癒癌症。

blocks.def: a written request asking an organization to pay you an amount of money that you believe they owe you
examples:
After her house was burgled, she made a claim on her insurance.
她家被盜後，她要求按保單索賠。
 Please submit your claim for travelling expenses to the accounts department.
請將出差旅費的報銷單交到會計部辦理。

blocks.def: a right to have something or get something from someone
examples:
She has no rightful claim to the title.
她並沒有獲得這一頭銜的正當權利。
 Our neighbours have no claim to (= cannot say that they own) that strip of land between our houses.
我們的鄰居無權擁有我們兩間房屋之間的那塊狹長空地。
 My ex-wife has no claims on me (= has no right to any of my money).
我前妻沒有權利向我索取錢財。

blocks.def: the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body and protects the spinal cord
examples:
She injured her spine in a riding accident.
她在一次墜馬事故中脊椎受傷。
figurative The Apennine mountains form the spine (= central row of mountains) of Italy.
亞平寧山脈是義大利的中心山脈。

blocks.def: a long, sharp point like a needle growing out of an animal such as a hedgehog or a plant such as a cactus
blocks.trans: （刺蝟等動物的）刺毛；（仙人掌等植物的）刺

blocks.def: the narrow strip where the cover of a book is joined to the pages, usually with the title and writer's name printed on it
involving a lot of excited movement or activity
examples:
After weeks of frenetic activity, the job was finally finished.
經過幾個星期的瘋狂忙活，工作終於完成了。
 There was frenetic trading on the Stock Exchange yesterday.
昨天股票交易所交易非常熱絡。

blocks.def: criticizing people or ideas in a humorous way, especially in order to make a political point
examples:
satirical cartoons/magazines
諷刺漫畫/雜誌
 She was known for her satirical humour.
她的諷刺幽默很有名。
 a satiric puppet show that mocked the government
嘲諷政府的諷刺木偶戲

blocks.def: living and behaving in ways that mean you get as much pleasure out of life as possible, according to the belief that the most important thing in life is to enjoy yourself
something or someone that is extremely large and powerful
examples:
The US is seen as an economic leviathan.
美國被視爲經濟巨人。

blocks.def: showing or relating to knowledge of a future event, especially when this comes from a direct message to the mind, such as in a dream, rather than by reason
examples:
She claims she has precognitive abilities and can foresee events.
她聲稱自己有預知能力，可以預見要發生的事情。
 He seemed to have, through his perceptive and precognitive powers, received the story out of thin air.
他似乎通過他的洞察力和預知能力憑空了解到了這個故事。

blocks.def: to persuade someone to do something
examples:
They induced her to take the job by promising editorial freedom.
他們向她保證有編輯自由，以勸服她接受這項工作。
 Nothing could induce me (= I definitely cannot be persuaded) to climb a mountain/ride a bike.
沒有甚麼能誘使我去爬山／騎腳踏車的。

blocks.def: to cause something to happen
examples:
Pills for seasickness often induce drowsiness.
暈船藥經常會令人昏昏欲睡。

blocks.def: to use a drug to make a pregnant woman start giving birth
examples:
In this hospital, twins are often induced.
在這家醫院生育雙胞胎常常要催生的。

blocks.def: very tired, especially after working hard for a long time
blocks.trans: （尤指長時間辛苦工作後）筋疲力盡的，極為疲倦的
examples:
I think he's a little weary after his long journey.
我想他在長途旅行後有些疲倦了。
 Here, sit down and rest your weary legs.
來，坐下歇歇腳。

blocks.def: bored with something because you have experienced too much of it
examples:
I've been going out with the same people to the same places for years and I've just grown weary of it.
多年來一直和同一批人去同一些地方，我已經開始感到厭倦了。

blocks.def: to make someone feel tired
examples:
Children weary me with their constant questions and demands.
孩子們整天不停地問這要那，真把我累壞了。

blocks.def: to start to feel that something or someone is boring
examples:
Some people never seem to weary of eating the same type of food every day.
有些人似乎每天吃同樣的食物也不會厭煩。

strain.pos: noun [ C usually singular or U ]

blocks.def: a force or influence that stretches, pulls, or puts pressure on something, sometimes causing damage
examples:
The hurricane put such a strain on the bridge that it collapsed.
在颶風強大的威力之下，橋塌了。
 As you get older, excess weight puts a lot of strain on the heart.
隨著年齡的增長，體重過重會給心臟造成很大負擔。
 Their constant arguments were putting a strain on their marriage.
他們持續不斷的爭吵使他們的婚姻關係非常緊張。
 The recent decline in the dollar has put a bigger strain on the economic system.
最近美元的貶值為經濟體系帶來更大壓力。
 Migration into the cities is putting a strain on already stretched resources.
城市新移民為原本就已吃緊的資源造成更大壓力。

blocks.def: an injury to a muscle or similar soft part of the body caused by using that part too much
blocks.trans: （肌肉等軟組織的）損傷，拉傷，扭傷
examples:
a groin/hamstring strain
腹股溝／膕腱拉傷

blocks.def: something that makes you feel nervous and worried
examples:
She's a lot better than she was but she's still not ready to face the stresses and strains of a job.
她比以前好多了，但仍然沒有準備好面對工作的緊張和壓力。
 He's been under a lot of strain recently.
他最近壓力很大。

blocks.def: a particular type or quality
blocks.trans: 類型；品質；個性特點，稟性
examples:
A strain of puritanism runs through all her work.
她所有作品都帶有一種清教主義色彩。

blocks.def: an animal or plant from a particular group whose characteristics are different in some way from others of the same group
examples:
Scientists have discovered a new strain of the virus which is much more dangerous.
科學家已經發現了一種危險得多的新病毒。

blocks.def: the sound of music being played or performed
examples:
I could hear the strains of Mozart in the background.
我聽見背景音樂中有莫札特的旋律。

blocks.def: to separate liquid food from solid food, especially by pouring it through a utensil with small holes in it
examples:
Could you strain the vegetables, please.
你能把蔬菜篩一篩嗎？
 The oil in which the fish is fried is strained off and used to cook potatoes.
煎魚的油在過濾之後用來炸土豆了。

blocks.def: to become stretched or to experience pressure, or to make something do or experience this
blocks.trans: （使）緊張，（使）承受壓力；拉緊，繃緊；損傷
examples:
I've put on such a lot of weight recently - this dress is straining at the seams.
我最近胖了很多——這條裙子穿上後緊繃繃的。
 I strained a muscle in my back playing squash.
我打壁球拉傷了背肌。
 Don't watch TV in the dark - you'll strain your eyes!
不要在黑暗中看電視——會傷害你的眼睛！
 [ + to infinitive ] figurative I really had to strain (= try very hard) to reach those top notes.
我確實得拼盡全力才能唱出那些最高的音。
figurative I was straining (my ears) (= listening hard) to hear what they were saying.
我豎起耳朵，拼命想聽清他們在說甚麼。

blocks.def: to cause too much of something to be used, especially money
examples:
Increases in wholesale oil prices have strained the company's finances.
油料批發價的上漲讓公司財務支出過多。

blocks.def: to do something unexpected that surprises and sometimes worries a person or animal
blocks.trans: 使大吃一驚；使受驚，使嚇一跳
examples:
She was concentrating on her book and his voice startled her.
她正在聚精會神地看書，被他的聲音嚇了一跳。
 The noise of the car startled the birds and the whole flock flew up into the air.
汽車聲把一大群鳥驚嚇得振翅飛了起來。
 Her article on diet startled many people into changing their eating habits.
她那篇有關飲食的文章使很多人惶惶不安，開始改變飲食習慣。

blocks.def: relating to an illness, caused by too much bile, that can cause vomiting
blocks.trans: 患膽病的；膽汁分泌過多的
examples:
She suffered from bilious attacks.
她膽病發作了。

blocks.def: If someone is bilious, they are always in a bad mood.
examples:
a bilious old man
脾氣乖戾的老人

blocks.def: extremely unpleasant
blocks.trans: 令人十分不快的；使人厭惡的
examples:
His shirt was a bilious shade of green.
他的襯衫是那種令人反感的綠色。

blocks.def: a large group of people, especially women or girls, or a large group of similar things
examples:
Victorian postcards often featured bevies of bathing beauties.
維多尼亞女王時代的明信片圖案經常是一群游泳的美人。

blocks.def: a large group of a particular type of bird
examples:
a bevy of quail/larks
一群鵪鶉／雲雀

blocks.def: a short saying or poem that expresses an idea in a clever, funny way
examples:
One of Oscar Wilde's most frequently quoted epigrams is "I can resist everything except temptation".
奧斯卡•王爾德最常被引用的雋語之一就是「我可以抗拒一切，誘惑除外」。

blocks.def: the opposite
blocks.trans: 相反；反面；對立面；相反事物
examples:
I was worried that it might be too hard for me but it turned out the contrary was true.
我原來擔心那可能對我來說太難了，可是我發現恰恰相反。

blocks.def: used to show that you think or feel the opposite of what has just been stated
examples:
"I thought you said the film was exciting?" "On the contrary, I nearly fell asleep half way through it!"
「你不覺得這齣電影很精彩嗎？」「正相反，看到一半我差點睡著！」

blocks.def: saying or showing the opposite
examples:
For a long time it was thought to be a harmless substance, but we now have proof/evidence to the contrary.
長期以來這種物質被認爲是無害的，但最近我們有了相反的證據。

blocks.def: opposite
blocks.trans: 相反的，對立的；完全不同的
examples:
a contrary point of view
相反的觀點
 Contrary to all our expectations, he found a well-paid job and a nice girlfriend.
出乎我們的意料，他找到了一份報酬不菲的工作和一個漂亮的女友。

blocks.def: in a different way from what most people believe
blocks.trans: 與大多數人的看法不同
examples:
Contrary to popular opinion, I don't dye my hair!
與大多數人的想法不同，我不染頭髮！

blocks.def: A contrary person wants to disagree with and annoy other people.
blocks.trans: 乖戾的；故意作對的；執拗的
examples:
He doesn't really mean it - he's just being contrary.
這不是他的本意——他只是在故意作對。

blocks.def: a short period when a person stays in a particular place
examples:
My sojourn in the youth hostel was thankfully short.
幸好我在青年旅館逗留的時間很短。

oligarchy.pos: noun [ C or U,  + sing/pl verb ]

blocks.def: (government by) a small group of powerful people
blocks.trans: 寡頭統治（的政府）；寡頭統治集團

blocks.def: to make continuous, small movements, especially if they do not have a particular purpose and you make them without meaning to, for example because you are nervous or bored
examples:
Children can't sit still for long without fidgeting.
孩子無法長時間一動不動地坐著。
 Stop fidgeting!
不要動來動去的！
 He cleared his throat and nervously fidgeted with a pencil.
他清了清嗓子，緊張地擺弄著鉛筆。
 He fidgets with a string of worry beads.
他擺弄著一串安神珠。

blocks.def: a person who finds it difficult to stay still, and who often makes continuous, small movements, especially without meaning to
blocks.trans: 坐不住的人，坐立不安的人
examples:
Tim's a terrible fidget.
蒂姆是個一刻都坐不住的人。

blocks.def: a state in which you keep making small movements, especially without meaning to, for example because you are nervous or bored
examples:
I got the fidgets halfway through the lecture.
演講聽到一半我就坐不住了。

blocks.def: to interrupt a public speech or performance with loud, unfriendly statements or questions
examples:
A few angry locals started heckling (the speaker).
一些憤怒的當地人開始（對演說者）起哄。

blocks.def: to remove words or parts from a book, play, or film that are considered to be unsuitable or offensive
blocks.trans: （對不適宜或具有冒犯性的內容進行）刪節，刪改
examples:
The version of the play that I saw had been horribly bowdlerized.
我所看到的這部戲的版本已被刪改得面目全非。

blocks.def: the long nose of some animals, or the long tube-like mouth of some insects
examples:
An elephant's trunk is a proboscis.
大象的鼻子很長。

blocks.def: funny or intended to make someone laugh
examples:
a jocular comment
詼諧的評論

blocks.def: used to describe someone who is happy and likes to make jokes
examples:
Michael was in a very jocular mood at the party.
麥可在聚會上非常詼諧、幽默。

blocks.def: to steal something that you have been trusted to take care of and use it for your own good
examples:
He is accused of misappropriating $30,000 to pay off gambling debts.
他被控挪用了三萬美元去償還賭債。

blocks.def: an area painted with lines for playing particular sports, especially football
examples:
a football/hockey/cricket pitch
足球／曲棍球／板球場
 Supporters invaded (= ran onto) the pitch.
球迷都跑進了球場。

blocks.def: the level or degree of something
examples:
The piano and organ were tuned to the same pitch (= note).
鋼琴和風琴被調校到同一音調上。
 If you teach children and adults in the same class, it's difficult to get the pitch (= level of difficulty or interest) right.
如果你把孩子和成人放在同一個班裡教，就很難完全找出適合學生的難度和他們的興趣。

blocks.def: the level of a feeling
examples:
By this time their disagreement had reached such a pitch that there was no hope of an amicable conclusion.
此時，他們的歧見已大得不可能善罷甘休。
 The children were at fever pitch (= very excited) the day before the party.
派對的前一天孩子都特別興奮。

blocks.def: a speech or act that attempts to persuade someone to buy or do something
examples:
The man in the shop gave me his (sales) pitch about quality and reliability.
商店裡的那個男人向我大談最高品質，信譽可靠之類的推銷行話。
 She made a pitch for the job but she didn't get it.
她竭力爭取這份工作，但沒有成功。
 [ + to infinitive ] The city made a pitch to stage the Olympics.
該市竭力爭取主辦奧運會。

blocks.def: a place in a public area where a person regularly sells goods or performs
examples:
The flower seller was at his usual pitch outside the station.
那個賣花人就在車站外他平時的攤位上。

blocks.def: the amount of slope, especially of a roof
examples:
This roof has a very steep/high/gentle/low pitch.
這個屋頂很陡／坡度很大／相當平緩／坡度很小。

blocks.def: a thick, black substance that was used in the past to make wooden ships and buildings waterproof
a throw in a baseball game
examples:
a good/bad pitch
好／差的投球

blocks.def: the piece of ground on which you can put up a tent, park a caravan, etc.
examples:
We chose a large level grassy pitch for our caravan.
我們選了一片大而平坦的草地停下我們的旅行拖車。

pitch.pos: verb [ I or T,  usually + adv/prep ]

blocks.def: to move or be moved suddenly, especially by throwing or being thrown
examples:
She pitched the stone into the river.
她把石頭扔到河裡。
 The ball pitched (= landed) short.
球投到了不遠處。
 The bike hit a rut and I was pitched (forward) onto the road.
腳踏車卡進地上的車轍凹痕，我重重地（向前）摔在路上。
 The ship pitched up and down/from side to side in the rough seas.
船在洶湧的海浪裡上下／左右顛簸。

blocks.def: in baseball, to throw a ball towards the player with the bat in order for them to try to hit it
examples:
Who will be pitching first for the White Sox this evening?
今晚誰是白襪隊的第一個投球手？

blocks.def: to put up a tent and make it ready to use
examples:
We pitched camp/our tent in the shade.
我們在陰涼處紮營／搭起帳篷。

blocks.def: to express or set something at a particular level
examples:
The tune was pitched (= the notes in it were) too high for me to reach the top notes.
調定得太高，高音處我唱不上去。
 A teacher's got to pitch a lesson at the right level for the students.
老師必須把課程的難易度定得與學生的水準相符。

blocks.def: to try to persuade someone to do something
examples:
She pitched her idea to me over a business lunch.
她在一次吃商業午餐時竭力遊說我接受她的想法。
 They are pitching for business at the moment.
他們正在招攬生意。

blocks.def: to slope
someone who tells funny or interesting stories
examples:
He was a brilliant raconteur.
他非常善於講故事。

blocks.def: the process of reducing a cost or total in regular small amounts
examples:
This number represents the company’s value before depreciation and amortization.
這個數值是該公司的市值，未計入折舊和攤銷。
 These are the bi-weekly dates for the loan amortization.
這些是兩周一次的分期還款日。

blocks.def: the oldest, most experienced, and often most respected person of all the people involved in a particular type of work
blocks.trans: （某一領域內的）老前輩，老專家

blocks.def:
US spelling of
moult UK
to express something with strong feeling, especially in a loud voice or with forceful language
blocks.trans: 朗誦；（尤指）大聲宣佈，慷慨激昂地聲稱
examples:
[ + speech ] "The end of the world is at hand!" the poster declaimed.
「世界末日就要來了！」那張傳單上寫著。
 She declaimed against the evils of capitalism.
她聲稱反對資本主義的種種罪惡。

blocks.def: to block something
examples:
Veins can get occluded by blood clots.
血管會被凝血塊阻塞。

blocks.def: a small group of people who spend their time together and do not welcome other people into that group
examples:
Our golf club is run by a very unfriendly clique (of people).
我們的高爾夫球俱樂部是由一小撮很不友好的傢夥管理的。
 There's a clique at work that never talks/who never talk to anyone else.
公司裡有個小圈子，他們從來不和其他人說話。

blocks.def: a saying or a part of a poem, play, or book put at the beginning of a piece of writing to give the reader some idea of what the piece is about
blocks.trans: （詩歌、戲劇或書的卷首或章節前的）引言，卷首語

blocks.def: (especially of words or ideas) not well connected or well ordered
blocks.trans: （尤指詞語或想法）不連貫的，沒有條理的，雜亂無章的
examples:
The script was disjointed and hard to follow.
這個劇本寫得沒有條理，很難讀下去。

blocks.def: the willingness to give a lot of time and energy to something because it is important
examples:
He has always shown great dedication to the cause.
他對這項事業一直都表現出強烈的奉獻精神。
 She thanked the staff for their dedication and enthusiasm.
她感謝全體員工的奉獻精神和工作熱情。

blocks.def: a statement that says in whose honour something has been written, made, performed, etc.
examples:
The dedication at the front of the book read "For my Father".
書前面的致謝辭中寫道：「獻給我的父親」。

blocks.def: a ceremony in which a building, especially a religious building, is opened for use and its purpose is stated
blocks.trans: （尤指宗教建築的）落成典禮，啟用儀式

blocks.def: a person with good knowledge or understanding of a subject
an official decision that is made after a group or organization has voted
examples:
to approve/adopt a resolution
批准／通過決議
 [ + to infinitive ] The United Nations passed (= voted to support) a resolution to increase aid to developing nations.
聯合國通過了一項向發展中國家增加援助的決議。

blocks.def: a promise to yourself to do or to not do something
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] I made a resolution to give up chocolate.
我下決心不再吃巧克力了。

blocks.def: determination
examples:
He showed great resolution in facing the robbers.
面對強盜，他表現得英勇無畏。

blocks.def: the act of solving or ending a problem or difficulty
examples:
a successful resolution to the crisis
危機的成功解決

blocks.def: the ability of a microscope, or a television or computer screen, to show things clearly and with a lot of detail
blocks.trans: （顯微鏡、電視、電腦螢幕等的）清晰度，解析度
examples:
a high/low resolution image
高／低清晰度圖像

blocks.def: the act of separating or being separated into clearly different parts
examples:
the resolution of oil into bitumen and tar
石油分解成瀝青和焦油

blocks.def: a mixture of dried petals and leaves from various flowers and plants that is used to give a room a pleasant smell
blocks.trans: 百花香（用作房間熏香的乾花瓣及葉子）
examples:
a bowl of potpourri
一碗百花香

blocks.def: an unusual or interesting mixture of things
examples:
Her new TV show will be a potpourri of arts and media reports.
她的新電視節目是藝術與媒體報道的混合體。

blocks.def: an offensive word
examples:
The old woman walked along the street muttering imprecations.
老婦沿街走著，嘴裡咕噥著罵人的話。

blocks.def: an idea or theory on which a statement or action is based
examples:
[ + that ] They had started with the premise that all men are created equal.
他們是從人人生而平等此一前提出發的。
 The research project is based on the premise stated earlier.
這項研究計劃是基於早先提出的假設之上的。

blocks.def: to base a theory, argument, etc. on an idea, thought, or belief
blocks.trans: 假定…為先決條件，作為…的前提
examples:
He premised his argument on several incorrect assumptions.
他把自己的論證建立在了幾個錯誤的假設之上。

blocks.def: a type of writing or acting that tries to make something serious seem stupid
