a type of theatre entertainment in the US in the late 19th and early 20th centuries that had funny acts and a striptease (= a performance in which someone removes their clothes)
blocks.trans: 滑稽歌舞雜劇（包含脫衣舞等，盛行於19世紀末至20世紀初的美國）

blocks.def: previous
involving women; female
examples:
Giro d'Italia femminile is the distaff version of the famed cycling race.
環義大利女子自行車賽是這項著名自行車比賽的女性版本。

blocks.def: female members of a family; especially used to talk about people related to someone through their mother
blocks.trans: （家族的）母系，女系；（群體中的）女性成員
examples:
In 1948 Joanna's grandmother on the distaff side won the title. 
1948年，瓊安娜的外祖母贏得了冠軍。

blocks.def: in the past, a stick onto which wool or flax (= fibre from a plant) was twisted for spinning (= making thread)
used to describe a person who easily becomes angry or annoyed, or their behaviour
examples:
He launched into a splenetic rant about his colleagues.
他開始對他的同事大發脾氣。

blocks.def: something that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without itself being changed
an event or person that causes great change
blocks.trans: 促成變化的人；引發變化的事件
examples:
The high suicide rate acted as a catalyst for change in the prison system.
高自殺率促成了監獄制度的改革。

blocks.def: relating to an archive of historical records or electronic documents
examples:
The documentary features hours of archival footage.
這個紀錄片提供了長達小時的歷史鏡頭。
 They need computer access to the archival material. 
他們需要獲準用電腦連線檢索該檔案材料。

blocks.def: a situation in which there is great confusion, violence, and destruction
examples:
The country is gradually being sucked into the maelstrom of civil war.
國家逐漸陷入內戰的大動亂之中。

blocks.def: an area of water that moves with a very strong circular movement and sucks in anything that goes past
never wrong, failing, or making a mistake
blocks.trans: 不可能錯誤的；永無過失的；不會犯錯誤的
examples:
Even the experts are not infallible.
即使是專家也會犯錯。

blocks.def: feeling worried about something that you are going to do or that is going to happen
blocks.trans: （對將要做的事情）擔憂的，擔心的
examples:
I'm very apprehensive about tomorrow's meeting.
想到明天的會議，我就有些惴惴不安。
 I've invited a lot of people to the party, but I'm a little apprehensive that no one will come.
我邀請了很多人來參加聚會，但我有些擔心，怕沒人會來。

blocks.def: authority given to a person to act for someone else, such as by voting for them in an election, or the person who this authority is given to
blocks.trans: （由個人委託的）代理人，代表；代理權；代表權
examples:
a proxy vote
代投的一票
 My brother's voting for me by proxy in the club elections.
在俱樂部選舉中，我弟弟代表我投票。
 Can I nominate someone as a proxy to sign for me?
我能提名某個人代表我簽字嗎？

blocks.def: to decay, producing a strong, unpleasant smell
examples:
the smell of putrefying flesh
腐肉的氣味
 The body had putrefied beyond recognition.
屍體已經腐爛得辨認不出來了。

blocks.def: a person who knows a lot about and enjoys one of the arts, or food, drink, etc. and can judge quality and skill in that subject
blocks.trans: （藝術品、食品、飲料等的）鑒賞家，鑒定家，行家
examples:
a wine/art connoisseur
葡萄酒／藝術鑒賞家
 a connoisseur of ballet/cigars
芭蕾舞／雪茄行家

blocks.def: a model or other object that represents someone, especially one of a hated person that is hanged or burned in a public place
blocks.trans: （尤指被憎恨人的）模擬像，雕像；畫像：
examples:
Crowds marched through the streets carrying burning effigies of the president.
示威群眾舉著燃燒的總統畫像沿街遊行。

blocks.def: able to produce a lot of crops, fruit, babies, young animals, etc.
blocks.trans: 多產的；肥沃的；生殖力旺盛的
examples:
fecund soil
肥沃的土壤

blocks.def: producing or creating a lot of new things, ideas, etc.
examples:
a fecund imagination
豐富的想像力

blocks.def: having very serious effects or causing great pain
blocks.trans: 極嚴重的，劇烈的；使人痛苦的，令人悲傷的
examples:
Her death is a grievous loss to the whole of the community.
她的去世是整個社區的重大損失。
 grievous wounds
重傷

blocks.def: a person who does bad or illegal things
the beginning
examples:
I told him at/from the outset I wasn't interested.
我從一開始就告訴他我沒興趣。

blocks.def: relating to a type of story in which the main character travels from place to place and has a series of adventures (= exciting experiences)
blocks.trans: （小說等）以流浪漢和無賴的冒險事蹟為題材的
examples:
a picaresque tale in which Kate travels all over North America looking for Mr. Right 
一個流浪冒險故事，故事中凱特走遍北美尋找自己的白馬王子

blocks.def: short, severe pains felt suddenly along a nerve, especially in the neck or head
to try to change or have an influence on things that are not your responsibility, especially by criticizing in a damaging or annoying way
examples:
My sister's always meddling in other people's affairs.
我姐姐總是愛管別人的閒事。
 People shouldn't meddle with things they don't understand.
自己不懂的事情，就不該管閒事。

blocks.def: someone who is fighting against the government in their own country
examples:
All approaches to the capital are now under the control of the insurgents.
所有通往首都的道路都被叛亂分子控制了。

blocks.def: someone who opposes political authority
relating to soldiers, war, or life in the armed forces
to prevent further disagreement in arguments or war by giving to the other side an advantage that they have demanded
examples:
She claimed that the government had only changed the law in order to appease their critics.
她稱政府修改法律僅僅是為了安撫那些批評政府的人。

blocks.def: to lose strength or purpose and stop, or almost stop
examples:
The dinner party conversation faltered for a moment.
晚宴上的談話出現了一刻冷場。
 Her friends never faltered in their belief in her.
她的朋友從未動搖過對她的信心。
 Nickie's voice faltered and he stopped speaking.
尼基的聲音顫抖了，他沒再繼續說下去。

blocks.def: to move awkwardly as if you might fall
examples:
The nurse saw him falter and made him lean on her.
護士見他站不穩，就讓他靠著自己。

blocks.def: careful and using a lot of effort
blocks.trans: 認真刻苦的，勤奮的，勤勞的
examples:
a diligent student
用功的學生
 Leo is very diligent in/about his work.
利奧工作非常勤奮。
 Their lawyer was extremely diligent in preparing their case.
律師為他們這個案子做了認真紮實的準備。

blocks.def: done in a careful and detailed way
examples:
The discovery was made after years of diligent research.
這一發現是數年潛心研究的成果。

blocks.def: a low continuous noise that does not change its note
examples:
the drone of an engine
引擎的轟鳴聲
 Outside the tent I could hear the constant drone of insects.
我能聽到帳篷外面昆蟲發出的持續不斷的嗡嗡聲。
 The drone of his voice made me feel sleepy.
他單調低沈的語調讓我昏昏欲睡。

blocks.def: an aircraft that does not have a pilot but is controlled by someone on the ground, used especially for dropping bombs or for surveillance (= careful watching of a place)
examples: The U. S. Border Patrol's unmanned drone helped agents track down their smuggling suspect.

blocks.def: a male bee
to make a low continuous noise that does not change its note
blocks.trans: 發出轟鳴聲；發出嗡嗡聲
examples:
An airplane droned in the background.
背景中響起了飛機的轟鳴聲。

blocks.def: A parenthetical remark is said in addition to the main part of what you are saying.
blocks.trans: 作為附帶說明的，作為附加註解的

blocks.def: A grating sound is unpleasant and annoying.
a structure made of metal bars that covers a hole, especially in the ground over a drain
not fair
examples:
The current healthcare system is inequitable and unjust, with huge disparities between rich and poor.
當前的醫療保健體系非常不公平，對待窮人和富人差距懸殊。

blocks.def: a very small amount of something
examples:
There's not a scintilla of truth in what he says.
他說話一點也不可信。

blocks.def: to remove your hat, usually to show respect
a small hammer that an official in charge of a meeting hits against a wooden block or table to get people to be quiet and listen
blocks.trans: （會議主席用來保持肅靜的）小木槌

blocks.def: very great admiration or respect for someone, often too great
examples:
The youngster makes no attempt to conceal his idolatry of his team-mate.
那個小夥子一點都沒掩蓋對隊友的崇拜。
 Newton was revered to the point of idolatry.
對牛頓的敬仰到了偶像崇拜的地步。

blocks.def: the act of praying to a picture or object as part of a religion
examples:
Father Brown considers the notes and flowers left near the statue to be close to idolatry.
布朗神父認為留在雕像旁邊的便簽和花束近乎對聖物的祈禱。

blocks.def: an official, formal, or long letter
examples:
She sent a ten-page missive to the committee, detailing her objections.
她向委員會發了一封十頁的公函，細述她的反對意見。

blocks.def: the very thin thread that spiders produce to make webs
very delicate and light
blocks.trans: 精巧輕盈的；輕薄精緻的
examples:
gossamer wings
輕盈的翅膀
 a gossamer veil
輕薄精緻的面紗

blocks.def: upset and confused
blocks.trans: 心煩意亂的；慌張的；緊張的
examples:

她似乎有點緊張。
 If I look flustered it's because I'm trying to do so many things at once.
如果我看上去很慌亂，那是因為我正試圖同時做很多件事情。

blocks.def: something that keeps or defends a belief or a way of life that is disappearing or threatened

British public schools are regarded as one of the last bastions of upper-class privilege.

blocks.def: a part of the wall of a castle that sticks out from it in order to protect it
blocks.trans: 棱堡（城堡和堡壘的突出部分）

blocks.def: to walk in a proud way trying to look important
blocks.trans: 趾高氣揚地走，昂首闊步
examples:
The boys strutted around trying to get the attention of a group of girls who were nearby.
男孩們神氣十足地走來走去，想引起旁邊一群女孩的注意。

blocks.def: a strong rod, usually made from metal or wood, that helps to hold something such as a vehicle or building together
to have a pause or rest during a formal meeting or trial
examples:
The meeting was adjourned until Tuesday.
會議延期至星期二。
 Shall we adjourn for lunch?
我們暫停先去吃午餐好嗎？

blocks.def: anger about a situation that you think is wrong or not fair
blocks.trans: （由錯誤或不公正的事激起的）憤怒，憤慨

blocks.def: a large building, especially an impressive one
blocks.trans: （尤指雄偉豪華的）大廈，宏偉建築
examples:
The town hall is the only edifice surviving from the 15th century.
市政廳是唯一一座存留下來的15世紀的雄偉建築。

blocks.def: a system that has been established for a long time
blocks.trans: 精神大廈（比喻存在已久的體系等）
examples:
It looks as if the whole political edifice of the country is about to collapse.
看來整個國家的政治局勢是風雨飄搖、大廈將傾。

blocks.def: clever, dishonest talk or behaviour that is used to deceive people
examples:
The investigation revealed political chicanery and corruption at the highest levels.
調查揭露了最高層的政治欺詐和腐敗。

blocks.def: a list of matters to be discussed at a meeting
examples:

會議議程中有幾項重要的議題。
 The question of security is high on the agenda for this afternoon's meeting.
今天下午的議程中，安全問題是首要議題。

blocks.def: a list of aims or possible future achievements
examples:
Women's rights have been put back on the agenda (= are being discussed publicly again).
婦女權益的問題再次得到廣泛關注。
 The subject of safety needs to be placed high on/at the top of the agenda (= must be discussed because it is very important).
必須首先考慮安全問題。
 Education was placed firmly on the political agenda in the prime minister's weekend speech.
在首相的週末演講中，教育問題明確地被提上政治日程。

blocks.def: a drug that contains opium, especially one that causes sleep
blocks.trans: （尤指用於安眠的）鴉片劑，麻醉劑

blocks.def: a typical or good example of something
examples:

這是那個時期的房屋典範。

blocks.def: existing as a natural or basic part of something
blocks.trans: 內在的；固有的，生來就有的
examples:

幾乎每種運動本身都帶有危險／風險。
 I have an inherent distrust of lawyers.
我生來對律師就有種不信任感。

blocks.def: to officially make something holy and able to be used for religious ceremonies
blocks.trans: 使聖化；把…奉爲神聖；給…祝聖
examples:
The new cathedral was completed and consecrated in 2002.
新的大教堂於2002年竣工並祝聖。

blocks.def: to officially give someone the title of bishop in the Christian Church in a religious ceremony
to include something as part of something larger
examples:
Suggestions from the survey have been incorporated into/in the final design.
調查中取得的建議已被納入最終的設計之中。
 This aircraft incorporates several new safety features.
這種飛機具有幾個新的安全功能。

blocks.def: agreement between people to act together secretly or illegally in order to deceive or cheat someone
examples:
It is thought that they worked in collusion with the terrorist network.
人們認為他們與恐怖主義網路有勾結。

blocks.def: a light wind
an illness of the colon (= part of the bowels) in which the contents of the bowels are passed out of the body too often
saying that you have particular moral beliefs but behaving in a way that shows these are not sincere
examples:
Their accusations of corruption are hypocritical - they have been just as corrupt themselves.
他們對貪腐的指控非常虛偽——他們自己也貪腐。

blocks.def: a priest of very high rank in the Roman Catholic Church
blocks.trans: （羅馬天主教會的）樞機主教，紅衣主教
examples:
Cardinals elect and advise the Pope.
樞機主教推選教宗並擔當教宗的顧問。

blocks.def: a number that represents amount, such as 1, 2, 3, rather than order, such as 1st, 2nd, 3rd
a North American bird, the male of which has bright red feathers
blocks.trans: 紅衣鳳頭鳥（見於北美，雄鳥有鮮紅色的羽毛）

blocks.def: of great importance
blocks.trans: 極重要的；基本的；主要的
examples:
a cardinal rule/error/sin
基本規則／根本錯誤／嚴重錯誤

blocks.def: not trying to hide your bad behaviour
examples:
That's a barefaced lie!
那是厚顏無恥的謊話！

blocks.def: the regular rise and fall of the voice
a set of chords (= different notes played together) at the end of a piece of music
to make someone feel slightly frightened or worried about their ability to achieve something
examples:
She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem.
她絲毫也沒有被問題的嚴重性嚇住。

blocks.def: having problems with digesting food
always angry or easily annoyed
brave
examples:
It was plucky of you to chase after the burglar.
你真有膽量，敢追趕竊賊。

blocks.def: willingness to please others by being polite and fitting in with their plans
medically clean or without infection
examples:
an aseptic wound/dressing/bandage
經過消毒的傷口／無菌敷料／無菌綳帶

blocks.def: the quality of being honest and telling the truth, especially about a difficult or embarrassing subject
blocks.trans: （尤指對棘手或難堪話題的）坦白，直率，坦誠
examples:
"We really don't know what to do about it," she said with surprising candour.
「我們確實不知道該如何應付，」她以令人吃驚的坦率說道。

blocks.def: delicate and easily broken
examples:
As you get older your bones become increasingly brittle.
隨著年齡增長，人的骨頭變得越來越脆。
 The pond was covered in a brittle layer of ice.
池塘上結了薄薄的一層冰。

blocks.def: unkind and unpleasant
examples:
She gave a brittle laugh and turned away.
她冷笑了一聲，轉身走了。

blocks.def: unpleasant and shocking
examples:
Today's newspaper gives all the ghastly details of the murder.
今天的報紙登出了謀殺案的全部細節，令人毛骨悚然。

blocks.def: extremely bad
examples:
What ghastly weather!
天氣太糟了！
 It was all a ghastly mistake.
這是極其嚴重的錯誤。
 I thought her outfit was ghastly.
我覺得她的套裝難看死了。

blocks.def: If someone looks ghastly, they look very ill or very shocked, especially with a very pale face.
blocks.trans: 一臉病容的；（由於驚嚇）面如死灰的；（尤指）面無血色的
examples:
You look ghastly - are you okay?
你臉色蒼白——你沒事吧？

blocks.def: to sit on or near the edge of something
blocks.trans: 坐在…（的邊緣）上；棲息於；停留於
examples:
We perched on bar stools and had a beer.
我們坐在酒吧高凳上，喝了一杯啤酒。
 A blackbird was perching on the gate.
一隻烏鶇停落在大門上。

blocks.def: to be in a high position or in a position near the edge of something, or to put something in this position
blocks.trans: （使）位於高處（或…的邊緣）；（使）棲息在高處（或…的邊緣）
examples:
The village is perched on top of a high hill.
村子坐落在一座高山的山頂上。

blocks.def: a fish that lives in lakes and rivers and is eaten as food
a place where a bird sits, especially a thin rod in a cage (= wire box)
blocks.trans: （鳥的）棲息處（尤指鳥籠裡的棲木）

blocks.def: a seat or other place high up, often giving a good view of something below
blocks.trans: （常指能很好地俯視低處的）高座，高處
examples:
We watched the parade from our perch on the scaffolding.
我們從鷹架的高處觀看遊行。

blocks.def: difficult to deal with and noisy
blocks.trans: 愛吵嚷的；喧鬧的；吵鬧不服管束的；難駕馭的
examples:
obstreperous customers
吵吵嚷嚷的顧客

blocks.def: to hang loosely, or to hold something so that it hangs loosely
blocks.trans: （使）垂下；（使）懸著，懸掛；提著來回擺動
examples:
Loose electric wires were dangling from the wall.
鬆散的電線從牆上垂下來。
 He dangled the puppet in front of the children.
他在孩子們面前玩木偶。

blocks.def: to offer someone something that they want in order to persuade that person to do something
blocks.trans: （為了說服某人去做某事而）用…作為承諾，答應用…作為回報
examples:
I've tried dangling all kinds of offers in front of him to get him to work harder at school, but nothing works.
為了讓他學習用心點，我曾試過種種承諾，可是根本不起任何作用。

blocks.def: to save goods from damage or destruction, especially from a ship that has sunk or been damaged or a building that has been damaged by fire or a flood
blocks.trans: （尤指從失事船隻、火災或水災中）搶救，打撈
examples:
gold coins salvaged from a shipwreck
從船隻殘骸中打撈出的金幣
 After the fire, there wasn't much furniture left worth salvaging.
火災之後，沒有剩下多少值得搶救的傢俱。

blocks.def: to try to make a bad situation better
examples:
It was a desperate attempt to salvage the situation.
挽回這種局面的希望渺茫。
 After the fraud scandal he had to make great efforts to salvage his reputation.
詐騙醜聞傳出後，他不得不極力挽回自己的聲譽。

blocks.def: an illegal copy of a document, painting, etc. or the crime of making such illegal copies
examples:
These banknotes are forgeries.
這些鈔票是偽造的。
 He increased his income by forgery.
他透過製售偽造品來增加收入。

blocks.def: a person who considers himself or herself to be better or more important than other people
blocks.trans: 自我主義者；自高自大者
examples:
Politicians are notorious egotists.
政客們是一幫惡名昭彰的自我主義者。

blocks.def: a quick and often angry or humorous answer
examples:
She always has a witty rejoinder to/for any question.
任何問題她總能機敏詼諧地應對。

blocks.def: a person who knows a lot about a particular subject and is therefore often asked to give an opinion about it
examples:
a political/foreign-policy/sports pundit
政治／外交政策／體育權威

blocks.def:
→ 
pandit
someone or something existing or happening before, especially as the cause or origin of something existing or happening later
blocks.trans: （尤指作為後來存在或發生之事的起因或起源的）前事，前情，先例；祖先
examples:
Charles Babbage's mechanical calculating engines were the antecedents of the modern computer.
查爾斯‧巴貝奇的機械電腦是現代電腦的前身。 
Many people feel a great curiosity to find out about their antecedents.
很多人對於他們的祖先充滿了好奇，很想探究一番。

blocks.def: a word or phrase that a pronoun refers back to
examples:
In the sentence "He picked a book off the shelf and handed it to Sally", "book" is the antecedent of "it".
在句子 He picked a book off the shelf and handed it to Sally 中，book 是 it 的先行詞。

blocks.def: previous
blocks.trans: （同頁中）上面提到的；上文的，前文的
examples:
When the college was established in 1546, it inherited a hall from each of three antecedent institutions.
該學院在1546年建立時，從作為其前身的三個機構中分別承繼了一座教學大樓。

blocks.def: to be unable to make a decision about doing something
examples:
Stop dithering and choose which one you want!
別猶豫了，趕快決定你想要哪個！
 She's still dithering over whether to accept the job she's just been offered.
她還在猶豫要不要接受剛剛給她的那份工作。

blocks.def: to be very nervous, excited, or confused about something
blocks.trans: 對…感到緊張（或激動、困惑等）
examples:
Gideon is in a bit of a dither about what to wear for the interview.
吉迪恩緊張得有些不知穿甚麽衣服去參加面試才好。

blocks.def: an act or event that is clearly false
blocks.trans: 顯而易見的作假；明顯的偽裝
examples:
Everyone knew who was going to get the job from the start - the interviews were just a charade.
大家從一開始就知道誰會得到這份工作——面試不過是做個樣子而已。

blocks.def: a team game in which each member tries to communicate to the others a particular word or phrase that they have been given, by expressing each syllable or word using silent actions
a thin, flat piece of cut wood or other hard material, often used for a particular purpose
blocks.trans: （有特定用途的）薄木板；板；牌子
examples:
Cut the vegetables on a chopping (US cutting) board.
在砧板上切菜。
 There was a "For Sale" board outside the house.
房子外有一塊「待售」牌。

blocks.def: a flat piece of wood or other hard material with a special pattern on it, used for playing games
examples:
a chess board
西洋棋棋盤

blocks.def:
a 
blackboard  or 
whiteboard
examples:
The teacher wrote her name up on the board.
老師在黑板上寫下了她的名字。

blocks.def:
a 
noticeboard UK
examples:
I stuck the notice (up) on the board.
我把通知貼在了公告欄上。

blocks.def:
a 
diving board
examples:
I dived off the top board today, Dad.
爸爸，我今天是從最高的跳板跳水的。

blocks.def: the wooden fence surrounding the ice surface in ice hockey
the stage in a theatre
the group of people who are responsible for controlling and organizing a company or organization
examples:
Every decision has to be approved by the board (of directors).
每項決定都必須由董事會通過。
 She started in the firm after college and now she's on the board/a board member.
她大學畢業以後開始在這間公司工作，現在已經是董事會成員了。
UK The board of governors meet/meets once a month to discuss school policy.
學校董事會每月集會一次討論學校政策。

blocks.def: an official examination given by some medical and business organizations in the US
blocks.trans: （美國某些醫療、商業組織舉行的）執業考試
examples:
This is my last chance to pass the boards.
這是我最後一次通過執業考試的機會了。

blocks.def: on a boat, train, or aircraft
examples:
As soon as I was on board, I began to have second thoughts about leaving.
我一上車就開始動搖要不要走了。

blocks.def: meals provided when you are staying somewhere, usually for money
blocks.trans: （住宿處提供的）伙食，膳食（通常需付費）

blocks.def: to get onto or allow people to get onto a boat, train, or aircraft
examples:
At London airport she boarded a plane to Australia.
在倫敦機場她登上了去澳大利亞的飛機。
 Will passengers waiting to board please go to the ticket counter?
請各位候機的旅客去驗票口。

blocks.def: to pay to sleep and eat meals in someone's house
examples:
During his stay in England he boarded with a family in Bath.
他在英國逗留期間寄宿在巴斯的一戶人家。

blocks.def: to sleep and eat at school during the school term
examples:
When you went to school were you a day student or did you board?
你上學時是通勤還是住校？

blocks.def: to arrange for a pet animal to be temporarily taken care of at a place other than its home
blocks.trans: 將（寵物）暫時寄養在他處
examples:
He boards the dog out when he goes on business trips.
他出差時把狗寄養在別處。

blocks.def: relating to a philosophy (= system of ideas) according to which the world has no meaning and each person is alone and completely responsible for his or her own actions
examples:
an existential argument/philosopher
存在主義的論點/哲學家
 a novel of existential dread
一本存在主義荒謬性的小說

blocks.def: wet, dirty, and untidy
to join or unite to form a larger organization or group, or to make separate organizations do this
examples:
The electricians' union is planning to amalgamate with the technicians' union.
電工工會正計劃與技工工會合併。
 The different offices will be amalgamated as/into employment advice centres.
這幾家不同的事務所將合併成為就業指導中心。

blocks.def: to plan secretly with other people to do something bad, illegal, or against someone's wishes
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] He felt that his colleagues were conspiring together to remove him from his job.
他覺得同事們在密謀把他從工作崗位上擠走。
 As girls, the sisters used to conspire with each other against their brother.
還是小女孩的時候，姐妹倆常常在一起密謀對付她們的哥哥。

blocks.def: to leave a country permanently and go to live in another one
examples:
Millions of Germans emigrated from Europe to America in the 19th century.
在19世紀，數百萬的德國人從歐洲移民到了美國。
 Thousands of Britons emigrate every year.
每年有數以千計的英國人移居國外。

blocks.def: willingness to believe that something is real or true, especially when this is unlikely
to delay something until a later time
examples:
My bank has agreed to defer the repayments on my loan.
銀行同意讓我延緩償還貸款。
 [ + -ing verb ] Can we defer making a decision until next week?
我們可以延緩到下週再決定嗎？

blocks.def: a large crack in the ground or in rock
examples:
The stream had cut a deep rift in the rock.
溪流在岩石上沖刷出一條很深的溝。

blocks.def: a serious disagreement that separates two people who have been friends and stops their friendship continuing
examples:
The marriage caused a rift between the brothers and they didn't speak to each other for ten years.
這樁婚姻致使兄弟之間的關係出現裂痕，彼此十年都沒有說話。

blocks.def: physical or mental tiredness
examples:
Shareholders are blaming the company's problems on the lassitude of the CEO.
股東們將公司出現的問題歸咎於執行長工作懈怠。

blocks.def: to move slowly and awkwardly
examples:
In the distance, we could see a herd of elephants lumbering across the plain.
我們可以看見遠處有一群大象緩緩穿過平原。

blocks.def: wood that has been prepared for building
to drink liquid so that you stop being thirsty
examples:
When it's hot, it's best to quench your thirst with water.
大熱天裡最好喝水解渴。

blocks.def: to use water to put out a fire
examples:
The flames were quenched by heavy rain.
大雨淋熄了熊熊的烈火。

blocks.def: to satisfy a need or wish
examples:
Her thirst for knowledge will never be quenched.
她的求知慾是永無止境的。

blocks.def: boring, especially in appearance; having little colour and excitement
blocks.trans: （尤指外表）單調的，乏味的，缺乏色彩的，平淡的
examples:
She walked through the city centre with its drab, grey buildings and felt depressed.
走過市中心那些單調的灰色建築物，她心裡感覺很壓抑。
 I feel so drab in this grey uniform.
穿這套灰色制服我覺得很沒生氣。

blocks.def: to put right a wrong or give payment for a wrong that has been done
blocks.trans: 糾正，矯正；補償，向…賠償損失
examples:
Most managers, politicians and bosses are men - how can women redress the balance (= make the situation fairer and more equal)?
大多數的經理、政治家和老闆都是男性——女性怎樣才能改變這種不平衡的狀況呢？

blocks.def: money that you have to pay to someone else because you have injured that person or treated them badly
blocks.trans: （對傷害或虐待所致損失的）賠償，賠款
examples:
He went to the industrial tribunal to seek redress for the way his employers had discriminated against him.
因為僱主對他有所歧視，他走上了勞資仲裁法庭為自己討回公道。

blocks.def: (of actions and behaviour) deserving praise, even if there is little or no success
blocks.trans: （行為）值得讚揚的，值得稱讚的
examples:
a laudable goal/ambition
值得讚揚的目標／雄心
 The recycling programme is laudable, but does it save much money?
這項回收計劃值得稱道，不過它能節省許多資金嗎?

blocks.def: speaking or spoken in a confident way, but without careful thought or honesty
blocks.trans: 花言巧語的，油嘴滑舌的；（說話）不誠懇的，未經思考的
examples:
He's a glib, self-centred man.
他是個油嘴滑舌、自私自利的人。
 No one was convinced by his glib answers/explanations.
沒有人相信他那信口開河的回答／解釋。

blocks.def: a possession or piece of property that is considered to be a typical feature of a particular way of living
blocks.trans: （典型反映某種生活方式的）所有物，生活物品
examples:
Books and laptops are among the appurtenances of student life.
書和筆記型電腦等都是學生生活的標誌性物品。

blocks.def: relating to or like bears
the organs inside an animal, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, eaten as food
blocks.trans: （可食用的）動物內臟，下水，雜碎

blocks.def: If you become inured to something unpleasant, you become familiar with it and able to accept and bear it.
blocks.trans: 使（某人）習慣於（令人不快的事物）
examples:
After spending some time on the island they became inured to the hardships.
在島上留了一段時間後，他們適應了那裡的艱苦生活。

blocks.def: to make someone famous, or to treat someone as if they were famous
To edify is to help someone understand
examples: Books that edify those who want to learn a new language, or the explanations that hang beside paintings at a museum that edify visitors who aren't familiar with the artist.

blocks.def: to reduce the bad effects of something
examples:
They tried to palliate the hardship of their lives.
他們試圖緩解生活的艱難。

blocks.def: to reduce pain without curing its cause
blocks.trans: 緩解痛苦（但無法治癒病因）
examples:
The drugs palliate pain but have no effect on inflammation.
這些藥品可減輕痛苦但對炎症沒有效果。

blocks.def: specially made for a particular person
examples:
a bespoke suit
訂做的西服
 bespoke furniture
訂做的傢俱

blocks.def: to perform an examination on a chemical in order to test how pure it is
blocks.trans: 鑒定，化驗，分析（化學物質的純度）

blocks.def: statements, especially on religious or moral subjects, that are not sincerely believed by the person making them
blocks.trans: （尤指關於宗教或道德話題的）假話，空話，偽善言語
examples:
Shelley's friendship with Byron was rooted in their shared contempt for cant and hypocrisy.
雪萊和拜倫的友誼源於他們均蔑視假話空話和偽善行為。

blocks.def: special words used by a particular group of people such as thieves, lawyers, or priests, often in order to keep things secret
to change from liquid to a more solid state, or to cause something to do this
examples:
The sauce coagulated as it cooled down.
醬汁變冷後凝固了。
 The venom of this snake coagulates the blood.
這條蛇的毒液使血液凝結了。

blocks.def: suggested but not communicated directly
examples:
He interpreted her comments as an implicit criticism of the government.
他將她的評論理解為對政府的含蓄批評。
 Implicit in the poem's closing lines are the poet's own religious doubts.
在這首詩最後幾行中隱含著詩人自己的宗教疑慮。

blocks.def: complete and without any doubts
examples:
implicit trust
絕對的信任
 All her life she had implicit faith in socialism.
她一生都對社會主義堅信不疑。

blocks.def: deserving to be blamed or considered responsible for something bad
blocks.trans: 應受譴責的；該受處罰的；該對錯誤負責的
examples:
He was held culpable (= blamed) for all that had happened.
他被認為應該為所發生的一切負責。

blocks.def: a small, very thin rubber bag that you blow air into or fill with a light gas until it is round in shape, used for decoration at parties or as a children's toy
examples:
We tied balloons and streamers to the ceiling ready for the party.
我們把氣球和彩帶繫在天花板上，晚會的佈置已準備妥當。

blocks.def: a very large balloon that is filled with hot air or gas and can carry people in a basket (= open container ) hanging under it
examples:
People first flew in a balloon in 1783.
人類於1783年首次乘熱氣球飛行。

blocks.def:
a 
speech bubble
to get bigger and rounder
examples:
I ballooned when I was pregnant with my second baby.
懷第二個孩子時，我胖得像個氣球。

blocks.def: to quickly increase in size, weight, or importance
blocks.trans: （在大小、重量或重要性上）激增
examples:
The rumours soon ballooned into a full-blown scandal.
這些傳聞不久就完全演變成了一件醜聞。

blocks.def: arguing and complaining a lot
examples:
He's getting a bit cantankerous in his old age.
他上了年紀，變得有些愛吵嘴還老抱怨。

blocks.def: to take away money or property especially for public use without payment to the owner, or for personal use illegally
blocks.trans: （尤指無償充公）徵用，沒收；（尤指個人非法）侵佔，把…據為己有
examples:
He was discovered to have been expropriating company funds.
他被發現一直在侵吞公司資金。

blocks.def: smelling unpleasantly old and slightly wet
examples:
musty old books
發黴的舊書
 a musty smell
黴味
 a musty room
有黴味的房間

blocks.def: to remove your clothes, especially an outer or formal piece of clothing worn for ceremonies
blocks.trans: 脫外衣，脫外套（尤指禮服）

blocks.def: awkward in movement or manner
examples:
The first mobile phones were heavy and clumsy to use, but nowadays they are much easier to handle.
第一代手機用起來很笨重，而現在的手機就輕便多了。
 My attempts to apologize were very clumsy (= not said well).
我想道歉，卻拙嘴笨舌的。

blocks.def: A clumsy person often has accidents because they do not behave in a careful, controlled way.
examples:
That's the third glass you've smashed this week - you're so clumsy!
這已經是你這個星期打破的第三隻杯子了——真是太笨了！

blocks.def: If an event or series of events culminates in something, it ends with it, having developed until it reaches this point.
examples:
My arguments with the boss got worse and worse, and finally culminated in my resignation.
我和老闆的爭吵日益惡化，直到最終我決定換工作。
 Their many years of research have finally culminated in a cure for the disease.
經過多年研究，他們終於開發出一種能治癒該病的藥物。

blocks.def: the process of releasing strong emotions through a particular activity or experience, such as writing or theatre, in a way that helps you to understand those emotions
blocks.trans: 情感宣洩，精神淨化（如透過寫作、戲劇等活動或經歷）

blocks.def: unhappy, annoyed, and unwilling to speak or smile
blocks.trans: 陰鬱的；脾氣不好的；孤僻的
examples:
a morose expression
陰鬱的表情
 Why are you so morose these days?
你這幾天為甚麼總是悶悶不樂？

blocks.def: to knock or push roughly against someone in order to move past them or get more space when you are in a crowd of people
examples:
As we came into the arena, we were jostled by fans pushing their way towards the stage.
我們進入場內時，被湧向舞臺的歌迷左推右撞。
 Photographers jostled and shoved to get a better view of the royal couple.
一群攝影師互相推撞，以便更清楚地拍到這對王室夫婦。

blocks.def: the quality of being easily annoyed and complaining in a rude way like a child
examples:
I have never witnessesed such a display of childish petulance.
我從未見過如此幼稚的任性行爲。
 Displaying a mixture of petulance and arrogance, he refuses to listen to objections.
他的行爲既暴躁又傲慢，拒絕聽取反對意見。

blocks.def: the act of continuing to commit crimes even after having been punished
blocks.trans: 犯罪判刑後又犯新罪的行為，屢犯
examples:
This program is aimed at reducing recidivism.
該計劃旨在減少屢犯行為。
 Recidivism rates are 25 percent lower for offenders who get structured treatment.
接受結構化治療的罪犯刑滿犯新罪的情況較一般屢犯的發生率要少百分之二十五。

blocks.def: (a state of having) pleasant dream-like thoughts
examples:
He was lost in reverie until he suddenly heard someone behind him.
他陷入了沉思，直到突然聽到背後有人。

blocks.def: quick in noticing, understanding, or judging things accurately
blocks.trans: 聰穎的；敏銳的；有洞察力的
examples:
His perspicacious grandfather had bought the land as an investment, guessing that there might be gold underground.
他睿智的祖父投資買下了這塊地，認為地下可能有黃金。

blocks.def: to walk taking slow steps, as if your feet are heavy
blocks.trans: 艱難地行走；吃力地行進
examples:
We plodded through the mud.
我們在泥濘中艱難行進。
 Despite the wind and the rain, they plodded on until they reached the cabin.
他們頂風冒雨堅持走到了小屋。

blocks.def: to work slowly and continuously, but without imagination, enthusiasm, or interest
blocks.trans: （缺乏想像力、熱情和興趣地）埋頭工作
examples:
For years, he's plodded away at the same dull routine job.
多年來，他一直在做同一項單調的工作。
 Alex is just plodding along at school, making very little progress.
亞力克斯一直在校苦學，但幾乎沒有甚麼進步。

blocks.def: to confuse and worry someone slightly by being difficult to understand or solve
examples:
The disease has continued to perplex doctors.
這種疾病仍然困擾著醫生。

blocks.def: a large group of people standing very close to each other, usually for the purposes of defence or attack
blocks.trans: 密集的人群，方陣（通常以防禦或攻擊為目的）
examples:
Bodyguards formed a solid phalanx around the singer so that photographers couldn't get close.
保鏢在歌手周圍形成密集的人牆，阻止攝影師靠近。

blocks.def: any one of the small bones of the fingers and toes
examples:
There are fourteen phalanges in the hand.
手上共有14快指骨。

blocks.def: of or expressing sexual desire
examples:
The opera centres around the amorous adventures/exploits of its handsome hero.
這部歌劇以英俊的男主角的艷遇為主線。
 Amanda had rejected his amorous advances.
阿曼達拒絕了他的求愛。

blocks.def: causing so much emotion, especially pleasure, that it cannot be described
blocks.trans: （尤指喜悅）言語難以表達的，不可言喻的
examples:
ineffable joy/beauty
難以言喻的喜悅／美麗

blocks.def: relating to pigs
examples:
porcine viruses
豬病毒

blocks.def: like a pig
blocks.trans: 像豬的；肥豬似的；蠢豬似的
examples:
his porcine features
他蠢豬似的樣子 
a porcine grunt
發出豬一樣的咕嚕聲

blocks.def: to pronounce words or parts of words clearly
blocks.trans: 清楚地念（字）；清晰地發（音）
examples:
He doesn't enunciate (his words) very clearly.
他（說話）發音不是太清晰。

blocks.def: to express and explain a plan or principle clearly or formally
examples:
In the speech, the leader enunciated his party's proposals for tax reform.
在演講中，這位領導人闡明了該政黨的稅收改革計劃。

blocks.def: (of speech, writing, style, etc.) too serious about its subject matter; boring
blocks.trans: （講話、寫作、風格等）太嚴肅的，枯燥乏味的
examples:
a couple of pages of turgid prose
幾頁枯燥乏味的散文

blocks.def: (of water) not flowing easily
examples:
The river rolled darkly brown and turgid.
河水流動不暢，翻著濁黃浪花。

blocks.def: (of an organ or living tissue) swollen
blocks.trans: （器官或生物組織）腫大的，腫脹的，膨脹的

blocks.def: Menial work is boring, makes you feel tired, and is given a low social value.
blocks.trans: （工作）乏味的，低賤的，不體面的
examples:
It's fairly menial work, such as washing dishes and cleaning floors.
都是些很枯燥乏味的工作，如洗碗和擦地。
 a menial job/task
粗活

blocks.def: a state that does not change
examples:
She was bored - her life was in stasis.
她厭倦極了——她的生活像一潭死水。

blocks.def: a long list of complaints or problems
examples:
The critic delivers regular jeremiads against the contemporary art world.
這位評論家定期發表對當代藝術界的哀歎。

blocks.def: too sweet and therefore unpleasant
examples:
This is a wonderful wine - honeyed and rich without being remotely cloying.
這酒真棒——甘甜醇香，一點都不膩。

blocks.def: too good or kind, or expressing feelings of love in a way that is not sincere
blocks.trans: 令人膩煩的；膩味的；假惺惺的
examples:
She criticized the cloying sentimentality of the film.
她批評這部電影太過多愁善感，令人膩煩。

blocks.def: to be too bad to be improved or saved by anyone
blocks.trans: 無可挽回；無可補救；不可救藥

blocks.def: (especially in Christianity) an occasion when someone is saved from evil, suffering, etc.
blocks.trans: （尤指基督教的）拯救，贖罪，救贖

blocks.def: the act of exchanging bonds, shares, etc. for money
examples:
The bonds will be redeemed at 100% of their principal amount, plus interest to the redemption date.
在贖取之日，憑債券可贖取全部本金，加上到期的利息。

blocks.def: (especially in Christianity) giving someone redemption
blocks.trans: （尤指基督教的）救贖的；拯救的

blocks.def: a person sent by one government or political leader to another to take messages or to take part in discussions
examples:
He flew to China as the personal emissary of the President.
他以首相的私人特使的身份搭機前往中國。

blocks.def: to follow a different direction, or to be or become different
blocks.trans: （道路）分叉；出現差異；發生分歧
examples:
They walked along the road together until they reached the village, but then their paths diverged.
他們一直沿著那條路走到那個村子，然後才分開。
 Although the two organizations have worked together for many years, their objectives have diverged recently.
雖然這兩個組織在一起合作了很多年，但它們的目標近來出現了分歧。

blocks.def: a very wrong and unfair action or situation
examples:
They fought long and hard against the iniquities of apartheid.
他們為反抗不公正的種族隔離進行了長期艱苦的鬥爭。
 The writer reflects on human injustice and iniquity.
這位作家探討了人類的不公正與邪惡。

blocks.def: an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that grows in cooler areas of the world
examples:
a plantation of pines
人工松林
 a pine forest
松林

blocks.def: the wood of pine trees, usually pale in colour
examples:
pine furniture
松木傢俱
 Pine is a softwood.
松木是一種軟木。

blocks.def: to become increasingly thin and weak because of unhappiness, especially after the death of a loved person
blocks.trans: （尤指因深愛的人死去而）形容枯槁，憔悴
examples:
Carter died in 1904 after an accident and Leno pined away and died six months later.
1904年卡特死於非命，萊諾日漸憔悴，六個月後也去世了。

blocks.def: the separation or falling off of part of a plant
examples:
The flower buds and immature fruit frequently drop off; researchers have tried to determine the role growth hormones play in this abscission.
花蕾和未成熟的果實頻頻掉落；研究人員已經試圖從生長激素方面尋找脫落原因。

blocks.def: a short interruption in a war or argument, or an agreement to stop fighting or arguing for a period of time
blocks.trans: 講和（協議）；休戰，停戰（協定）
examples:
After years of rivalry the two companies have agreed (US agreed to) a truce.
經過多年的競爭，兩家公司同意握手言和。
 We've got to spend the weekend together, so we might as well call (= have) a truce.
我們必須在一起過週末，所以最好還是講和。
 Following last month's riots, two of the city's biggest gangs have finally declared a truce, ending years of bloodshed.
上個月火拼之後，這座城市的兩大幫派最終宣佈停戰，從而結束了多年的殺戮。
 The fragile truce between the two sides is not expected to last long.
預計雙方脆弱的停戰協定不會持久。

blocks.def: strong and sincere beliefs
examples:
The country was swept by patriotic fervour.
全國各地愛國情緒高漲。
 nationalist/religious fervour
民族主義熱情／宗教狂熱

blocks.def: extremely worried, nervous, or upset
blocks.trans: 極其不安的，非常焦慮的
examples:
The missing child's distraught parents made an emotional appeal for information on TV.
失蹤兒童的父母極爲焦慮，在電視上懇請大家提供相關消息。

blocks.def: famous, respected, or important
examples:
an eminent historian
聲名顯赫的歷史學家

blocks.def: to make someone a member of the nobility (= highest social rank)
to make something or someone better so that people admire it, him, or her more
blocks.trans: 使更崇高，使更高尚；使更尊貴
examples:
He has this theory that suffering can ennoble a person's character.
他認爲苦難可以使一個人的人格變得高尚。

blocks.def: to argue about, or say you disapprove of, something that is not important
blocks.trans: 吹毛求疵，為小事而爭吵
examples:
There's no point quibbling about/over a couple of dollars.
為幾塊錢而吵架毫無意義。

blocks.def: a complaint or criticism about something that is not very important
examples:
My only quibble is that the colour isn't very nice.
我唯一不太滿意的是顏色不太好。

blocks.def: the difficulties of a situation, especially one that causes urgent demands
examples:
the exigencies of war
戰爭的緊要關頭
 Economic exigency obliged the government to act.
經濟形勢岌岌可危，政府被迫採取行動。

blocks.def: the state of being morally bad, or an action that is morally bad
an organized attempt by a group of people to defeat their government and take control of their country, usually by violence
examples:
armed insurrection
武裝暴動

blocks.def: having a pattern of different colours or marks
examples:
variegated leaves
斑葉
 a variegated plant
色彩斑駁的植物

blocks.def: extremely great in ability, amount, or strength
examples:
She wrote a truly prodigious number of novels.
她寫了數量極多的小說。
 She was a prodigious musician.
她是一位不同凡響的音樂家。
 He had a prodigious appetite for both women and drink.
他對女人和酒有著強烈的欲望。

blocks.def: to feel or express great pleasure or satisfaction because of your own success or good luck, or someone else's failure or bad luck
blocks.trans: （因自己的成功或好運而）沾沾自喜；（因別人的失敗或壞運而）幸災樂禍
examples:
She's continually gloating over/about her new job.
她一直在為獲得新工作而沾沾自喜。
 I know I shouldn't gloat, but it really serves him right.
我知道自己不應該幸災樂禍，可他真是活該。
 His enemies were quick to gloat at his humiliation.
看到他受辱，他的死對頭乘機幸災樂禍。
 [ + speech ] "This is our fourth victory in a row," he gloated.
「這是我們連續第四場獲勝了，」他洋洋得意地說。

blocks.def: an occasion when you gloat about something
examples:
to have a gloat at/over/about something
對某事洋洋得意（或幸災樂禍）

blocks.def: to speak in a way that is intentionally not clear and confusing to other people, especially to hide the truth
blocks.trans: （尤指爲隱瞞真相而）說模稜兩可的話，含糊其詞
examples:
She accused the minister of equivocating, claiming that he had deliberately avoided telling the public how bad the problem really was.
她指責部長含糊其詞，稱他故意不讓大眾知道問題真正嚴重到了甚麽地步。

blocks.def: Grandiloquent language or behavior is very formal, literary, or exaggerated, and is used by people when they want to seem important
To flinch is to react to pain by wincing, pulling away, or cringing. Often it's used to describe a person who shows a moment of weakness or fright
examples: he was so tough, I thought he'd never flinch, but snakes really freak him out.

blocks.def: An archetypal thing represents an original type after which other, similar things are patterned.
examples: With her green skin, black garb, and evil ways, the Wicked Witch of the West is an archetypal villain.

blocks.def: If something's made of wood, or looks like it is, it's ligneous.
examples: A tree is a ligneous plant. A stiff politician is a ligneous person.

blocks.def: Have you ever pretended to be sick or hurt to get out of taking a test or doing a chore? Then you, my dear, are a malingerer, and should be ashamed of yourself. Shape up!
When soldiers debouch, they march out of a very narrow space. Troops might debouch out of a long pass between mountains, for example.
The adjective irenic describes something that is peaceful.
examples: Although you and your sister constantly fought as young children, your relationship might become more irenic as you grow older.

blocks.def: Something that's farcical is ridiculously funny
examples: When you stumbled onstage, tripping over your costume and pulling down the backdrop, you brought a farcical element to the serious play.

blocks.def: Something that's odoriferous carries a smell.
examples: When you hear someone use the word odoriferous, just hope they're not referring to your breath or armpits.

blocks.def: encyclopedia
suggest that someone is guilty
examples: We could see the president substantially exonerated, we could see him inculpated by has associates.

blocks.def: If a field is plowed into furrows, it's striated
the act of exhorting; an earnest attempt at persuasion
examples: When you were little, heading out the door on a freezing cold day, your mom probably made an exhortation to put on your hat and zip your coat up all the way.

blocks.def: Acrimony is bitterness, or ill will. Acrimony is a spiteful word. It sounds bitter, like acid.
